Q0Rh57n8eI_EcFoWo6-hkA.text: The food was awesome, loved my tacos, queso, and guac! Unfortunately, the reason I am giving this review three stars is because of the service. I called ahead to see what time Condado was open until, assuming they may have early closing hours on a Sunday but they said they were open until 2 am. Our server had a bad attitude and rushed us the entire time. We wanted to stay and order more drinks but she cleared our table, which still had chips and a full bowl of queso on it. She then immediately gave us our checks after serving us another round. We wanted to continue drinking our drinks when she continued to look over to see if we paid. It was really uncomfortable and put us in bad moods before we went to a concert. Before leaving, I asked again if they closed earlier on Sundays and they indicated that "they closed early upstairs if there were not many customers." There were probably 15+ people upstairs when we were there. We would have for sure sat downstairs if we knew this prior! Delicious food, but Pitt Condado employees need to have kinder and more patient attitudes.

Bdd8oV9n6YzKI83oYJWCdg.text: These tacos as so good. And the quest and chips are a perfect blend of cheese and seasoning.

ifV-vK__DAEfWz9dKaF8WA.text: Service is top notch! We came here for happy hour and to celebrate a friend's birthday. The staff was extremely nice and accommodating. They helped us hide the cake and even served it when the time was right. This place gets extremely crowded during happy hour so people were bumping against us the whole time. The food was pretty decent. We got a couple of dips to sample and my favorite one was the corn. The tacos were good and I like the concept that you can build your own. The only thing that disappointed me was that they didn't have a non spicy steak taco. Definitely try the margaritas!! Salud!

v3ZQJWepAD5zNVsvulDDHA.text: The tacos were good but the chips were chewy... great staff.... my daughter is very happy because of the vegetarian options though

6RCENpxDpyiw-ksHhNzjFA.text: This place deserves all the stars. Not much to say other than Condado has the best tacos I've ever had. Also recommended the guacamole and queso with chips. Don't just walk there, run.

Q9MpY63C2aZg9KeFV7c2Tw.text: Location: Liberty & Tenth. Good for convention goers, pre-game cultural district show or exploring lunch breakers. Pittsburgh is starting to fill in the Historic District and I can dig it.   Restaurant: It's small but hip. Wall art is postmodern Dia de los Muertos style. It's artsy and fun. They have both a custom taco option or you can opt into their already developed creations. The price point is kind of what threw me. It's located downtown but I like my taco's cheap. It's more artisan and edgy than I was looking for but I'm game for anything.   Food/Drink: I got 3 tacos that they designed. They were all completely different in flavor. The drink list is extensive and enjoyable.   Experience: I was here for lunch break and in a hurry. This place is not tailored to a quick lunch yet, but they are new and I'm sure they will get there. It's a great spot for a quick bite of adventure and a solid drink before you begin your evening adventures.

8uJZleV8T3HSwJEit5cBDw.text: Love the concept of Building your own taco! the staff is friendly and the atmosphere is very lively!

HkcoTuybjDVgABXouAG2_A.text: Condado is hands down my favorite place to get tacos. The build your own menu offers a lot of unique and delicious choices. Along with that, the price is fantastic. The atmosphere is cool as well. Great customer service, great food, great drinks. Highly recommend!

t9pg47fKtQj9Dm_-N8Zytg.text: Can't say enough good things about this place. Chips, salsa, guacamole, queso, and TACOS are TO DIE FOR. I've heard their "dirty sauce" is legit one of the spiciest around and their drinks are strong, but I can't attest to that. I ordered hard shell tacos and boy was I salivating for more. I can't wait to bring my boyfriend here so he can go to taco heaven. I also really love the atmosphere: exposed brick, cool ass artwork everywhere, and industrial vibes with the dark wooden tables.  I made my own tacos but they also have suggested tacos for you to choose from.

Nqp7zJg-HKzhgNbUWVLteQ.text: I'm sure we caught them on an off night, and we understand our server was extremely overwhelmed, but we had an absolutely awful time at Condado. We got there at 7:15 and were told there were four parties ahead of us, but they could not give us any estimated wait time. By 8 we checked in again to hear there were two parties ahead of us, but we did not actually sit down until 9pm. When we arrived we were told that they were out of all tortillas except for soft flour tortillas. While we understand this happens, this would have been nice to know when we arrived two hours prior. After telling the server we were upset, she brought the manager up who apologized for the food shortage and provided us with free dips (which was very nice and the only reason for the two stars in this review). When our tacos finally came out, the tortillas were cold and extremely soggy. My chorizo was also cold on the inside. Surprisingly, someone in my party received crunchy corn tortillas, so we aren't sure what happened there. Lastly, there were problems with our bill being split correctly. Our server was apologetic, but we still would not recommend going to dinner on a weekend here to anyone.

QCC_-UR6msw-DrWrdn6ITA.text: This place was a little disappointing after hearing good reviews.   My girlfriend and I came for Happy Hour and an early dinner. We were sat upstairs only to find out that Happy Hour deals are only offered downstairs. Not a good start. We started with chips and the chorizo queso. This was the best part of the meal. The chips are house made and the queso had tons of chorizo! Delicious. That was about the end of delicious. We made our own tacos which is such a cool, fun idea. I got a brisket taco and a pulled pork taco. The soft shell came right out of a bag from a grocery store which was a little disappointing. The meats were both unseasoned and bland and the brisket was very dry. The sauces, salsa and toppings were very flavorful which saved the taco. The rice and beans (served in extremely small portioned cups) were also very bland and again the rice was bland.  This place has a lot of potential if they can improve the product they're serving to people. It's a great location and I love to see downtown Pittsburgh growing. The environment is also very hip and trendy. I'm hoping this was a single bad experience. I'll be back to try again.

IKI5x85E55jiU2VFPySTnA.text: Condado is your high school cafeteria's tacos served in the old Tonic, late and cheap. The underwhelming options are overwhelming in number. Kind of like if Taco Bell had booze and tried a smidge harder. It gets two stars because late and cheap are two things I usually am, too.

lZegPJ2xxdengmghtG2Rfg.text: I. Love. Tacos. So believe me when I say, I've had my share of them.  I didn't even realize Condado existed until one of my friends randomly stumbled upon this treasure.  For starters, the staff is always super attentive and friendly even when it is super busy (which it usually is).  Each time I go I usually get a margarita. I do have to say they don't have the best margaritas, but their chips and queso make up for it.  I usually do a chip and dip trio which I get the spicy queso, salsa, and guac (per request of the group, I'm not really a guac fan).  The chips and queso are to die for.  I also get El Santo, one of their speciality tacos.  The menu has tacos already made up, or you can make your own.  I can't lie, I love El Santo so much that it's what I normally order, so I can't speak to the other items.  BUT, anything the rest of my group orders they absolutely love.    The prices are very reasonable and the atmosphere is very fun ! I will keep coming back for more, for sure !

UrdLwcnUHApYJpdWEAW8xg.text: This place was great! Awesome atmosphere with excellent tacos, guacamole and salsa! My butthole is still on fire!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dia de muerte!
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Skulls - you can&#39;t go wrong!
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Awesome murals!

FKUOhwGKRjs88X7ppdh-9g.text: Blackberry margs, beef brisket, DIRTY QUESO...this place is outrageously good...sausage gravy in between taco shells for brunch, please, just take my money!

DLLJdBZxvXkKTXjgwVdS4g.text: Meh- Ordered to-go and the tacos are soggy almost to the point that they are douched. Very pricey and meat is dry. The condiments/toppings are old ie, cilantro was wilted and rice was hard. I've had better tacos than this place- such as TaKo or Cocina Latina- to which I have ordered to-go in the past and they make sure when you get your food at home they are just as good as if you are eating there. Don't waste your money on this restaurant.

94iy51sAcUGrwnIgc18IaA.text: The margaritas here are absolutely wonderful. I especially loved the strawberry and blood orange. The tacos were so-so but definitely worth it if you go during happy hour. Highly recommend to anyone staying in the downtown area.

xgyM9DQXTEmd_LBX9c7WJw.text: The food is not comparable to some other similar restaurant close to it. The margaritas also aren't great...the staff treated me like I was an inconvenience.

vPbrqT8szRbw0RoARMyoVw.text: We were one minute late for our reservation and they gave our table away. We had to wait in the hot pittsburgh sun again just to not get served.

EIhdLXsTsm-2AIAFZAU56Q.text: The best goddamn tacos in the burgh.  Best happy hour, best margaritas, plus Sarah kicked ass helping us figure out what the fuck was going on.  Also, totally recommend the Blanco corn queso... Phenomnomnomz

npsQ_ex9nf_PrjJfdRcxuw.text: It's burgatory but with tacos! Plenty of options including some great veggie choices (Thai chili tofu, bbq jackfruit). Happy hour is great. Half off tacos which start at 3.50 and half off drafts/ margaritas. You can add special toppings for more but I never see the need to. I'm usually full from 2 tacos and some chips and salsa vs the smaller taco size at nearby Bakersfield. The only complaint I have is how tight the tables are on the bottom floor. Either way, I don't care because I can't get enough of this place.

jdMkDEm43hOBnFh5p-XVvQ.text: Went here for happy hours the margs are bomb and the tacos looked good! I did not personally order any but I was with a large group of people and they all enjoyed their food! A good place for larger groups because they will accommodate you nicely.

iWx2DxuX_PNE6X2Cb-XOgw.text: First time there and loved it.  The atmosphere was great and our bartender was awesome.  Drinks were really good.  Tacos are excellent.

0xt5kLxVrXAw0m6YhO63aw.text: I'm updating this to 4 stars because today's experience was better. I do recommend not going in when they are busy because that's when things in there are the most chaotic with the service and food. Condado would be perfect if they worked on that. They are newer and I am giving them the benefit of the doubt, but I do always keep in mind that Bakersfield and Tako are other lunch options.

TYSD-Vn2QnPkzEHYa3WdoA.text: My son picked the place from a list as it was close to our hotel. he liked it so that worked for me.  However, the waitress was very slick in selling him on queso , which was more expensive than he expected (the price may be somewhere but tiny).   I gave up trying to order a cocktail and was far too tired to do the gymnastics of creating  taco -- I get that is how it is there, and that's on me for not knowing that in advance. So I ate nothing. Plus, she sold him on three tacos when a small guy really only needed one (or two at the most).  I think it works for folks why like cutting edge tacos but from what I tasted, not that great. So no dinner for me tonight.

D2VIac8ezMG0lsCIvfFNgQ.text: Awesome food and service. My husband and I came in for a Saturday date and couldn't have been more pleased. We ordered off the create your own taco menu and all 4 came out delicious! We both had a chicken and a chorizo taco with different toppings. We also had the chorizo quest which was perfect. The waitress was very nice and because the tacos took longer than normal to come out they gave us tortilla chips on the house, which was very nice. I also ordered a beer that had just kicked and they gave me the rest anyways. Overall a very pleasant visit and will definitely recommend everyone go to Condado.

Wp4trDrc62dtqbXFg0-QWw.text: couldn't get a seat in the happy hour section but who cares, the tacos are worth full price. tasty margs and quick/ efficient service, I'll be back... soon

Uq1hRz87qkQ1OYTafC9upg.text: We were given a recommendation to grab tacos at this place. I am personally always a fan of tacos, and especially a place with a great atmosphere to go along with them. We were seated almost immediately, which I thought was great considering the estimated wait time online of 30 minutes. We were however seated at a small table sort of in the middle of all of the foot traffic, with people constantly hitting our chairs as they walked by. But, beggars can't be choosers.  Anyway, the menu looked great. We were politely greeted by our waitress who explained the menu to us. We selected to build our own tacos, filling out a paper menu with the type of taco, toppings, sauces etc. Cool idea, similar to some build your own burger restaurants in the are.  Unfortunately the drink I ordered, a "Mexican Coke" in a bottle was never delivered. I decided I probably didn't need it anyway, and didn't want to bother the waitress who I could tell was already stressed by having too many tables to wait on. Our food was finally delivered. Tacos in cardboard boats wrapped in foil. Presentation looked ok at first, however as you unwrapped the tacos, half of the ingredients were already all over the sides of the shell. Understandably, tacos are not a clean eating food, but there was very little attempt to even keep the toppings/sauce inside the shell in the first place. First bite...a lot of sauce- some cilantro lime cream sauce. Good, but slightly overpowering for the flavor of the taco. The meat....unfortunately I can say that the chicken tasted like it was directly out of a can, and not really much else added to it. I guess the sauce is supposed to cover that. Salty food requires water, which was quite hard to come by. After asking our waitress for a refill..two or three other table who were just seated and received their drinks before a plastic pitcher was brought to the table. The lid apparently was not very great, causing the waitress to pound it into place-table side- splashing me in the eye with water. Not really an issue, just more of a lack of attention and poor equipment. Finally we decided to just ask for the check, of which unfortunately contained the Mexican Coke which I never received. Asked for a to go box for the tacos, received two extra pieces of foil and a brown bag...I guess that's a good way to do it? But the foil was no where big enough to cover the taco that was already leaking. Paid the bill and left. While walking out, felt that unforgiving rumble in my stomach. A 20 minute drive proved quite challenging, finally making it home with regret and a prolonged stay on the toilet. Quite unfortunate, it looked like a great place...maybe it can be. But I will probably not be going back to this place, and I forewarn those who are looking for a good taco and a healthy GI System...look elsewhere.

IVUQYlSTNO2-Qp4mITSBkg.text: Lots of vegan options, which is a rarity at some other places in this town.  Was sad to see Tonic go and skeptical when Condado moved in, but the atmosphere is laid back, the drinks are reasonably priced, the food is excellent and they haven't turned into an overpriced bro-stop for the after work crowd.  The only complaint is that the menu is a bit confusing when building your own tacos (if you are getting more than two and being very specific about what you want on each).

PDTW97jc_ujA7fabHirTAA.text: I would not waste your money going to this place.  There are much better places in the city such as Bakersfield and taKo if you are craving tacos.  The restaurant has build your own taco concept which sounds fun but the food was not good at all. I didn't even end up eating the tacos. There is almost no meat in them and the meat that is included does not taste good. I had the brisket and pork and you could tell which was which and both had a sweet sauce on them which was not tasty.  I also ordered a jalapeno margarita which I also couldn't drink because there was so much sour mixer in it.  I have to say I will not be going back.

XEBXiiRfx927NDWfiiJpBw.text: The food at Condado is amazing. I have never had a taco as good as theirs in Pittsburgh. Plus I live about half a mile from the location in downtown Pittsburgh. However I find myself eating inside the restaurant less and less because of the horrendous service I have received time and time again. I go about three times a week to enjoy some of their delicious tacos. They have a wide range of tacos and can even create your own taco. They also have a wide assortment of guacamole, salsa, and queso. They have a full bar as well with every type of tequila you can imagine. I am not writing this review to bash on this place because they do have great food and I will continue to get there food, only through take out with the occasional meal at the bar with their male bartenders, who are the only ones that provide exceptional service. They have one male bartender in particular, named Dave, that I will come see time and time again because he is not only great as his job but extremely friendly and goes above and beyond. Overall, it is a place to try and when eating inside the restaurant try to sit at the bar when Dave is there.

D8Ox4Ivfn5h9CZLsHj-Ppw.text: For New Year's Eve you would expect average service and food at any bar or restaurant. Wrong. This place was awesome. The tacos were amazing and it was 11pm. Drinks were great too. Excited to come back next time I'm in Pittsburgh

uIf6Vl4Z-fm7mVzp1kG9Qw.text: Solid spot!  Quick thoughts:  -Fair priced food/drinks. Happy hour prices are great. Will be back during HH.   -Decor is cool. Lots of skullz. RIP tonic (will miss u).  -The music was oddly loud for lunch at noon on a Thursday. I felt like I was in da club.  -Tacos are generously sized compared to the two-bite Bakersfield tacos down the street; I built two brisket tacos which were pretty num.  -Queso + chips were good. A Generous amount of dip and waiter gave us extra chips.  -Margaritas are good. They use real fruit/lime juice.  -The menus are a bit confusing at first!  -All in all: 4 stars for above average food/drinks at super reasonable prices but docked a star bc nothing really stood out as OMGZ

5qQCDrnRvVrc_XaJn6sq5A.text: I have been here twice so far and have loved the food I ordered both times.  Got there before 4:30 (on a Friday) the first time I went, downstairs was already pretty full so my friend and I went upstairs and sat at the bar. The one big negative from this visit was the bartender did not tell us that happy hour was downstairs only and we found out when we over heard her telling others later. In general people were unhappy to hear that. I heard several complaints from others once they found out. It doesn't make much sense to me either but I know nothing about the restaurant business. Other than that the food was good and came out quickly.   Second time I went was a Saturday afternoon, the downstairs was pretty full again so we went upstairs not expecting happy hour prices. Three of us split the El Tres Amigos and ordered build your own tacos. The issues with this trip was first with the Dirty Queso we ordered. On the menu it says 'chicken, black beans, onions, dirty sauce' when we received it it was just plain queso with a little of the dirty sauce drizzled on top.. Kind of annoying, if your out of it just tell us, don't try to fake it. It was still damn delicious but we wanted to try something different. My friend ordered one drink and a different server brought her a different drink and said something like 'well just give it a try' and walked away. Our server came over and apologized for the mix up and said if she wanted the correct drink it's not a problem. Not a huge biggie at all, probably wouldn't even have mentioned it but it was the weird way the first girl handled it that made all of us say 'wtf'. Once we received the rest of our food we were happy campers. Two of my friends were going to order more drinks but we hadn't seen our server in some time so by the time she did come over we decided to go elsewhere for further drinking.  Food is wonderful, service could use some work but it's still new. I will probably stick to Sienna and Bakersfield for drinks though! (note: I was going to give this 3 stars for the service and other mix ups but I just really liked the food and food prices!)

piRW50acntzwwUqerC5VWQ.text: Very disappointed.  Tortilla chips were way too greasy. Asked for hot salsa and what we got was not only mild but also quite bland. Brisket Tacos were nothing special; had much tastier ones at another place around the corner.   It was their first week open so I may give it another shot... have heard some good things that don't match my experience.

V1KfBu3ZYIQVa2qlh5Q0wg.text: A m a z i n g tacos! Good service, and do not take too long! Wide variety of ingredients

XjbNW5PIYJnQg-D4PcINag.text: Food *****, Drinks *****, Service *****, Value *****, Atmosphere *  Made Party of 15 reservations for Saturday 7pm (I know, I know, PRIME TIME in a new restaurant...what was I thinking?) No table available. Sat us at upstairs bar (one member of our party can't do stairs :o(, so they left) Mgmt comped us chips and guacamole for the inconvenience. Table opened after about 50 minutes. By then several others also left because it was so packed and LOUD they just didn't want to be there anymore. 10 of us squeezed into a super booth where we ordered food. Bartender Mike was our AWESOME server. Staff was great, it's just really REALLY cramped, busy, and loud. Oh, and it's really loud too. Tacos are INCREDIBLE. Margaritas are FABULOUS. Prices are crazy reasonable. But it's really LOUD.   Bottom line: Go eat there! Just not at 7pm on a Saturday night.

j1daJSZIeXcguctlzLA_kg.text: My husband and I stopped here for a late lunch on the weekend.  The decor is hip Mexican with a cute bar.  It's cozy and inviting.  The service was very attentive and friendly.  We ordered the Anejo Manhattans and the cranberry guac to start.  The Manhattans were ok, they came on the rocks which isn't my favorite way to drink a Manhattan and they were a little too sweet.  The guac was ok and reminded me of the store bought kind, though the toppings dressed it up.  There was an option for  build your own taco, but we opted for the already put together kind.  I got a surf and turf, but didn't really see any steak.  I also got the taco with the jackfruit and double taco shell held together with queso.  That one was pretty good.  I feel like if they focused on making a few things really good, rather than having such extensive options, it could be better.  I would say that if we were in the area, we might stop for an appetizer and drink, but wouldn't make it a destination.

y3fpnGJI6u31-Tnt0T7jUw.text: Excellent tacos with a very nice selection of options for meat, shells, and general toppings.

Rl8Nk5B33bzaqwNf0SsheQ.text: I want to TACO 'bout how awesome this place is.  If I was given one last meal - it would be Tacos - and it would be Condado's brisket tacos with the many unique and delicious toppings and sauces they offer. I am salivating right now just thinking about them.  I got hooked on this place after first being introduced to their Margaritas from a girlfriend of mine (BLOOD ORANGE IS TO DIE FOR) and their chips and dip (which is one of my favorite foods).  Eventually we tried their tacos and I can't believe it's taken so long for me to have them.  They're one of a kind with a wide variety of assorted toppings, sauces, and styles of taco shell.  They're a decent price, seem to be going more expensive since they've first started but you really do get a lot in one taco.  I'm typically full off of 1 and my fiance can't finish more than 2-3.  I can't say enough good things about this place.  Only downside is that it does get quite busy and seating is very congested, I'm talking about rubbing elbows with whomever is seated next to you, hearing everyones conversation.  The upstairs is a bit more open, however that area is not always open.  With that being said I have had a few to go orders messed up and unfortunately you don't find out until you're home unwrapping the tacos and about to dive in.  I've worked in the service industry so I understand from time to time things like that will happen.  Love this place, haven't been able to find better tacos.

PGXv4q4a8tq1hMnBys_Hdg.text: This place is very good the only thing I would say is it is very crowded and they don't take reservations. The seating is also very close together. My margarita was excellent! The service was quick but they did forget the queso we ordered...they brought it out after the food but it was annoying. What is not to like about make your own tacos? I had the beef brisket and pulled pork and both were excellent along with the garlic sauce I put on them! I would defiantly go back just maybe not on a Friday to avoid the crowd.

-qi4JaoiKiBWXKZVKxQZcg.text: I tried this place at the recommendation of my Uber driver, and it did not disappoint! I had the house margarita, which was decent. I built my own tacos with the Ju-ju and Lucy taco shells. My favorite was definitely the Lucy shell with the pulled pork. The cilantro/lime aioli sauce was great! I also had the chips and half size of the quest blanco, which was way more than I could finish. The service was awesome and the food came out quick. I would definitely try again!

drGAyRlQARVjPHHIqOIH4w.text: Beat Queso Blanco i have ever had! I'm not a huge fan of tacos but this place is delicious. The walls and decorations are adorable and the wait staff is extremely helpful if you're not entirely sure what you want. 9/10 Would recommend

_M62h4KTXtmGcV5mVylYqg.text: I love the food, the art, everything! This is my favorite place to eat! They are accommodating with my allergy and always get the food out pretty quick! Their tocos are to die for and don't forget about the queso! Looking forward to my next visit!

kQfvpUAZ168iNNBYjr4SXw.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat downtown!  I've done brunch, lunch, dinner, second dinner... And it never disappoints.  The guac is amazing and you can build your own taco with countless ingredients.  The prices are also pretty low and happy hour is a great deal!

KIo5-Ina0kAzFX7U7BJVXA.text: Very hip taco place that was right across the street from the Westin Convention Center. Hit the spot when I didn't feel like eating free food from my conference (somewhat shocking for a poor college student but it just goes to show how much I enjoyed the tacos).   The build-your-own taco customization makes is a gift that keeps on giving. As a combinatorics enthusiast, it was fun running through all the different taco outcomes you could get. So great for vegetarian and vegan options!   It gets pretty crowded and loud during peak hours but definitely part of the vibrant tone of the place. Service is quick and easy. Loved the art on the walls.

LvOxsbPAt6mK2qjMJWSt9A.text: The tacos here are amazing, never seen the day that i would eat avocado on a taco and absolutely LOVE it. I think it was their chicken bacon ranch taco of the month. Absolutely amazing each and every time i go. the queso, oh my the queso is outstanding! the vibe of this place is just so chill and happy. definitely love coming here!

3UBWLGAd-tYLJxfK_teJ-A.text: Came here with my buddy after a highly disappointing wine and taco festival.   It was at Condado where I found redemption.    Now if you think you're gonna get some authentic Oaxacan tacos here, think again. They're just trying to bring good tacos for EVERYONE to enjoy in a festive atmosphere and they do a great job of it! I respect it.   Versatile gringo style tacos (and some non gringo)! Have the option of selecting from their recommended tacos or creating your own. With a piece of paper and a pencil and a few X's (sorry didn't mean to sound like a divorce lawyer ad) you can construct your own tacos.  Nachos and other typical dishes are available too. The nachos do look heavenly, won't lie. It's one of the few places where you can "double decker" up with a tortilla and crispy shell.   The meats are cooked well and the margaritas are strong AF yet extremely delicious. We got mango jalapeno and that hit the spot (by spot  I'm pretty sure it was a stomach ulcer but worth it )  Overall, dope little taco haunt at the location formerly known as "tonic" and a great addition to downtown. Awesome place to hit up before going out or for happy hour!

5S_8hqrA2tRSKJaUk7Oj2g.text: I'd give this spot 2.5 stars. When I first tried it, I really loved it! I like their Queso a lot, and their make your own tacos are super fun. It's a hip spot to check out, but it's super busy and the service is terrible. I've gone multiple times and each time, the wait staff has been quick, edgy, and dismissive. I tried to join their rewards program and no one wanted to help me do this. When I first moved here, I enjoyed this place and went a handful of times because of its convenient location and cool vibe. After the last couple experiences, I will be avoiding this place. Also, their chicken tacos are TERRIBLE! Get those only if you like totally bland, boiled chicken! It's really easy to mask the lack of flavor with sauces and toppings, but a True foodie and cook will know the difference. If you want good tacos, I'd suggest venturing outside the city into Coraopolis for La Poblanita! It's super authentic and well seasoned, well cooked, and delicious! Fair warning though, that place won't have your fancy sauces and there is no seating except for some benches outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Don&#39;t get the chicken!
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy Queso was really good!
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Make your own tacos

x5r8dfTW-9T8Be6R6RTt8Q.text: We ate here out of desperation on a late Sunday night as we were headed out of town. The food was tasty and creative, we appreciated the vegetarian and vegan options, and the service was friendly and prompt. We drank the on-tap blood orange sour and the anejo Manhattan, and both were delicious.  I will say: this restaurant is straight-up disrespectful to Mexican and Tex-Mex cuisines. The Spanish was especially heinous--a light-up sign proclaimed "Tacos Delicioso" (should be "deliciosos"); a menu item was called "el Tres Amigos" (should be "los") and worst of all, the spicy tacos were labelled "mucho caliente", which means, "a lot of hot", not "very spicy", which in Spanish is "muy picante". Yikes. Even spending a few seconds on Google Translate would have helped, let alone consulted one of Pittsburgh's 6,000 Spanish speakers.

bqPRXC01d3Qp2TyS-THBEA.text: Damn. These tacos are INCREDIBLE. I love the option to build your own and, let's be honest, these tacos are basically free. They're SO CHEAP, yet so delicious, it's ridiculous. I'd love to see the HH specials offered throughout the restaurant since the layout is a little disjointed, but I'll live either way. I've only been for lunch (since HH is chaos here), so I'm sorry to say I haven't tasted the drinks, but if the tacos are any indication, they're incredible too.

3u6AFmC2T5jwXpGqDJsgLQ.text: I do not understand the appeal at all. Sure, the margs are cheap and the alcohol pours may be heavy-handed, but the tacos are disgraceful. I rarely spit food out once it is in my mouth, but the ceviche-inspired shrimp taco was quite possibly the worst I have ever had. The shrimp taco was sweet, sour and the sauce tasted very thick, a very inappropriate combination in a taco.   Another problem was the unnecessarily confusing taco menu. I found myself sorting through a pile of oddly-shaped menus to figure out my dinner.  It is a shame, because this restaurant is in a fantastic location and features a vibrant and colorful addition to Downtown Pittsburgh. I am willing to try again if they can get their act together and cook proper tacos. At least the chips are cheap and satisfying.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The cider is a bit small
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Diablo queso is pretty good!

YYFwjD3cJf7BKSJbpeQhTQ.text: Amazing tacos, quick and friendly service, and good margaritas and beer selection. We ate so much we were almost uncomfortable but we don't regret it at all!

x6dk3jPiYRZJE3q08bvIJQ.text: Condado has great happy hour deals (except for when an event is in town). First, drinks. The pomegranate marg is my personal favorite, but all of the flavors are great! The flight of margaritas is the best way to try multiple flavors if you can't pick just one. Second, apps. I'm a sucker for queso and Condado has some of the best. Always out quick and nice and warm. Can't beat it. Third, tacos. With a sheet of paper to customize your tacos however you want, this place really has it all! (The sweet Lucy taco is to die for!!)

mHR__m3D0OpcV5GGQbvQaQ.text: Hands down my favorite taco place I've ever been to. I came to Pittsburgh for a conference and looked for food in the area that was cheap but good. Only Condado Taco fit the bill.  Walked in and I immediately got a seat at the bar; the place was packed but as a single person I didn't have any issues finding a seat. The menu is quite complicated but once I got the hang of it (the bartender was very helpful explaining it to me) I had a blast. Their chorizo is amazing, and their tacos are sooo good. I enjoyed their cocktails and I made happy hour so it was cheap. I had a very fulfilling meal including alcohol for less than 25 bucks, which is a miracle.   The food was so good I came back the following day with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

tB9hQPmdBEkcJEd8ZBGm_A.text: I LOVE Condado Happy Hour!!! It is Monday - Friday 5-7 in the bar area (first floor).  You get $1 off each taco and the margaritas are half price!   The margaritas here are soooo good! They have a ton of different flavors and I swear each one is more delicious than the next! I haven't tried a flavor I didn't like.  The tacos are customize-able which is fun, but always makes me nervous I'll make a terrible combination.  Luckily they have some pre-made selections if you need suggestions.    I highly recommend the "Sweet Lucy" shell which is a hard shell, queso, guac, and a flour tortilla.  The queso appetizer is pretty addicting too!   This past visit one of the food runners ended up with extra chips and salsa and gave it to us for free which was so nice! I would definitely order the queso or guac over the salsa, but it was great to try it! I would not recommend the chorizo in your taco unless you like things realllly spicy.  It was the only thing I would change about an otherwise great dinner at Condado.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Every flavor of margarita is sooo yummy and even better when it&#39;s half off during happy hour!
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Taco Menu
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

xvHZsypv52VUcUp_JKVmow.text: Always very busy and crowded, but worth the wait (if you have the time). I have gone here for several meetings and it's always hard to hear one another, but we always make it work. The food and drinks are delicious and the staff are quick and attentive.

CqXnQ8Y-ybTKNw2NqaLspA.text: The food was excellent.  The service was awesome.  We had a beautiful day to enjoy the outside dining option.  Definitely recommend.

BQHrMbORm7ywIckcszldqQ.text: Really great concept of building your own tacos! I thought the atmosphere was great, extensive drink menu and delicious food that came out quick! Great spot for downtown!

BWECdGpr9Fnn2C4s8W4VhA.text: Did you know that Condado offers 335,544,320 different combinations of tacos? So far, every one that I have tried has been quite good! I highly recommend the beef brisket and the juju shell, which is the combination of a soft and hard shell with queso and chorizo in between. The option of customizable tacos is also great if you are going out with a picky eater.  Happy hour is from 5-7 pm Monday through Friday and includes half off margaritas and $1.00 off tacos and drafts. You cannot take advantage of the happy hour deals on the upper floors so sometimes there can be a bit of a wait. There are no reservations and the staff will ask for a phone number when putting your name in so that they can contact you when a table is ready. You have five minutes to claim your table after it is ready.  The inside of Condado is cute and eclectic with different paintings adorning the walls. It can get pretty loud in there, especially during happy hour. However, the food comes out quickly and is delicious. Make sure to ask for their monthly specials!  In my opinion, Condado has much better tacos than Bakersfield even if their queso is not as good. While the queso at Bakersfield is on another level, Condado has more options. I definitely think that Condado is a good place to try out!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

7WT8GmSyJAyo9nvdY8Imdg.text: I was very excited to try this place out but I left disappointed. They have a bar and seating upstairs and downstairs. You can make your own taco or order off a menu. I ordered 3 different tacos and none of them were very memorable. Staff was friendly but I wouldn't go back.

OG1KlMhKo-_tdX19pWfw9A.text: Ended up here after a night of creativity and mischief. They have awesome tacos and an excellent selection of beer and liquor. We sat at the bar,  the service was great and food came quickly. They only have tacos minus a couple specials they seem to have monthly, so don't come expecting something else.  The only downside was the music. It was the most god awful pop Brittany spears bullshit.  Looking around, it didn't fit any of the crowd. But I guess they were too drunk to hear it, I will be more drunk next time. Because I will be back; i have a taco problem.

Plg5iwzBix3GLpyjKafADA.text: the service can't be beat honestly. quick service - even at midnight! other bars in the area you have to fight or wait for a drink. here, I have never waited too long to get waited on and food and drinks come to you quick! the best late night taco and drink spot. drinks will have you questioning if there's even alcohol in them they're that good!

s_BIyOKojir7-ZxcEl-aMg.text: I was really hyped to try this place. Arrived around 6 on a Thursday evening and it was packed. I didn't mind waiting, but there really was no place to wait (and the weather outside was terrible!).   We were seated super close to the tables surrounding us, but I didn't mind because I was so excited for tacos. The restaurant was really loud, so if you're looking for a place to catch up and make lots of small talk, perhaps this isn't the joint for you.   We started with the queso, guacamole, and salsa. The portions were huge and the chips were fresh and bottomless. The create your own tacos were unique. We had a lot of fun deciding what toppings to get. I thought my chicken taco was better than the brisket. I found the brisket to be pretty dry.  Also had a blood orange margarita and would highly recommend that!   Overall, I was impressed with the menu and the prices. I will definitely return!

9BmMC81vRVrDIQzt_PR3DQ.text: My husband and I were in town for a Pens game a few weeks ago and decided to grab dinner here before the game. We'd never been in before, but Michael, our waiter, was fantastic. He walked us through the menu and how to order. The whole experience from start to finish was amazing! The tacos were by far the best we've ever had and service was spot on. The chips, salsa, queso and guacamole were phenomenal as well. The only downfall is they're 3 hours away from us! We absolutely cannot wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Vd3Ry1-Tdoys-Feqbib86g.text: The tacos I ordered (the surf and turf) were SUPER spicy. Delicious, but way spicier than I realized. The regular lime margarita was overly sweet, but the blood orange one was divine. I would give four stars, but the restaurant was tiny and LOUD. Don't recommend if you're hoping to have conversation.

Nt30iG5P8kT_hpAMwpJefg.text: Hands down BEST tacos I've ever had in my life. I loved the concept, where you order your own food by using pen and paper. There are tons of options, especially for vegans and vegetarians. Drinks looked great, I ordered one but I think the server forgot to put it in. I ate so much chips and guacamole that I was kind of glad he forgot it! Wow! Check this place out.

Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chips are AMAZING! Guac is ok, good amount for $
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken something!

jsbdUUeBG4_sr3h2x5bWWA.text: Originally tried Condado in Columbus, Ohio and was super excited to find out there is one here in Pittsburgh!  Going with a toddler for some late night tacos, they did not disappoint!   Service was exceptional and the tacos.... LOVE!  The ghost pepper salsa..... HOT but soooo good!

rO_1GXhcLceDyN7Zsi_EiQ.text: I went here twice in the span of 24hrs for dinner and brunch; If you want the best damn tacos in Pittsburgh, these are the best damn tacos in Pittsburgh.   I'm a big fan of Doce Taqueria, Tako, Bakersfield, El Burro and even Las Palmas but Condado Tacos is THE best in Pittsburgh and here is why.  (You can skip to the last paragraph if you not like read long) 1. THE Tacos Starting with the queso or guac is a must here. Ooey-gooey melty goodness that is just ooh wow hot wow delicious. The diablo queso isn't as spicy as you'd imagine and the Tuscan guac is pretty fantastic.Chips and corn shells are fresh and are bomb dot com. The ability to build your own tacos gives you the ability to royally "F" your own taco, but it also gives you the ability to make an incredibly tasty masterpiece. Brunch, Lunch or Dinner, their Chorizo is really, really (I mean REALLY REALLY) good. Their pulled pork doesn't beat Doce but their brisket, steak, ceviche, chicken, and portobellos are all expertly seasoned and absolutely delicious and mouth-wateringly tasty (the steak and ports with eggs for breakfast is just ughhhmazing.) Sauces- GREAT, salsas- just meh, but fresh.  2.The Drinks This is a bar that sells tacos.Good beer selection(taps and cans), a plethora of tequila and a bunch of cocktails that are pretty darn good (although they can be pretty strong...which is a bonus in my book). Also, Micheladas. Year round. Love me a michelada. These guys aren't the cocktail kings, but they have good stuff and great prices, especially during happy hour.  3.Everything else This bar pulls out the stops. Great location with enough seating so you don't have to wait forever; Enough room at the bar for those who want to drink the night away and the atmosphere(super cool vibes) that encourages it, if you wanted. Coat/purse hooks under tables and at the bar; A convenient touch for comfort. Kitchen is open till one 7 days a week so you can grab your midnight snack, drunk or not, any night of the week. A rewards program that makes you want to go back over and over and a Happy Hour that really makes that easy. Lastly, but not leastly, the service is good and with time will be great. Patrick was there day and night and went out of the way to make sure we understood everything, as well as making sure we were topped off and satisfied.   ALL IN ALL, the prices here align with your typical taqueria ($3 tacos +$ for anything special) yet taste like your upscale fancy pants taco (I'm talking about Tako and Bakersfield). They don't charge you or focus on presentation and location and that alone is commendable. Drinks are great and they are appropriately styled and priced. Service is still growing its roots and confidence but is still good.   I'll be a regular here. A Condadoer. A condadooy. Condaddy? Whatever, I'll be there weekly.  (Condaddy for sure) lol.

T72uxWhwt1CSg1d-Wk1Wlw.text: Amazing! Can't beat for the price and atmosphere. I always try something new and am never disappointed. You will not regret it!

xWjVE_N6CWjTk2sHFsq5eg.text: I am beyond impressed. I think it's rare that you have a good thing going right out of the gate. Granted, they've tested this already in their successful counterpart in Columbus, but dang, these are some good tacos!  The concept is build your own tacos. So you fill out a form for exactly what you want your taco to be. Flour or corn tortilla? Double stacked with gauc inside?? Dorito taco... Okay I made that last one up, but seriously the options are endless with meats, cheeses, toppings and sauces. The works! So it's really your fault if you make a bad taco! Although I would be hard pressed to find one I didn't like. I built one with their house made chorizo and fresco sauce and it was incredible. The other steak one I built was pilled high with chipotle cheese. Just thinking about them makes my mouth water.   We also got chips, which are freshly baked and fried in house with two types of salsa (house and verde) and the queso with beans. The only miss was that the queso was really runny, so it made picking up the sauce with chips hard. But it still tasted good somehow, just messy!  The service was top notch and I love the vibe. Can't wait to make this my go to happy hour and taco spot... I feel like this is just the beginning of a beautiful relationship make in taco heaven!

6sWctF01rfnu2nZVZQsfaw.text: The food and drinks were awesome at Condado! And if I were giving a rating only about their food and drinks, I would give them 5 stars with no hesitation. BUT I have never in my life experienced service as bad as I had at this restaurant.  Awhile back, a group of friends and I had reservations for a special occasion. Out of 11 of us, only one member of our group had been to Condado. When the waitress greeted us at our table, she asked if any of us had been there before and the one member raised their hand. The waitress said "Okay, well if you've been here then you can explain how this works and make my life easier" and then left for 20 minutes. There were a bunch of other issues throughout the evening (including her taking a glass of water that one person had been drinking out of and giving it to another person instead of just getting them a new glass). Finally, the week after, I checked my bank statement to see that they had overcharged me as well as several other members of our group. What was supposed to be a nice "pick-me-up" for a friend ended up being so disappointing.

jQFrGFJPrCbRuI603tWpFA.text: Be sure to get the chips with dip sampler! Such a good way to start the meal. The margaritas are fabulous! We were there for happy hour which they have great deals going on. I got two recommended tacos and one I made myself. I got the El Tradicional and wasn't a fan at all. Didn't even finish it after one bite. Also got the Ooey Gooey and that was good but pretty spicy. I'd go again for happy hour and fill up on drinks, chips and make my own tacos from now on

ZvreqctZgILZ3Vu18JpQQQ.text: I've visited Condado's numerous times. Every visit is 5/5 stars for food and drinks! 4/5 stars for staff... only because they get very busy and you have to wait awhile at times to get fresh drinks. This review is only 4/5 stars, because we visited last night pretty late and were told the kitchen was still open but was closing soon. So we put in our taco orders and the food was served quiet quickly. However, everyone's tacos were cold... be advised you will not get freshly cooked food if you order close to kitchen closing.

Gjuv2Owq1WR1STaxTEbFig.text: I often go to Condado's with my girlfriend. It has a cozy, relaxed atmosphere with a very attentive staff. You need more chips? They're typically already on it. Even on busier nights, they make sure that you are taken care of to the best of their ability. Our server Michael provided exemplary service tonight under the management of Audrey. And I haven't even gotten to the food yet-- the tacos are fantastic. The order sheet has options for creative twists if you're feeling a little adventurous alongside more classic styles. I would definitely recommend their happy hour after a long shift at work!

Spe5hT2S9j6c8ATudpYXXw.text: I knew that this place was opening soon and luckily we were downtown this weekend to check it out. Official opening: Tuesday, March 14.  The inside is super hip with skull graffiti on the walls and cool people working there.  This was a pre opening day, so they were working some kinks (i.e. app came before our pitcher of margaritas) out but that did not take away from the great food and service. Many managers checked on us throughout our meal to make sure that we had a memorable experience.   Some things to Note: The margaritas are tasty.  Not that sugar mix garbage that you get at other places.  This pitcher tasted like it was handcrafted with just enough sours and more than enough alcohol,  A plus for authenticity.  The tacos are tasty.  Interesting flavors, spicy, not spicy.  Anything that you want, you can get. there are no menus there.  More than the flavor, these bad boys are filling.  After eating an endless bowl of chips, two tacos was almost too much NO MENUS (sort of):  You have a tablet of pre-made tacos and a tablet of make your own.  There are a lot - ALOT of options.  It isn't blatantly stated, but you can add proteins to pre-designed tacos.  I have a "Trust the chef" mentality, so I usually stay away from anything build-your-own, butI did create a shrimp Seviche taco that really hit the spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu. Not menu.  So many options
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp seviche taco. Make your own. Keep it fresh

gVaPktpvXc-KO4aeIDe1mQ.text: My husband and I decided to go on a whim. We were a little stupid for not realizing that would be super slam since it's Taco Tuesday! We were expecting a long wait for a table and then for food after we ordered. There were about 6 tables ahead of us and we only waited about 15 minutes. After we ordered everything came out quickly and was hot. Since it's the grand opening there were lots of specials on margaritas and your first Taco was free. I got a peach Margarita and my husband got prickly pear. Prickly pear kind of tastes like watermelon. They were both good. I was surprised that I liked their traditional Margarita more. My husband says that is has a punk-rock rock Taco vibe to it and I have to agree.   I really love the build your own taco option. It's like Mad Libs only you end up with a delicious yummy dinner. We got the dirty dip and it was absolutely delicious. I queso dip with chicken beans onions, "dirty sauce" and a whole bunch of yum.  I called this the flavors of Tako and the value of Los Palmas. I wouldn't bring your grandmother cuz it's kind of loud but works in this place.  Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. I I always believe that the chef knows what flavors go together the best.

xnSpUup5anKxrPXliUe08w.text: This place is great! They have some of the best vegetarian tacos I've ever had and they had multiple options which rarely happens.

ggFe-ANCHpEQruLAuxTdaQ.text: When I heard we were getting a new taco place in downtown I was beyond thrilled. Who doesn't love tacos? I know I think about tacos almost all day every day. A group of friends and I stopped here one Saturday after the Winefest to give it a try. I think it was safe to say the entire group loved it.  The decor of this place is spot on and I absolutely loved it. The drink menu was very extensive and had a lot of mexican drinks that you don't see all that often. Ever since I had a michelada on vacation years ago I have had trouble finding places that served them. They also have a variety of margarita flavors that you won't find most places. Sure other places have your strawberry or raspberry but Condada has banana, prickly pear, peach, jalapeno, and the list goes on. Our waitress recommended a mix of strawberry and jalapeno which I will definitely be trying next time!  Most importantly though, and the main reason I gave it a 5 star, is the tacos. Don't get me wrong it is hard for me to not like a taco. What I like most about this place is the fact that you can create your own tacos. I don't mean just pick your meat, toppings, and shell. You can choose from a corn tortilla, to a flour, to a hard shell within a flour with cheese in the middle. They have multiple meets, sauces, cremes, etc. For those that don't want to create their own they also have suggested tacos that you can order. Most of which looked delicious but as a first timer I obviously had to create me own.   All in all, I think Condado Tacos is definitely worth checking out and I would highly recommend it. And when you do go get yourself some chorizo queso! It's amazing.

BEyh2TDHsYUBdJd4ygpDUQ.text: Brendan split our check 12 ways. I'm not sure how he kept track of everything but did so error free. Great food and atmosphere.

ecS5lMfEA-COpzqVZ5SyCQ.text: Was good. Everything - including the guac - needed SALT. I think if the dishes were seasoned just a bit more, they would be on-point. But overall, would still recommend.

2ceGK-9Dqh28KYEg-21LSg.text: Condado lives up to all the hype!! Their happy hour is the perfect time to try their food and drinks if you're curious. It goes 5-7pm M-F which is later than most places and is essentially half price margs and tacos. Each taco is fairly large so you really only need to order 2 or 3 for a meal at most. When I went, I also got the chips and corn guac (forget the exact name) - it was so tasty!! I was surprised at the intense flavors of everything I had here. Much better than a lot of other restaurants downtown that have tacos, in my opinion. I want to come here all the time now.  Must, must, must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

7lBxHb7AkBtzEwhe27jzdw.text: A simple build your own style taco place with some predesigned options. They have a good beer and tequila selection too.  Their pico has a nice pop to it. They get busy st lunch, but you can call in order to pick up.

Bw3k8-XMAbwLKdGySe9EVg.text: Condado Tacos was right there when we needed them!   Staff was nice to explain to us how we go on with the menu. Guacamole was delicious and chips were fresh. They gave us chips to go since we had guacamole left.   We got a chance to make our own tacos as we wish. I didn't want to pay extra for rice however the greens, cilantro and tomatoes are free to add so it was the best to add to tacos.  Beef Brisket inside Goody Goody with Chipotle Crema sauce were my favorite and I suggest to all.  The specials on alcohol are must try, looking to visit there on their happy hour!

It was a little busy with a bit of a wait (they don't take reservations), but we got seats at the bar and were very comfortable. The bartender was attentive, friendly, and STUNNING! And the banana margarita was enough for a 5 star rating.

fiyGls5Y2sJhS2BG65sugw.text: I stayed in the Westin Hotel so it was right across the street from me.  The staff and the atmosphere were nice.  The tacos were very good, especially the Surf and Turf.  I will definitely recommend people try this place.  I wish I had gone later in the night for a margarita or something.  Definitely next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Pt6n2xbtqn8SNSklSIJyQQ.text: Do not do it. Please, don't!!! Hand to *whoever you pray, or don't,* this is the worst place I've ever eaten on the promise it would be suitable. I had a Lyft driver and bartender try to sell this place as a good spot for late night eats, and I'm struggling to paint the picture without being overly verbose but that's the only way I can, I'm sorry. Walked in late night, stoked for some good eats. Warning sign numero uno: two people next to me had food they were eating and it smelled awful. I chalked it up to maybe having ordered something weird? I ordered a beer..it was satisfactory. It was okay, is okay good with you? I picked two tacos through the choose your own adventure menu. Maybe I ordered wrong? I hope not! The fundamentals (tortillas, meat, etc.) weren't good. Also, if you give people the ability to pick options to build their own taco, don't give them the option to fail! I've never left a taco plate or a a serving of beans uneaten but I couldn't finish my food. Here's why: The flour tortilla on my mushroom taco was cold and grainy, the mushroom had zero flavor, and the parts of the tortilla that weren't ice cold were gummy which tells me it was microwaved or something there means it wasn't heated on a flattop or pan. Also, the ground beef taco was DISGUSTING. Do you like Taco Bell? Sure, we all do. Imagine Taco Bell texture and quality without the taste. THIS PLACE!!! Zero flavor with TB quality. Sick. Do I need to talk about the beans??? Beans are 995% my jam!!! I took 3 bites. The first was to have a bite and the next two were to determine what I was tasting - burnt chiles. It tasted like char and gas. It was awful! What concerns me most - this is apparently a chain? I hope this place is an anomaly or that my experience was an anomaly. This isn't just the worst Mexican food or worst tacos I've ever eaten, this goes down in the books as one of my worst restaurant meals, period. Do.not.do.it.

UpfDMumJ-MgqH78SOW4c_Q.text: I first visited Condado when they opened in Pittsburgh and was not impressed. This visit was much better!   Meet some friends for happy hour. You can't beat the special here!   Drinks: Extensive drink menu with so many margarita flavors. I had the blood orange and will have it again in the future! My friends had Blackberry and pomegranate, which were also very good. They even offer margarita flights to sample some of the flavors.   Food: We had the usual chips and queso to start. Nothing special, but how can you not? Then we ordered tacos. They have a preset menu or you can build your own. I did a build-your-own with chorizo. Very good! I had the pulled chicken before and was not as impressed. The tacos are a generous size. Order two for a complete meal. The build-you-own menu offers a number of salsas/tortillas/meats/toppings - you can't go wrong!   Space: Condado has two floors. We sat downstairs. Seating is tight! Just a heads up if that's not your thing...   Super excited to make this a go to happy hour stop this summer!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

mOsn0i3tp7o1oI-5k14TIQ.text: That was the best tacos i ever had, definitely a must go a good place to go with friends.

X3cY0P0dB_MWgayI1UstQQ.text: We waited for a table on a Sat evening, noticed it was noisy in the first floor. We were almost seated on the 2nd floor but it was unbelieveably noisy. People leaning in to hear each other. Not my idea of a good time. Just turned around and left. Nobody to tell at the hostess stand. Might try again, at a less busy time.

dTS9SGjed52EgVbbkqr7dQ.text: This used to be my most favorite restaurant ever. The past few times the service has been horrible. Horrible.    We waited 10 minutes for a server to approach us with a water. And take an order.   We usually have to kindly ask the server to come back for our taco order while we're eating our dips. Now the server barely bothers to come back to our table. And we're left to drink warm water whenever she feels like bringing a refill.   Then after an order of 2 taco bowls, we waited 30 minutes to get our food. The place it's no where near as busy as normal and there are food runners. I should also note our appetizer was finished 45 minutes prior to our food was delivered.   After this being our favorite place, I'll doubt we'll be back.

56SUAbg4dDSohLj0aUVlGw.text: Tacos and Margaritas.  What else do you really need.  Joined some coworkers for a Happy Hour here at Condado.  The place was packed on a Tuesday afternoon, so obviously it is a popular after work spot.  We started with a chips and a bunch of different salsas.  Guacamole, Sweet Corn, Queso.  All were amazing.  I think you can make the Chips and Salsa a meal if you really wanted to and not be ashamed about it.  But you really don't want to do that.  The Tacos are amazing! So many options! Build your own or chose one of the already created tacos from the menu.  You can create your own taco from a long list of options of shells, cheeses, meats and other toppings. They have pads on the tables with all the options and you fill it out with what you want and rip off the slip to hand to the waiter/waitress. Its that easy to do, but trying to construct your own tacos given all of the options can be a daunting task.  I had two tacos with Chorizo and two with Shrimp Ceviche. I only slightly varied the topping between the two, but both kinds were very good and filling.  The Hard shell inside the Soft Shell was great and kept everything together and from getting messy.  My wife wants to go there after telling her of my experience, so I hope to be back soon!

AwqRtCVKAWktBZrEtVNo5g.text: After graduating from college in the Pittsburgh area, I think Condado Tacos is the place I'm gonna miss the most. It truly is a taco eatery in a league of its own. First off, I LOVE that condado has solid vegetarian protein options, rather than most taco places which just have a singular options. Here, you can choose from Thai chili tofu, pulled jackfruit, mushrooms, or even rice and beens. My personal favorite is the tofu, which is crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. Next, you can choose from pre made tacos or build your own. Normally, I build my own so that I can put all the toppings and sauces that my heart desires. Another unique aspect is that condado has double shell tacos, with one soft and one hard, plus other fillings like quest and gauc, without costing extra! Normally, I can get two very filling tacos for under $10 here.   At happy hour, there are margherita deals and $1 off tacos. Another cool thing that condado offers is the option to mix two flavors in your margherita, like strawberry-mango, etc.   Honestly, I could go on and on raving about this place but you should go check it out for yourself :)

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Make your own tacos
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Couldn&#39;t wait to take a bite!
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tofu and jackfruit tacos + mango margarita

81NrM2qTQJZtpSAjcMY4kw.text: This restaurant brings a different vibe to the Pittsburgh restaurant scene. As soon as you walk in, the dim lights but colorful wall decor bring a setting that I personally have never seen in Pittsburgh. A fun fast casual place. It's got two floors - small seating downstairs with a lot more room upstairs. There's a bar on both levels. I've never had to wait longer than 15 minutes for a table at this one (I've had long waits at the Lawrenceville location, however). A really great place for a big group of friends to go!  Starting with drinks and apps, the house margarita and the white sangria are amazing! The guac is great and I've honestly gone to Condado sometimes just for their chorizo queso - it's the best. Very sweet and rich. Then, when it comes time to order tacos, they have a couple recommended orders but they have a "build it yourself" menu. You can order as many tacos as you want with whatever you want. Every type of meat you want and all your classic taco toppings - vegetarian options too! Every taco starts at $3.50 and most toppings are free (some toppings add $1). Individually, things are pretty cheap, but add up pretty quick when you get carried away with the amazing menu.  I've never had bad service. If the place is busy (which it tends to be) servers can be a little slow on drink and chip refills, but they're always nice and food comes out really quick.  I will always suggest Condado first when it comes to choosing dinner or late night food places with friends. If you haven't gone, you definitely have to!

MkZfrmIjJouTeSFWxmGoVQ.text: I write this review as I walk towards Condados Tacos for the fourth time in the past week of arriving to the Pittsburgh area (yes, you read that right), so that must tell you something off the bat.  This is a small taco joint located in the heart of downtown Pittsburgh, with a small interior but tacos that surely make up for it. The way you order is quite original: you take a list check boxes and a pencil from the table and either check which (and how many) tacos you would like. They have two lists - one for their 'signature' tacos, and one for those who would like to make their own.  Service is fast, those who work there are certainly instrumental to their business's success.  They also seem to have a wide selection at their bar, although I have not personally tried any of their drinks.  And, most importantly, the tacos...the freaking tacos man...they are miraculous. Pretty much every other food item on the list I have tried (guac, chips, rice) is just downright orgasmic.   So in short, definitely check this taco joint out. You won't be dissatisfied.

VHkboz54IdVaf-UbsqCPwQ.text: Quite honestly my favorite restaurant. Great service every time, good prices, and delicious food. I love the white queso, although the chips could be a little less greasy. I love being able to build my own taco since I'm such a picky eater (get the roast pollo it's amazing!). And the margaritas are strong and so yummy, love all the different flavors. It's always crowded for happy hour so be early!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

YDNTDLJWV2h5pL7QHnoPJw.text: Bar service review only: 2 stars only because their margs and food ARE delish, 0 stars for service. I wish I knew the name of the horrid bartender I had while sitting at the bar recently (see check "server: downstairs b) so that management could appropriately follow up. Beyond the initial greet in which she barely grunted at me, she did not use words or speak to me the ENTIRE meal I had. I attempted to ask for a fork multiple times in which she blatantly ignored me (ended up asking a server on the floor). Further, my margarita sat completely empty pushed to the bar front for 25+ minutes. I would have enjoyed another but she was too busy on her phone and I wasn't ABOUT to yell across the bar at her for another drink after her barely addressing me.   The thing, however, that set me over the edge and forced me to write this was that in her ignoring me the whole time - she couldn't even give my credit card back to the correct person. After waiting for my check for another 10 minutes, she ran my card and set it down in front of another guest down the bar. The bar was NOT that busy that this should have happened and its unacceptable with all the identity stealing that happens in today's world.   I think she and management need to rethink her role as a bartender if this the type of service you receive from "downstairs b". Part of being a bartender is being welcoming and helpful and she was ANYTHING but that. Sorry Condado but the tacos ARENT THAT good and Bakersfield is right down the street where at least I know I will get a "hello", a "thank you", and my credit card back to the right person at their bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

GmOc_uktvV75miIFShcwjw.text: Pittsburgh's best happy hour! $3.50 margaritas and $1 off tacos, not to mention you can make whatever kind of taco your heart desires. The 5-7pm hour is also perfect for specials. The drinks, apps (el tres amigos), and tacos are the best bang for the buck. El tres amigos allows you to choose 3 different dips to sample with a monthly queso and guac that always exceed expectations--we love the Tuscan guac! My friends and I have been coming here for a few years and will always be coming back for future happy hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Good friends and good margs!

p-91W7y0JDjmhFHRagKlkQ.text: Great place for a quick meal if you are attending anything at the convention center. This place also boasts a great beer list.

FX_wfaao0eAI8HzHF_o4ow.text: This taco joint is the bomb .com!!! I went here on a date and it was such a cool place. My date even really enjoyed it. It was both of our first time trying it here and we both left satisfied. I'm glad I only got one taco though because they were HUGE! The peach margarita was amazing too. I will definitely be back here in the near   10/31/2018 - Went back again today and I'm still just as obsessed with this place as I was before. My only wish was that they had a little more room for seating because I kept bumping the girl beside me. Aside from that, the food was awesome and the margaritas never disappoint.

Ggv-ciByLrRAdTYyVCU6Cg.text: I frequent Condado any time I'm in the downtown area.  The sweet lucy shell is amazing and I highly recommend the Queso Blanco.  The "build your own" concept allows you to get exactly what you want.  The margaritas are delicious as well.  One downside is that it is a bit cramped and can get very noisy.  That being said, I will still return!

ltmPyS3Z2yAVJyDmkxj__Q.text: Got the table quickly for our party. Server was very frazzled waiting on our table. Forgot to get water for 10-15 minutes after we asked. My food came out cold. I asked about it and was told something about all the ingredients being refrigerated... so now I'm supposed to believe that meat is served cold here. Server finally agreed that the meat is not supposed to be cold, and took it back to ask the kitchen remake it.   I didn't really have much of an appetite after the remake came out... the tacos were all drenched in sauce and the shells were moist and sticky. I just gave up after that. This place got 2 stars because the hostess was incredibly friendly and understanding, and the manager was great and refunded my purchase before I walked out. Rest of the group stayed and trucked on; hopefully they had a better experience than me.

VaJlW-TLsWHKT5uWCnbnDw.text: Condado is a great spot to have Downtown-- it's not fast food, but it's not a two hour commitment to have lunch either. The tacos and queso have always been solid. I was excited to see they opened up in Lawrenceville too-- we went there on their second day and were impressed with the service quality and food then, too.

iTYmIgaPSns6BcBfmx9lZw.text: Best tacos period! The juju taco shell is amazing, like a cheesy Gordita crunch from Taco Bell but with real cheese between the shells!! And unlike most "gourmet taco joints" these tacos are legit filling...like one or two and I'm stuffed (coming from someone who likes to try a lot of different things when I go to a restaurant this is kind of good and bad...but definitely NOT complaining) also, their monthly specials are usually pretty amazing

3uAQdvxGX6CCEE9gmlw7Jg.text: No tacos are created equal. My new year's resolution was to eat more yummy food and after this adventure I'm good. I've officially ate at all the taco spots downtown. This place is in my top list of tacos ever and it wasn't expensive for what I got. First, a build your own taco spot is genius. I went with the shrimp ceviche taco and a chicken taco and to no surprise the shrimp one was delicious. When it eventually fell a part I let my fork finish it off. It was jam packed with so much flavor. I'm still "Why haven't I been here earlier?" I love the decor and the service was great. The music had today's jams on it and the bar... Sheesh! You name it they have it and if you can't name it, they'll find you something you like. I definitely have to check this place out as they're always packed but there's a reason they're always packed. Good food is good food and they know tacos.

3pzXL1SAGv_n3Agdp1hxAw.text: Amazing build your own Tacos or specialty tacos from a menu.  Good atmosphere and a great selection of beers.

qTez8Z6ceIfoHmqw_hahig.text: The after contact with corporate was just as strange as our in restaurant experience.

NRbqxrJUEN0Sm_Irum6UZg.text: The tacos taste good enough so I gave it two stars. The marghereita is too but the tacos left me sick later that night. The shrimp and steak was undercooked. Get it right people you shouldn't be poisoning the community.

ZAsnpz_6e4Y6zM_KVvrpNw.text: Ordered chips and two different sauces. Sauces were great but the chips were fragments. Had to dip your chip in a broken off piece. Ordered a margarita. Very small for a 10 dollar margarita. I then order 3 build yourself taco and they were excellent. Their signature dishes were excellent however everything else was a little below par. I highly recommend the guacamole with artichoke balsamic dressing with delicious.
