nZiqDtPvCLGvtS7QtSZu9Q.text: Severely overrated. Servers were nice, place was clean  but the food.... you select your toppings on a card, I didn't see "extra lettuce" as a topping but it sure looked like we all selected it. The meat was cold on the pulled pork and the steak. My steak taco was ghost pepper marinated but even my wife who is sensitive to spice couldn't tasty and flavors standing out. I'd say the tacos are priced fairly but the rice and sour cream... way overpriced.

xNpqT5jV_VlGJc1i7JUkrg.text: Great spot for happy hour. Half off margaritas and discount on tacos. I usually get 2 tacos and I'm filled up completely. Tacos come out pretty fast so the waits usually aren't too long. Queso is also very tasty.

U242Vi3pQtYt2vkq7ZR1cg.text: I hate the hightop seating situation. Not handicap accessible. But the vegan tacos are very good.

Xyw2sH2PQVjN-YQLewn-wg.text: My GF and I were looking for a nearby dinner option after a play downtown on Saturday afternoon. We love tacos, so of course were stoked to see a taco place at the end of the block. We perused their menu in advance and were impressed.   The quick summary: Food            4.5 - Great menu and delicious!  Atmosphere 1.0 - Downright awful Service         2.5 - Solidly mediocre  Total             2.6 - Disappointing mixed bag.  *The Food* They have two primary options for tacos--a list of their suggestions or build your own. There are GREAT vegetarian options. Overwhelmed by the prospect of figuring out the right combination of mouth-watering items, I went with one each of their suggested vegetarian options: The Mantis (pulled BBQ Jackfruit) and the Dutch Dragon (portabellos). I also ordered sides of beans and rice.   We ordered chips and queso blanco to start. The chips appear to be house-made and the queso was tasty.   Both my tacos were great. Nice combinations of flavors and spices. They were of a decent size so two made a good meal. I did note that they did not have any soft corn tortillas, which was disappointing since a good homemade corn tortilla is a key component of a good taco. Even if they don't have the capacity to make their own, they're probably not a mile from La Reyna...just sayin'.  *The Service and Atmosphere* To be clear, I do not expect servers to be my best friend and I appreciate that it is not an easy job. That said, I expect competence, which requires the restaurant to ensure proper training and the server to put it to use. I note a few other reviews that point to lousy service as well, so it would seem that our experience was not unique and the FOH training is lacking.   The waitress asked if we'd been there before and when we said we hadn't, she did little more than point us to the papers on the table with pretty self-explanatory directions. She didn't know what horchata was or how to pronounce Jarrito's. My sides did not come out with my food (the waitress did not deliver the food). It took her a few minutes to come check in after the food was delivered and took a while more for the beans and rice to arrive after I asked for them. When they arrived, they were in the little plastic cups in which you'd get salsa to go, so I'd guess maybe  cup of each--at least they don't charge that much for them. My tacos were in a plastic basket with wax paper liner, so I had no way to eat the beans and rice (with my plastic spork) without making a big mess (the tiny plastic cups were filled to the top) and certainly no way to mix them together as I intended. A plate would have been a nice option, but the waitress dropped them on the table from over my shoulder, so I wasn't looking at her when she did and left, so by the time I processed what was in front of me, there was no opportunity to ask for one. I took them to go and had them the next morning with eggs--they were delicious.  The atmosphere in this place is AWFUL. The overall vibe is 20-something sports bar. It is SO OPPRESSIVELY LOUD, it feels like the noise is physically pushing you down. The free noise meter app on my phone read levels between 50-70 decibels. Everything in the restaurant is hard-tables, chairs, floor, brick walls, exposed ceilings--the whole industrial acoustic horror show plus loud music. The fact that the Pens were playing that night and there was a Pitt game didn't help things. There were large tables of young people ordering pitchers of pink alcohol and shots of tequila in mason jars and using the kind of voices generally associated with such things. Conversation was nearly impossible across the three feet of table between me and my girlfriend and obviously this does not help the servers do their job because they cannot hear you well.  Overall, it was a very disappointing experience. I'd definitely eat their food again, but only if I don't have to go into the restaurant.

n23N0R40j_PkWp6WXwKlQA.text: We are Condado regulars in our hometown, and decided to stop by this one while visiting Downtown Pittsburgh & were not disappointed! There was tons of seating on both levels and staff was friendly, this is a busier location but noise wasn't too much of a problem. We had a mixup with   our order (my husband accidentally ordered the wrong tacos ) and although it was his fault, our waiter still replaced the tacos with what he really wanted, we were very pleased! Great Condado location!

64UWUNdRmOhGyErHDnlrRw.text: Love getting the nachos, but as advertised--it's loud and crowds quickly. Try takeout for lunch, load them up & enjoy.

CE3FNUUhg1fLOz_xks0kPA.text: Very quality tacos, service is usually pretty good, a little bit pricey but overall worth the trip   Not the best tacos in Pittsburgh but very good ones

jjSETzPNPHqEnnGVKlL_iA.text: Another great Condado experience! The food was great and I can always count on a good eating experience here as someone with a serious gluten allergy. You need to get the queso! Our bartender, Christina, took great care of us and was very kind. Love this restaurant!

5zCe2xzZrveWkQlEcEthcQ.text: The food was great. It is self service, so you'll have to grab a pad of paper to create your own taco.  Try the non meat options like the mushroom, it was delicious. The spicy taco shell wasn't as great. However their guac was amazing! Dont miss out on it and they give you a lot of it, but you need to ask for it because it is not on the menu. Grab a seat at the bar because there is no wait. On the con side the bartender had a terrible attitude, acted put out each time I asked a questions, never asked me for another drink or how I was doing, except to give me the check.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The bar!

S7qszCLiE_uF9oXiZt10CQ.text: Super yummy, great atmosphere, busy but fantastic happy hour! I definitely recommend the place if your staying or visiting Pittsburgh. Even better note there are two locations.

-LDymmcyHbt-drsWpgc18Q.text: Good hearty tacos! Friendly service all around. Open late and located across the street from hotel I was staying at after a late night flight

CK8eZmvWqq_r5FJUb_5suw.text: This is a make your own tacos place, that also offers some pre-made tacos.   Me and my friends ordered some nachos and two or three tacos each, which ended up being more than enough. If you're only getting tacos I think two or three are fine, based on how hungry you are. They're pretty big and filling.  Nachos were nothing special. We had quite a lot left over but didn't box. We mostly just ate the free chips that they gave us, which were good. The tacos were also fine, but again nothing special. It kind of felt like they were going for the authentic but hip vibe with some of their ingredients, and it just didn't end up impressing me. None of the individual ingredients (and I tried to get a variety) were amazing. Just didn't live up to other tacos I've had, growing up in California.  All that being said, I see the appeal for make your own tacos and nice drinks in a hip environment at a reasonable price point. Also the murals, art, and service were all awesome!

ut2xjxOJLEI0BwzI-PupzQ.text: These. Tacos. Rule. I just had my world rocked trying Condado Tacos for the first time.  You're able to build your own or go with pre-made options (but you can make alterations if necessary).  The flavors were amazing, the quality ingredients rocked my mouth.  I forgot that one of my options (Dutch Dragon) had jalepenos on it, so I was facin' the heat with my mouth burning for a little before I remembered (I forgot to ask that they remove them).  My other taco was the Ooey-Gooey, substitute with the cilantro-lime sauce.  These tacos got me so PUMPED to go back that I am already planning it. The drop of a star is because our servers never came back to refill drinks until we were practically finished.  With my lil' taste buds simmering in the heat, I really would have liked better service in that (it might have been because we were sitting outside).  I will go back.  Soon.

KDtEC_g73pwwrqxZwMYQoQ.text: I used to go to this place a lot when it first opened. Everything from here tastes great. I love that you can create your own tacos, because that allows you to put as little or as much as you want on! Their queso blanco is also great! Taco shells and tortilla chips are wonderful as well, but s little greasy. They raised the prices on the tacos from 2$ to 3.50$ a piece which now I don't think is worth it so I only go during happy hour. Great margaritas!

6xuCg6UTCfgGvufI561-ew.text: When I came the first time with my girlfriends I had a great experience.  Then I brought my husband and child back on my sons 1st birthday for lunch to celebrate and our waitress ruined our experience.  She was rude, not friendly and left me feeling like myself and my son were annoying her.  I get this isn't the best place to take a child, but we were in the area and also celebrating surviving our first year at being parents.  We came for lunch, and we arrived there were only 3 other tables upstairs. I asked her for a kids menu and she said they didn't have one with a rude tone.  Even taking our order when we were asking about the chicken and whats on it she was sassy. Then my husband requested his order form back to identify what each taco was, since the menu is so large and she gave him attitude. Even when we got the check she had attitude.  We were only there for 35 minutes and for months I had been looking forward to taking my husband to this place.  Its really sad that our waitresses entire domineer ruined his experience.

2Rrr963x5cgF9DXVLSkWow.text: I've visited Condado on multiple occasions. I love that they have a variety of Tequila options because I mean who doesn't love a good Tequila. However, moving here from Texas, I'm not a big fan of their tacos. The tacos have too much going on. Simplicity is what makes a good taco.

OmADQXp6-wSEYNKyGjXrbw.text: I've been to Condado a few times now and it's always good! The place has a cool hip vibe. The downstairs is a little small but there is also plenty of seating upstairs. The one thing I don't like is they don't take reservations. They have so many flavors of margaritas and offer a flight for $15 which is so fab! Queso is amazing especially with the chorizo in it. The chips are salted to perfection. The tacos are build your own so you fill out exactly what you want on a little form at your table. They offer lots of options. $3.50 for a taco so prices are reasonable and also the tacos are a decent size. I had 2 and I was stuffed. I recommend the chorizo and shrimp. I really love the tortilla options too...goody goody is my personal fav. On my last trip there the server wasn't very nice and we had to ask twice for water but we did get our food really fast. If you're in the mood for some tasty tacos and margs this is the place to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

H58pQQMcerqAP4rXz4GR8Q.text: I LOOOOVE THIS PLACE!!! There dips are better than MAD MEX!! And there hasn't been a taco I've had that I didn't like!!! I've been craving it but I'm trying to behave! but who says I can't get one of those DELICIOUS margaritas!!!

Z-p9Sm1NGxPtHKTElifTzA.text: My all time favorite restaurant downtown. This place is the best. I work by condado and go here more often than I would like to admit. I always get the build your own nachos and then have tried many taco combinations. At other places I usually do not like to customize my own order as I have found its not as good as the specialties but this is not the case with condado. Every combination of taco I have made is delicious. Same with their suggestions. Everything is so good. Prices are great. Obsessed with this place. Worth the wait if there is a line.

m852LR6ES_pkD5zDOWa8nQ.text: I have heard wonderful things about Condado, so I decided to try it. I went yesterday (Tuesday) and to my pleasant surprise, they had a happy hour available from 5-7pm, which was half off certain drinks and $1 off tacos that are typically $3.50-$5 each. The waiting staff was helpful and quick to prepare food. I had the "Sweet Lucy" tortilla which is a mix of both hard shell and soft shell, with cheese and guacamole in between them. I added roasted chicken, veggies, and chipotle crema (a sauce that I highly recommend). Overall it was a great experience and I will be back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

MkG6vo8m5ZH3eqkIicMBfg.text: It was very busy so I was expecting some great food and service. Unfortunately we got neither. The tacos were not good and seemed to be made with cheap ingredients. Any college student could make these tacos in their dorm room. Our particular server was not very friendly and didn't seem to know the menu very well at all. Her answer to a lot of our questions was "I don't know." Then when we were ready to leave, instead of giving us a detailed receipt, she just said how much we owed. The prices she said were impossible to be correct. But she swore they were correct and gave us attitude when we questioned her. So only AFTER paying would she bring us a detailed receipt, which sure enough had many errors. Maybe she was new and the place was very busy so I'm sure the servers were stressed but everyone in our party was disappointed with the service and cheap tacos. I won't go here again

diDWaxEbYxbT1NV2UHz7KQ.text: This place was fantastic!  Busy, but worth the wait!!!    There is a bar and some tables upstairs, and then a bar and even more tables on the main floor.  It can be a little loud, but its a crowded spot, so that is expected, and the downstairs is a little dark, but its a fun, hip, modern dia de los muertos style atmosphere; the dim lights and the loud music is by no means a negative either, it just adds to the vibe of the restaurant.    Great tacos, margaritas, and guacamole!  I highly suggest the pineapple guacamole, it was so delicious with the sweetness of the pineapple playing with all of the other flavors, and the chipotle honey....I wish I had some right now!  The tuscan was also super delicious, but the pineapple was my absolute favorite, I wish I knew how to make it like this place, because I am salivating just thinking about it!  I love the idea of building your own tacos with a check off system,  but they also have taco suggestions, so you don't have to build your own of you don't want to.   My one coworker and I went upstairs for a drink and guacamole while we waited for others to arrive.  we sat at the bar, and once our friends came, we went downstairs for dinner.    I was with a pretty good size group (about 5 people) and we all did the build your own tacos and had margaritas. We also ordered the tres amigos with a salsa, a queso, and a guacamole.  We had worked a long day, and it was the last day of our work trip, so we were celebrating. My coworker and I were so excited to come here, that we made sure we ate light all day so we could eat as many tacos as possible!   Everyone enjoyed the food so much, we had wished we had time to come back again and again!  I know I will come back next time I am in Pittsburgh!

HKWeW7kVrI4zDMt6ROA_rQ.text: Pretty cool place! Only complaint is that the chicken is dry (almost every time I've gone), but if you know which sauces/toppings to add with that choice of meat then it's good. Happy hour prices are great!

xav-or3tToz2N1F_jJErQg.text: Love this place! It's a little tricky to figure out what to order at first, but the amazing staff will help you out with that  The double stacked tacos are awesome!! (Juju are my favorite) Hailey is the best!! Go here, you won't be disappointed!!

mkQj_2PxXS-4RYxY1KSE7w.text: Can someone please explain why everyone else thinks this place is so good. These tacos are just okay, the margaritas are really good but the tacos are just okay.

94H1Nb3eMsr6f4z_UPQtMA.text: I went to Condados with some girl friends and we were able to score some happy hour drinks at the bar before heading up to our table (although next time I will definitely try to the margarita flight). The menu is a build your own taco which is great because you can customize everything. We also shared a trio of dips which were flavorful without being too spicy.  I don't recall our exact order but there are many varieties of salsa and queso to try. This is definitely a great place for a group as there are tacos that will please anyone with any food restrictions.

0whyu7gCbSQG2Lp4HXV_Cg.text: I really loved the drinks and queso when I went here, and the atmosphere was great. It was the perfect place to come on a Friday night. For those with a low spice tolerance, beware that some of the taco options are pretty spicy though!

GCxBJrT0wJa9drD3be5QGw.text: I went to meet with some friends for margarita    Happy hour. I didn't stay long enough to review the service but I did stay for a taco. It's nice that they offer $3, $4, and $5 taco choices but the flavor was not for me.   I come from Texas where Mexican and tex-mex restaurants probably outnumber Starbucks so I was pleasantly surprised to have found a few restaurants nearby that mirrored those delicious dishes. The only downside outs none of my regulars had happy hour, which brought us to this establishment. Their taco fillings were definitely on the experimental fusion side but tasty. There was one my friend ordered that was completely vegetarian but tasted like pulled pork! Sadly any delicious taco can be crippled with a not so tasty tortilla. The surf n turf taco I ordered was served on a flour tortilla that tasted like those processed package ones you'd find at a grocery store, not like the homemade fresh ones mama makes. If you are going to buy from the store, it's best to just purchase corn. It would surprise and disappoint me further if  the tortillas were made in house.

-wA2GhLfNbwNfsWZ2KA2aA.text: Always amazing! The best tacos and margaritas and very reasonably priced! My favorite taco place in the city.

vd2s_cqgxuRrmtyhrrTssA.text: Best margarita ever. I don't even like tequila. I love that I could build as many different tacos as I wanted and that there were so many options! The beef brisket was so good and everything was super fresh. The staff was awesome; they were friendly, helpful, not overbearing, and it was busy tonight. We'll definitely be back (maybe as soon as tomorrow, who knows...)

9lJiAjM8HdeMOxdywAMGqA.text: If you are downtown and looking for tacos, this is the place to go!! Excellent food and atmosphere! Very reasonably priced and you can customize your tacos to get exactly what you want!

MFxaV7to3Dkq4lLIOO2iUA.text: Decent Mexican food in downtown Pittsburgh. Really enjoyed the vibe of the restaurant and the staff are incredibly helpful. I ended up grabbing dinner here with a coworker while in town for a conference.  The chips and guacamole are a definite go to move. The combination of the sweet salsa on top of the guac is a game changer. Ended up going with three tacos (two Carnitas and one beef) with a side of rice and beans, which were basic with average flavor.  Definitely worth a visit if you're craving Mexican food in downtown Pittsburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

zy0ycg7VN6_Bdu8MZZwTRw.text: Yum yum yummy!  Just went here for lunch. They don't use any flavor enhancers (Sazon or MSG). The food was DELICIOUS and so cheap!  We already want to go back for dinner. Lol

iVbaL0W-Qb1dv7WrovTQKQ.text: Great service first and foremost . Taco's Tuesday !!!! I love the selection they offer . Make sure you try the Lucy taco it is on point .

ZCSNfvNmstSlST_KBhnRbA.text: Meh, the tacos are okay. I really don't like the tortillas (tastes store bought) they use and I usually leave here feeling like I'm not 100% satisfied. I do like the concept of creating your own tacos but I also don't trust myself with making a great taco either. There are better options for tacos in the area. Hard pass for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

QhjCrGLS7w1vOm2N5PwZzQ.text: This was a pretty mixed experience, that I'll describe in chronological order. When I first arrived, I had to wait near the door until the host would sit the 2 guests ahead of me, and then take my name. However, the host completely ignored the couple, and took a phone call instead that required him to jot down the order for pick-up. There were plenty of open tables and the couple was rightfully outraged and chided the host for being rude and thoughtless. Considering it was noon, I was surprised it was so empty, but I also did not see anyone eating any food. Seemed like the service was awful, as was confirmed by the host, and then of course when I was finally seated at a table for 4, it took a while before a server came to us. 1 star.  Tale of two cities. The food was amazing. I got 3 tacos including the taco of the month for January - Beefy Lucy Taco. The shells were all great, the Lucy was even a bit spicy. The hard shell was surrounded by a soft shell to keep things neat. Each taco was equally delish, and the server even came around for a drink refill 0- halleluhaj(sp?) I'll definitely go back, but will be wary of the service before making it a more regular destination.

i5WcSATCR01JrQf432z2XA.text: This place is totally buzzing and has a great visual feel but was disappointing in food and service.   As a disclaimer, I'm full Mexican and I've been living in LA for three years. I swung through with a group of people that are also all from California. With this in mind, we arrived trying not to have any expectations about how the food would be.   We had a pretty big party (around fifteen) but we were brought upstairs and seated at two adjacent tables, with impressive timing for such a packed place. We grabbed an order of guac and a pitcher of their prickly pear margarita while we decoded the build-your-own menus. Along with our guac, the waitress brought us two paper boats of tortilla chips and two bowls of salsa.   The chips, while they were made of thick tortillas and looked decent, were not warm at all. One boat had a pile of tiny little bits and pieces that were useless for dipping. They were still somewhat tasty, but the cold chips threatened a stale taste and texture.   There are many ways to make salsa, and everyone's recipe is different, but their green salsa really needed work. Maybe it's about sourcing their ingredients, but it had a sourness/acidity that made it obvious the tomatillos either weren't ripe or weren't well-balanced with salt and chile. It was very watery, and was not spicy at all. The red salsa also needed salt, but had good flavor. For the guac we ordered, apart from a very small portion for the price, it had next to no flavor and a mushy consistency that wasn't really appetizing. The pickled red onions on top were a confusing addition.   We had been told the pitcher would cover about four and a half margaritas, and at such a high price point, it was a little sad to see we were juuuuust making it to four portions, some a bit short. The mason jars were a cute touch, though, and we appreciated the ability to split the cost of a pitcher. The flavor did not resemble a prickly pair, and it was very light on tequila, but it was sweet and refreshing.   I ordered one chorizo and one sweet chili tofu taco. In retrospect, the sweet chili sauce flavor made no sense to combine with any salsa and toppings present so that was a mistake on my part. There was no option for soft corn tortillas, which was hugely disappointing, as that is literally how tacos work. I opted for flour instead, and they were cold and sad. My tacos were presented to me mummified in foil and were very small and bare bones.   The chorizo alone was enough to make me pretty upset. It was not a chorizo, at all. I don't understand why it's sold as chorizo. The pale coloration, the ground up texture, and the very strange spice gave no indication it was anywhere close to the hot, deep red and chunky meat it is meant to be.   The service unfortunately did not save the dinner as it could've. It took us forever to flag down the waitress and ask for a glass of water and a salt shaker, as we had no condiments at our table. Upwards of fifteen minutes later, she finally pops by with three cups, with the salt nowhere in sight, and never brought to us. It was even longer to flag her down for the check- maybe fifteen or twenty straight minutes of waving every time she speed walked by and never getting her attention. It was twenty minutes between her printing the bill and us trying to get her to pick it up. Overall we wasted about an hour just trying to get out, and we were all really frustrated.   It was obviously popular, and I can't deny it was pretty hip and cool, but I wouldn't want any of my friends to come here. The food is beyond recognition, and the few servers around couldn't work fast enough to balance the packed restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tofu and chorizo tacos
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Prickly pear margarita
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Guacamole

fHrHf6gu6YKQVUXttiZAZw.text: The taco was moist and satisfying and it just melted in my mouth. Right as I walked in the man offered me a cold, hard bar stool that I gladly covered with my seat. As I was getting started wiping my mouth of the creamy goodness, the bartender served up a dripping, ice cold, margarita that quenched my thirst like never before. I will indeed be returning to satisfy my taco cravings

kOCGL0kxaOvnEWwvE1H0yA.text: After hearing so many good things I finally got to try Condado Tacos for myself on cinco de Mayo. They had great specials for the occasion too. We got a pitcher of strawberry margarita and the traditional guacamole to start. The guacamole had a nice bite to it which I really liked. I loved getting to make my own tacos. I made one with most of the hot or spicy ingredients and two with the ju ju tortillas. The ju ju tortillas were delicious and will definitely be my go to for now on. Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Ey68k5hOkfTnS_ys0wVe_A.text: Condado Tacos opened up on the corner in downtown Pittsburgh in what used to be a spot occupied by Tonic Bar & Grill. Tonic wasn't bad, but I think Condado is extremely creative and has amazing potential when you compare it with Tonic. Condado's affordability and flair combined with my love of tacos makes me wonder why I waited this long to try it, but I'm glad I finally paid it a visit to see what the hype was about.  It was lunch hour, and I don't eat out often, but a friend of mine is a big fan and suggested we go to Condado as a payday treat to ourselves. She was raving about the queso, so as soon as we arrived we put in an order for it. The queso was fantastic, gooey, warm, and everything you want in a bowl of melty cheese. They had some other queso options aside from the classic plain queso, and I took an order of the dirty queso home to enjoy. The dirty queso had beans, shredded chicken, and a hot pepper sauce in it that was to die for!  Next we were on to ordering our tacos. It's a simple process, you get a sheet and a pencil and check off what you'd like on your taco. One of my favorite things was the special taco shells. I tried the Sweet Lucy, which was a hard shell and a soft shell with queso and guac in between the shells. It was so good! I got one of my two tacos plain soft taco style, and the shell ripped apart and made it hard to eat. Go for the hard and soft shell combo, you won't regret it. The first of my two tacos was the sweet chili tofu, which was delicious. If anything they could've been more generous with the tofu rather than loading up on toppings, but it was still good. The other that I chose was a chicken taco. It wasn't that the chicken wasn't good, but it was cold. I'm not a fan of cold chicken at all, especially not in tacos. There were a good bit of toppings on it, but it shouldn't have been straight-out-of-the-fridge cold. The flavors were there, but I'm going to be wary of ordering chicken again here because of this.  Overall, for 2 sauced up tacos, an order of rice, beans, and sour cream (all $1 each), and an order of dirty queso to go, my total was around $20. Not bad for a lunch and a takeaway of queso with a big bag of chips. I'd come back to Condado, but maybe just for margaritas and queso next time. I'd definitely give the tacos another chance at some point, but I'm not in a rush.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sweet Lucy shell tofu taco and a chicken taco! So delicious

jmsVgqMq0v_YncB6HV_omg.text: Just happened upon this restaurant/bar while partaking of the International Jazz Festival last Sunday evening around 5pm.  A lot of restaurants were closed even though this major event was taking place -- not great planning on business's part, I'd think.   Anyway, after walking around seeing most places not open, we spotted Condado Tacos and strode in.  Soooo very glad we did!  First of all it's enticing just visually -- all around you is art -- on the walls, on the stairs (don't forget to look at those stairs)!   I was impressed by that alone.  We sat at the bar and the bartender was very friendly and helpful.  We ordered some tacos and were given some chips and salsa.  I had shrimp in mine and was very happy, indeed.  When all was said and done and eaten, the final bill was around 20 dollars for the two of us.  I'd say that was a fair meal and a tasty one, too!  When I posted pics of this place on FB, I was surprised when several of my friends said it was their favorite taco place.  Why the heck am I just finding out about it??  Well, at least I have now!

DT29me7gxp67wB-pHQYfVA.text: Had a great lunch hear on a recent weekend in Pittsburgh.  You can construct your own tacos from a checklist or pick from some pre-designed ones if the options are overwhelming,  A decent selection of veggie options, including BBQ jackfruit and a good selection of beers.  The double wrapped tacos, with one hard shell and one soft were definite winner.

EKkGuVmfDxECrwVm6iXiew.text: I visited for lunch with my Dad and we were seated right away, which was a surprise for prime lunch time on a Sunday.  We sat on the small stools and tables in the center near the bar, sitting is very tight here.  We ordered the guacamole, the chips were not my favorite but we received a decent portion of guacamole.  I ordered the Kahlo margarita which had fresh lime and mint and was very fresh and not incredibly sweet.  I did a build your own taco and Lucy's fire taco, I would recommend going with a preselected one.  Lucy's fire taco was delicious and it will definitely be what I order the next time I visit.

Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lucy&#39;s Fire
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kahlo marg

DV5hLsU-hSLF_pZDgMyjHA.text: My husband was visiting Pittsburgh and came here a few months ago..he literally called me right after to tell me about how great the tacos were and how he HAD to bring me here. We came on a Friday evening, this place was BUSY...it is extremely popular, however I must say that the wait wasn't that long.   I very much enjoyed my tacos (I think I enjoyed the ones I 'built' myself rather than the pre-done ones already on the menu). I won't even bother to specify what I had because I had several (and am ashamed) and I think you'll be happy with whichever you choose. The sangria is ok, not to toot my own horn but I think I can make better at home...also the pitcher is of poor value because it was mostly ice.   Some negative points to note:  There are no fish taco options  You cannot order the refried beans without bacon (my mother in law is vegetarian and was really disappointed by this)  The service really is not that great, I do have to echo what I saw some others have said here. I took away a star for the service: our server was not attentive to the table, we had to ask for water and even then it took 20 minutes from someone to bring it...of course when we asked for the check, they brought that SUPER quickly :/

Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The decor

pzV-VPPQumgoieNLDuiauA.text: Hands down the best happy hour place to go. Quick bite and a few drinks along the way. They have a piece of paper which you customize your own tacos that are filled with toppings and varieties. Margaritas are perfect and the food was great.

GUvVKVMFZpDmvM-fIrC01g.text: I love this place. It's fun to make your own taco and the price can't be beat (especially in the bar during happy hour). I feel like I'm always making crazy taco combinations and I can never remember what I did to create a favorite, but that's also half the fun - making it up as you go.

yO5eLkMCuulUrkETVzekaQ.text: I was just here again last night, prior to going to the comedy club for improv night. I have to say this is my favorite taco place in Pittsburgh. Their proportion to price ratio, fresh tasting ingredients and choices are so good.   Last night, I had a dinner with a vegetarian and I should mention that they were very please with their options for ordering. We split the queso (w/ corn) and were very pleased.    I also got the surf n'turf taco as well as the Dutch Dragon. I get the Dutch Dragon every time, I absolutely loved all the vegetables and fresh tasting combination with both the hard and soft shells.  You can build your own, but I love Condado's suggestions and have yet to get one I did not like.   Atmosphere: It is a little loud, so if you are looking to have a serious in depth conversation it may not be your best option, especially on weekends.   Service: I've always had great service there and the staff is always on top of things and keeps things moving so even if there is a line out the door on weekends. The wait was only 20 min last night and they text your cell phone when your table is ready so we walked around downtown for a little bit.   Happy Hour: Although I was not there for happy hour last night, it is a place I frequent. Their tacos (downstairs only) are all $1 off and you can get $3 margs (including their special vs the original). If we want tacos for happy hour, this is without a doubt the place we will go.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

7Re55RZuXaf7gkwraXYDrg.text: Delicious tacos! You will not be disappointed! Upstairs and downstairs bar. Gets busy and cramped if you go at prime times but they serve quick. Endless combinations as you can opt for the build your own option. Vegetarian options are great too. Also lots of fun queso options. I've been here several times and the spice level has varied across visits but we usually go to for the Diablo queso. Bathrooms haven't always been the cleanest unfortunately, but it's a bar downtown so I think it happens. If you love tacos and haven't been to Condado yet, get there!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Elote queso
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Margarita
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

S66p9qu_nMbT72PVPgI9Gg.text: This place is amazing! Be sure to plan accordingly because it gets packed. Perhaps it was extra packed because of Memorial Day weekend but I can imagine it being busy in a Friday night. We were able to get in right when it opened and sat on the second floor. The waiter immediately greeted us with water and asked if we wanted to start our Memorial Day off right with a shot of tequila We had to pass but they have an open bar for anyone wanting a drink or two.   The way the ordering works is similar to ordering sushi. There are pads of paper that have a variety of ingredients from your tortilla to protein to salsas.   They also have a pad of "suggestions" of taco creations. You can also make taco to go which they prepare after bringing your dine in order our.   I will definitely be back to have the goody goody! It was delicious! I got that with one chicken and one brisket - sour cream, salsa and cheese. The goody goody comes with sour cream, guacamole and some crunchy goodness. Good thing they brought my order sheet back so I can share it.   The service was good and the price was affordable.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

MmlIOPIyPJ1ntVuRLNJdOg.text: Ugh I feel like such a hater but I just didn't have a great experience here, despite all the hype. Don't get me wrong it was absolutely not bad. But Pittsburgh has so many Mexican food restaurants, and this was very underwhelming to me. We got a trio of dips and the guac tasted very store bought to me :( I made my own tacos, so me not liking them could very well be my fault, but everything was just small and didn't stand out. To be fair, it's very inexpensive. The atmosphere is great and I would absolutely go back and maybe not try to make such a fun taco and just do something basic, I might have been just doing too much. Overall, just wasn't loving it.

C7EjS8nKJ-ZjMI82Aezryg.text: Taco menu is pretty cool cause you can literally put whatever you want on it. Chips and queso are good. Skip the salsa verde, it like the margarita pitcher is incredibly watered down and not worth the price. We asked for more tequila in the marg pitcher bc it literally tastes like simple syrup on ice and the waiter said it came from a premise mix... nough said. Not to mention our waiter got us to get the blood orange margarita bc he already had one made yet it still took 5-10 minutes to get to the table. We expressed how disappointed we were by the margs (as evidenced by no one drinking it) and he took it and the mostly full pitcher off the table. Skip this place if you're going for drinks, but the food is decent and fairly priced.

bqiv5Z11sgogh2TipsT7aQ.text: We went a couple of days ago for a late night meal and drinks and the service was great! Our waitress made sure to sit with us and explain how everything worked and recommended us a couple of amazing drinks.  I was surprised to see that they have a lot of vegetarian/vegan options also, which caught my attention due to my little sister's recent change in diet.  In short: a lot of options, decent price, good service. Definitely coming back!

ChzrEegykxf4aWOlMHAqBA.text: One of my favorite taco places. Their margaritas and tacos both are some of the best I've ever had and I live in the taco capital of Austin, Texas. I even told the bartender/owner that they would kill it in Austin, the make-your-own taco menu is the best I've seen. Their Blood Orange margs and Delicioso margs are the best. Don't get anything but the sweet Lucy, it's heaven in a taco shell. Their ghost pepper marinated steak is heaven on earth as well. Overall an awesome place and I hope they expand to Austin!!!

Oy4m5kuyPtWA761aI_DJqg.text: Food was great but service unacceptable.   We had made a reservation for 9 people several weeks before but when we arrived the sat us at two tables. We had to ask three time before they gave us one table for all of us. When we called for the reservation they said nothing about seating us at two separate tables.   Several of us ordered three tacos but only received two tacos. No one came around to check on how the food was or if we received everything.   After we were finish eating no one cleared the plates for 30-40 minutes.

WEfuBHMbg0MwbXzpB_o6tw.text: This actually may be my new favorite taco spot in Pittsburgh. I just really love the vibe. The food is good and the price is right on point with what you should pay for tacos in a Downtown Pittsburgh location. There is a downstairs and upstairs, giving it plenty of space for patrons.  You build your own tacos here. You fill out a form of what you want and the quantity you want. They also have a few "house" recommended ones on another form you can fill out. Great variety on everything from taco shells, meat, and sauces. You could make a TON of different tacos if you wanted. I had three totally different tacos. I loved them all! We also ordered an order of chips with gauc + two salsas. I think that was actually my favorite part. I lied... the pitcher of peach margaritas was my favorite part.  I will be back like 1000 times.

LqpYFO6lYE6RkMAGUF4j5Q.text: Get a taco, any taco, with brisket.  Really that's all you need to know. You can come in and order their pre-made tacos or build your own. I built one of mine with brisket, then two more with pulled pork. The brisket was definitely the wiser choice.  It was prime time on a Friday night so the place was pretty packed, but we really only waited 10 minutes or so for four of us.  Great introduction to Pittsburgh for me.

Ne1iQCId3OHTr41G5rswXA.text: Wow! Super fresh tacos, priced extremely reasonably $3.5-$5 each. Great service and cool vibe. I'll definitely be coming back

icF2xanOMtGan-DrGAkhdw.text: I have mixed feelings on Condado. On one hand, I liked the decor and the overall vibe of the place, and I generally liked my tacos; but on the other hand, I was super overwhelmed and unsure of the create your own taco menu.   It could have honestly been a combination of not being sure how all the toppings would taste with the proteins I chose and the lack of description/explanation from our server. Basically, I happened to make a few lucky choices and enjoyed my meal. My friends went through the same battle and, while a few of us chose the exact same taco, they looked completely different. One girl appeared to have the table's portions of cilantro entirely in one taco, other tacos were missing guacamole, and the sauces on a few were completely skipped. I think a quality control check is needed!  Lastly, they had a million different menus. I don't get it. There was a create your own taco menu, a premade taco menu, a drink menu with beer/liquor and then some other drink menu. Just combine them. Too much going on, too many moving parts.   I'm willing to take another shot at Condado because I did enjoy the flavors, I just hope it's easier for me to navigate the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

_aVa5AmZZI1nzh7ECrajHw.text: Absolutely love this place. I have to come here every time I'm in Pittsburgh!! The queso diablo is to die for and the tacos are banging. The staff rocks and the environment is all around awesome!

HLd6DRaS401f1arVRXZcvA.text: Great margaritas and cool atmosphere! Also fantastic options for vegetarian and vegan.

pRdjl5r5dDMxSnEUMKUZZA.text: Came here on a Wednesday night with a friend to try the much talked about tacos. I'll be candid and say that I was not a fan of this place for 3 reasons: 1. The tacos are mediocre. I'm a pretty tough critic because my comparison is living in Austin, TX for 4 years, in the land of tacos. The meat in both my tacos was cold when it arrived. We also ordered queso and chips and the cheese congealed even before we paid the bill (there is a way that the queso gods make it that doesn't congeal...I don't know what it is, but I've had it) 2. The ordering system is less than ideal. They give you two columns of filling in open bubbles for what you'd like...the problem is, that doesn't allow you to order multiple tacos of different ingredients. I had to choose 2 tacos and pick exactly what shell, filling, and topping I wanted. Or I had to write the quantity in the open box for the same exact taco. This is limiting. 3. The space itself is SO tiny. I was practically eating at the tables of other people and in their conversations.  The wait staff had to squeeze by every single table when running to and from the kitchen. I can imagine this bothers them, so it has to bother the eaters at their establishment.   I think with a change in the menu, some alterations of seating, and some study of better ingredients this place could be better, but I'm just not sold.

l2W6jK8z_U0o2hW3z5tXAA.text: Tacos are great service is ok. They always seem busy. Favorite taco is the bbq pork thing they do warped in the Ooey-gooey shell.

SQ5hnuwP9jmJM3_MlvOnmQ.text: This was tough for me. And I will write an updated review when it's not Cinco de Mayo and I actually consume their food.  First issue: time proximity was "2 drinks", literally that's what they said. Which in retrospect is probably just their way of getting me to drink. I'm thinking 30-45 minutes. Even though we left we still did not receive a text until over 2 hours  later. My issue here is that if it's going to be long and it's going to be 2 hours just let me know. I'll have my drinks and leave. When we asked (an hour in) how long, they wouldn't give us any estimate? Just kept saying "a long time". At least tell me how many people were in front of me!  Another thing: honestly the margs were not that good. They were ok.   I don't like non up front answers and I don't like withholding information on how long the wait may be. Needless to say we left and got Italian food.

MEZpuhKt2-9ifDSwLavaxQ.text: Great food.. left out an order of nachos on take otherwise would be 5 stars.. corn and soft taco shells has great texture..  Bubba Kush.. MUST TRY... GREAT FLAVORS.  created my own with beef brisket... loved it.  From Virginia would travel back just to eat there again

s5QihnIJrRqueb70BU-Juw.text: We enjoyed the food and service here! Went on a Saturday night and only had a short wait. On the loud side, but you got expect that on a Saturday night.

2aRqRX7cPYG9vI4yFfCsvQ.text: It's a shame that their food was amazing but the service was unbelievably terrible. I will not recommend Condado Tacos to anyone.  Condado Tacos was a 10 minute walk away from our hotel so we thought it'd be nice to walk and explore the city instead of driving there. Upon arrival, the hostess explained about the happy hour special and the upstairs seating situation. We opt to eat upstairs and pay everything regular price because we were starving (and a bit tired).   Downstairs has a pub/bar style going on, and upstairs is your regular hippy, cool, relaxed Mexican restaurant. Our waitress asked if we've been here before and if we knew how to order - we told her no. So she went on to taking our drinks order and left. We thought the drinks would come quickly so she'll explain how things work here when she's back, but after a pretty long wait, not only were we still waiting for the drinks, we were left there confused with the menu. I had to flag her down and ask, which is when she finally told us how to make your own taco and write them down on the sheets. She also reassured us to start small and order more later on because the service here is very fast.  We ordered 2 drinks initially, then we got 2 Bubba Kush, 2 Chronic Tortilla Fritos, and 1 make your own taco. One of our drinks finally came, then the Fritos and our self-created taco arrived. Almost finishing our meal, I reminded our server about our second drink. This was after waiting for about 15 minutes for our food and drinks, and at least another 15 minutes into our meal, and we were still waiting for our second drink. With no apologies, our waitress disappeared once again, and was back with our second drink after awhile.   And it just gets worse...we were done with the Fritos and taco, we were just sitting there and chatting, because we expected our 2 Bubba Kush to eventually arrive. After being in the restaurant with no attention from our server, and waiting for the rest of our food for about 20 minutes after finishing all our food on the table, we gave up. We asked for the bill and left.   Don't get me wrong, the tacos were amazing, but the service was unbelievable - even though she had some cool purple lipstick on. I'd rather go to McDonalds for a better time.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

jVRVFSi9biEQVhSbl5RlEQ.text: I went here with a new group of friends I met in Pittsburgh, and the food fueled us to have a great time. Condado Tacos has tacos already set with their combo of ingredients, but they also have the option to make your own. I went with the Dutch dragon, which had spicy portabella mushroom, cabbage, and the regular fixings like salsa and corn. The special thing about this restaurant's tacos is that they have a hard shell that's wrapped in a soft shell, held together by guacamole. I've never seen anything like this. You get two different textures with just one bite. It's truly a revolutionary idea. If you want to try something other than a taco, they also have a purple haze bowl. This bowl had tofu, red cabbage, and pickled onions. The pickled onions were a very nice touch and added depth to the dish. I would definitely go back to Condado Tacos to satisfy my taco cravings.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. purple haze bowl
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. dutch dragon

ea-zL1PMjwH2I1cn20ajzQ.text: Great tasting tacos with lots of options. I tried a margarita flight with three different flavors but they honestly all tasted the same and weren't very strong.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

jkUds4jBHR4OFFT66x5_hg.text: Pittsburgh seems to be getting a lot of hipster taco joints lately, and you know what?  I ain't mad about it.  The Mexican food scene around here is pretty weak because we don't have much of an immigrant population to speak of, so not a lot of options if you're like me and love going to a hole in the wall with someone's Abuela in the kitchen, you know?  And you know what?  I ain't really mad about that either.  I lived in SoCal for 8 years and had all that time to get my fill since my own Abuela went to see Jesus decades ago.    Anyway, I am happy that tacos have taken on a life of their own outside of a cheesy Mexican restaurant chain context, much like pizza has.  Their MTO concept is a teensy bit confusing at first, but once you get the hang of it, it's cool.  They even have some pre-made combos for you to choose from, which is what my friend got because she didn't trust her judgment to put together a good taco.  She says they were good, but pretty loaded and filling.  I myself went pretty simple, limiting myself to about 3 ingredients including the protein.  They were very good, but I was a little taken aback by the corn tacos being hard shell and not soft like the street tacos I'm used to.  It's not necessarily a bad thing, but something to take note of if you're not into hard shell.  A couple of my tacos were chicken, and the meat was very juicy and can make the shell soggy if you don't get to it quick enough, so heads up.  We also split an order of the guac and it had a nice little kick to it.   One thing to note is that the HH specials is just in the downstairs bar area.  If you want a table upstairs, you'll probably have to wait because the place isn't that big to begin with, and it draws a nice crowd if there's a game in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chips &amp; guac round this meal out
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chips &amp; guac round this meal out
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 2 chicken and 1 brisket MTO taco

l4ntXgO5H5KYV5-hwSI8Eg.text: Me and my date decided to go there for dinner. The guy told us that there was one couple ahead of us. So we decided to wait. He said he would text us when our table is ready. So I gave him my name and number, and we walked around the city. That was around 6:30pm on a Friday night. Two hours went by and we still haven't gotten a text. What a waste of time.

RoNh_5flTqIlCauWt1xPMg.text: Love the artsy and attention grabbing scenes painted on the walls. Lots of great items to choose from, many of which were celiac-friendly. I haven't had something i didn't like! And the servers / bartenders are really accommodating and on time.

5B5_JVRTeB8FKBSLI_ZzpQ.text: Condado tacos is often touted as one of the best tacos in Pittsburgh. As someone who travels regularly to Texas and grew up visiting Texas and eating fantastic Tex Mex and Mexican food Condado tacos is only average in Pittsburgh.  It's be closed in months in any area South with any semblance of actual Mexican cuisine Tex mex or more authentic.  The key point of any Mexican restaurant is do they have fresh tortillas? Flour or corn and Condado's tacos are some of the worst tortillas I've ever had.  The only reason I give Condado 3 stars is their dips such as salsa and queso are a solid choice. Their specials on drinks and price isn't too bad for downtown Pittsburgh either.  I'd love to share with you more about the actual taco which sans the horrible tortilla was sub-par. There's just not positive comments about their tacos.  Go down the road to the Strip instead.

AMd6xdpRXcFE16G3njntFg.text: Spent a lot of time there during Pride weekend!!!!  So much fun, so many new friends made!!!! Though I'm especially partial to my friend V, bartender extraordinaire, best fresh margaritas anywhere!!!!  Love their tacos and the wild list of choice ingredients and toppings available - only a wee bit disappointed that the only fish offering was ceviche - I'd have loved to have had a great grilled or blackened fish taco, but the steak was pretty amazing!!!!  Definitely a place I'll visit often and take some friends with!!!

xFSq0IHFZbCdgZY7rDZI9A.text: This was our first time trying Condado with some friends on a Friday night and all I can say is...best tacos in Pittsburgh! I loved it here and the create your own taco option was great. There were so many creative options to choose from and the flavors were great. Definitely something different than any ordinary taco I would usually order. We also had the queso as an app. Their queso was fantastic! They also have delicious margarita options and a huge drink menu to select from. I had the blackberry and strawberry margarita and it was awesome. I even tried my friends mojito, which I normally wouldn't order, but it was also delicious. The only downfall was service was a bit too slow, but the food and drinks made up for it. We can't wait to return!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

VGENLbKNhsgNWFxwTAQ2jQ.text: Well, one shouldn't go to a hipster taco place expecting anything remotely resembling authentic tacos, but even so the flavors were all underwhelming. There are so many toppings that they all just end up muddy, the sauces either cancel each other out in their mildness or are just spicy without flavor, and neither the chorizo nor jackfruit proteins really had much seasoning. It's fine for the price, especially at happy hour, and it's not bad, but it's not food that I especially enjoy eating.

wg2JayxryhXjwGt5ybjI6w.text: I have been wanting to try Condado for quite some time and it did not disappoint! As a new staple in the cultural district, and downtown in general, Condado is an awesome choice that doesn't break the bank and that's sometimes hard to find downtown!   The atmosphere is unique and exciting with two floors, both featuring their own full service bar! I went on a Saturday around noon before an event at the convention center and we were able to get a table without a wait.   The menu features both create-your-own tacos ad well as predesigned tacos. I decided to go with the ones they had created! I ordered an ooey gooey and and el tradicional. They ooey gooey rocked my world while the other left me wanting more. I didn't love the soft corn tortilla. We also split an order of queso and be prepared for a huge bowl to come your way. I don't ever do Mexican without queso and this didn't disappoint.   When the bill came and all was said and done it was $12...I was full, happy, and ready to go! I can't wait to go back and design some of my own tacos next time and check out more of their queso varieties!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

5fa8OU4Oy2Ww-LrCFWqDfw.text: Condado is a great spot for some delicious tacos in the Cultural District. One of the best parts about Condado is the affordability, which is often hard to find in that area of town.   I stopped in for lunch with a friend on Saturday afternoon. There was plenty of availability for seating, both upstairs and downstairs.   I ordered the blanco queso and two tacos: one surf and turf and one bubba kush. The queso was divine and there was so much of it--your dollar goes far here. The tacos arrived almost a minute after the queso (the service was so fast!) and they were also delicious. The bacon black beans on the Bubba Kush taco were smokey and delicious. I also enjoyed how the crunchy corn tortilla was wrapped in a flour tortilla, so you get the crunch but everything holds together. The surf and turf taco (only $5!) comes with steak and shrimp ceviche. The flavor was excellent but there were so many flavors going on that it was hard to find the ceviche at times, though everything still tasted great.   Condado is affordable with some excellent tacos! You can also build your own, but I decided to go with the recommended combinations and was not disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Some recommended combinations
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The menus

3Cqx2Q3Pq3P0mGS6jX7Ntw.text: I built my own tacos again. This time was much more enjoyable. I focused on less ingredients and more flavors. The chorizo is very flavorful and will be my go to meat when I come here for tacos. I also got a taco with the brisket and I'd never do that again. It was soaked from the juice it sits in and made the whole taco fall apart. The honey chipotle sauce is delicious and it compliments mostly everything.   The basil blueberry margarita was overrated sadly. I tasted no basil and the blueberries were lack luster. I tasted mostly just tequila and nothing else.   I still find this place to be a unique taco restaurant in Pittsburgh and it's enjoyable every time.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

l6NxN6ksfwXpg3_XKAZm-w.text: If I were basing this review on the taste of the food and ambience alone, this would be a five star review. I consider myself to be a bit of a queso connoisseur and in my opinion, they have the best in the city. The chips are thick and served fresh. The taco offerings are unique and flavorful. I love the option to build-your-own with a sheet to fill out at your table so you can take your time and really think about all of the wonderful combinations you could make, but their house creations are excellent too. My favorite is the El Santo. The decor is fun (those skull lights, swoon!) and the atmosphere is lively, especially at happy hour.   As for why I knocked off a star.... the sides are cheap but the portions are very small - the guac was just okay and the bacon refried beans were extremely disappointing. For some reason, they reminded me of old KFC mashed potatoes in both taste and texture. Yeah, kinda gross. Also, every time I've been here, the service has been somewhere between awful to mediocre. Don't get me wrong, it's not going to stop me from coming back for that sweet, sweet queso. But I really wish it could be served to me by someone who seemed to actually enjoy their job.

6Rq9Dh22mzVJLKMiuK-qVA.text: The tacos were great, but the service was slow and it was hard to hear. It took some time to look through the menu and construct the tacos, but once the order went in they came out in a reasonable time. The table I was sat at with a friend of mine was also too small to hold to people's meals and the large paper towel/menu holder they put there.

hCJU_Wv-gEiBa2X-l4rWlA.text: Food was amazing, service was incredibly slow. I work in the industry so I get it but when I say I need one more minute to finish my order, don't come back 10 minutes later. Then my friend and I were half way done with our food before the waitress came out to ask how everything was considering she didn't run us our order. Then we waited and waited until she saw we were finished for her to bring us our bill. It was around 2pm when I came in and was 1 of 3 tables my server had.

PYo46TDEKTYba5OyT4K2tQ.text: I am a huge fan of Mexican and this place is on the top of my list for Tacos! The pricing is very reasonable and the menu is great! I love the build your own taco but Lucy shell is my favorite! its a hard shell with a layer of cheese and then a soft shell! This is the best taco base to get!!   They also have awesome cheese dipping sauce! They have seasonal dips as well and they are always creative and flavorful!   I am so excited they opened another location in Lawrenceville!

WupxIvgmyzbmBjcbv3FuVA.text: Unique and tasty tacos. Lots of great choices for tacos and margaritas. The place has a cool vibe, too.

n_y8j6wZ6dnz-rKjLPVBbw.text: Once again, my fellow yelpers did not steer me wrong  The tacos at Condado are slammin'. Pretty much because you choose what you want on them, and I make the best tacos sooo lol love the causal ambience and decor, was pleased with the seating options (upstairs vs. downstairs) & the cherry on top is their variety of bourbon options. Was so happy to find a place near the convention center that is open late! Definitely recommend this spot for a chill night out of the hotel room. The only reason they're not getting 5-stars is because I ordered my food before everyone else at the bar & I got served last  lol was totally worth the wait though!

c2Nr_9uxasngmvlwcAdCZg.text: Looking for a quieter place with great Tacos, then this is your place. I had two tacos. One had the house made shell and the other was flour and corn with queso and guacamole. I had pulled pork in both with a mild salsa. I did two different types of sauces and both were good. Tacos were made fast. I also enjoyed the margarita of the month. Giving a four star because I wasn't offered much advice on how the ordering worked, I just had to figure it out.

08UeK1DFaAfD_cZr0peRKQ.text: Bowl was really good. Better than chipotle. Wish i was able to add jalapenos, other than that food was awesome. Look the inside decor. Also with this being my first time to Pittsburgh, location was close to hotel (across the street). Just an awesome experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pack bowl-beef brisket

KNZeVJKOdCLZ29ugyZKPfQ.text: This place changed the level of enthusiasm I had for Tacos when anyone suggested tacos for lunch or dinner. I was here with my colleagues for lunch during a conference in downtown. I was intrigued by the interior and it did not stop there. Their menu is also unique. You can build your own tacos and the options are unlimited. The waiter who waited on our table is very patient and explained to us about filling out the menu card which requires some effort that is totally worth for the food they serve.  I ordered tofu in one of the tacos and I don't regret going for that unusual combination. The tacos are huge and I ordered 3 of them. Two with tofu and one with some regular fillings. They are delicious and I highly recommend the hard shell tacos.   I should also mention that they are the most ergonomic tacos which are easy to eat without making a mess! Of course, I am going back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Three tacos in one basket! Most ergonomic tacos I ever had...

Xu0EkYner9e0ZhowYFKBOg.text: I ate here again and LOVED my tacos and guacamole. The chips could be better, maybe more salt. I like that it's build your own, I wish there were seafood options like crab, lobster and shrimp.  As much as I love these tacos I have to say if I eat more than two things I get sick...

Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

bGJaFM7cX6ioamcoBFyRfw.text: Seriously when the taco expert states it was the best taco ever.....hats off.  Friendly staff and very cool vibe.  We only tried one type of taco, but were blown away.  Everything stays in place for an amazing bite every time.  The flavors all complimented each other and extremely flavorful.  We had a bad restaurant experience and got this place after a few cocktails.  Will be back to try more.

-_0vIKsz1d4slaPLlSWmrw.text: Visited Condado for the first time during the arts festival with my boyfriend, another couple, and our 3 dogs. It had been raining on and off throughout the day, so the outdoor tables weren't available. Our plan was to order a few tacos and drinks and wait outside until they were ready. The amazing staff at Condado instead brought tables and seating back out for our group, and made sure our pups had water to drink. The food was as amazing as our service. At $6 their nachos are a steal. We will be back!

obu3exe2R9IaeBizy1WaHQ.text: Loved everything about this place!! I have visited both locations now and both have very cool murals on the walls, and the same quality service. They're happy hour includes half off margs and $1 off tacos. You can create your own with a ton of different options or pick from a pre-created list. I highly suggest the sweet Lucy she'll that comes with a soft shell with guac, queso and a hard shell. Also a fan of the pomegranate margaritas.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sweet Lucy - brisket &amp; chorizo tacos
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

uReUmnKCW7bsZ8FCyBBFGw.text: I came here on an average weekday night after work and man, was this place popping & filled with people. Granted, it recently opened so I guess that certainly helps, but I certainly did not expect it to be so full! As such, I proceeded to order out as there was no way I was going to wait to be seated. There are two ways to order: 1) either presets on a menu or 2) make-your-own where you can customize different aspects of your taco with some ingredients costing extra. In general, the tacos here are pretty good and reasonably priced. They have some pretty interesting ingredients and combinations that can be made with such ingredients on the menu, which I personally found pretty intriguing and certainly not something you find at some of the other taco places that I've been to in the 'burgh. All in all, the tacos tasted great ... packed with flavor, freshly made, and reasonably priced. I certainly would recommend at least a try if you are into tacos of any kind. Oh and there's a bar too, if you're into that kind of thing as well, lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tacos mmm mmm
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lively scene even on a weeknight

_OrnB7SHZ_Vc6Mv2Lxx7mA.text: This restaurant is in a great location, sharing the street with a lot of other interesting places to eat. I wish I would have tried one of them instead. Their tacos were good, but not great, and service was worse. On the upside, the atmosphere is buzzing even on a weeknight. The downstairs bar was packed, and upstairs had a fun mix of professionals getting drinks after work and hipsters on dates. Be sure to check out the sweet murals - You can't miss the art on every wall!

HKJlJENCmX1aSudjE0spCg.text: The service was cheerful and accommodating. The tacos were not authentic. The corn tortilla was crunchy, not soft. The black beans on my veg taco had that canned taste. The food at this place is not memorable.

-sSvN2WothZNUG7lc9MUQA.text: We come on a Friday, 1/2 hour before happy hour and wouldn't have gotten a table if we hadn't. Make your own tacos is awesome (ask for soft corn if that's what you want), margaritas great and our server did an excellent job checking in (and getting us to buy that one more margarita at happy hour). Don't expect to carry on a conversation without yelling- very loud venue!

DPUAXtnB9_HAr27YaQg6vg.text: I love the build-your-own Taco idea. Toppings are perfect, but I wish they had some more seafood options. Regardless, You can't go wrong with their happy hour deals!

THNUlTJRuiiP2bC5F-1uOQ.text: A great spot for tacos for a number of reasons: 1) the selection - you can choose from pre-set options or create your own from their extensive menu; 2) the size - these ain't no tiny tacos, you get a well-sized taco; 3) the value - for what you're getting, these tacos are reasonably & competitively priced; 4) the ambiance - a wide-open restaurant, with a fun vibe.  A tad loud, but when I went (Saturday evening), it was to be expected; 5) the nachos - we got a mountain of nachos, far more than I expected, and they were excellent; 6) Margaritas - we got a pitcher of them, and we got plenty of delicious margaritas to go around!  All-in-all, a taco spot that is fun and definitely worth checking out.

mzmCPnTBGJYLKkPh6MCZlQ.text: So me and my friend came here for the first time the other night. They have a great selection of craft beer and a full bar on top of that. Their food was very good. If you are in pittsburgh I would definitely recommend checking this place out! A++++

r_zJWp0tTF40uXrcrzsKsA.text: I went to try it out on a tuesday night.  Sat at the bar, Mike the bartender served me and explained the menu.  Tons of options and customization for your tacos and sides.  the food style is more americanized or Tex-Mex than traditional mexican, tons of options, great pricing, really good service, will be back.

2Wj0CBXWPyF2BB09C9HXMw.text: Three evenings in Pittsburgh, PA, and three evenings in a row I've eaten at Condado Tacos.  This evening, I carried out 3 tacos, all the same, and I spoke with the host to who took placed my order, and delivered my order.  I told him I was highly impressed from the first bite of the first taco I ate there.  The price, I told him, isn't only cheap, it's completely underpriced because the quality of food exceeds what can found elsewhere.  I also let him know I'd be providing a rave review on Yelp, and he was delighted to learn that they really impressed a new customer.

HMti3gSjZtMnUa37efrVgQ.text: What a concept - build your own tacos.  And they are awesome including the quesos and salsas.  Plus some great beers on tap too.  This place is always busy but haven't had to wait more than 10 min for a table.

Dyv-ZR9rfXhzpY5bjXUiuQ.text: Amazing tacos and queso! Great drinks and great location. Extremely well priced food with moderately priced drinks for the area. The waitress we had was great, very friendly and prompt;  but the bartender who we ordered drinks from while waiting for a table was not nearly as friendly.   Overall a great additional to the Cultural District!

khAqPzElXTvgmfCtEbxl7g.text: I typically never order tacos because I'm picky as all hell, but this place lets you build your own! I met my friend here for lunch last Friday, and it wasn't even our first choice.  We tried three other restaurants but they were all packed to the brim. We both mentioned Condado and said we had yet to try it so we might as well give it a try.  We got seated right away and even got a seat on their patio area.  I consider myself a queso connoisseur and their queso is bomb.  Honestly though, the tacos were the best part.  I believe I go the ju-ju shell which was essentially a hard shell nestled inside a soft shell glued together with their queso - amazing.  Highly recommend.

fwtuICZjLjmL0V5abpkxfA.text: Went to Condado for the first time today (Friday 4:00pm) and were seated immediately.  The food was AMAZING!  Although some other *newer* Mexican restaurants in the city are great, this place is legit.  Seriously, the best sit-down Mexican taco joint in the Burgh.  Order George's Dirty Taco and it will improve your outlook .  We will be back....tomorrow?

SvdVKh8oyGB3khuftJ6d3w.text: Awesome prices and the service was pretty quick for Downtown lunch hour. I loved the decor as well. Most importantly the tacos are delicious. Definitely check it out if you're in the Downtown Pittsburgh area.

Bu4Mz2TvygM7vdOE3r_ojw.text: I'm from California, and Pittsburgh doesn't have many great places to get some tacos. This will be our new go to when the craving strikes! Very fun space, good food, and cheap prices! Yes, they are new. Yes, they are working out a few things... but that certainly doesn't warrant a shitty review. Well worth a visit!! Go get some tacos, you won't regret it! Also, if you get the delicioso (cucumbers, jalapenos, and soda water) margarita -- it is HOT! And delicioso, just like the tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

L9_OWxr7bh9Ex_1hCFia3A.text: A great place that gets over looked because of all the talk over other taKo places in town! But this is by far my favorite!! The margarita needs work so opt for beer, but the food and guacamole won't disappoint.

JvKbdhsXr74MOZ17lesMjA.text: Stopped in on a Saturday afternoon for lunch. Really awesome inside decor! Definitely a punk/rock vibe which hasn't been done at a Mexican place in Pittsburgh yet. We sat at the downstairs bar. Menu was super impressive. There's a smaller list of "already made" tacos you can just order. Or you can use their huge list to create your own!! We just ordered a few off the already made list and we'll make our own next time. We first got the pineapple guac & chips - holy cow. Never had guac like that before. The only downfall, the chips were really greasy. Onto tacos... I got a taco with chicken (forget the name - queso fresco, pollo,..) and it was SO GOOD. Also got a pulled pork one - even better!! My boyfriend also got the pulled pork one and 2 chorizo. He really liked them all!... keep in mind, the tacos are BIGGER than the other taco places in Pittsburgh so you don't need to order as many. I was stuffed after sharing guac & eating 2 tacos. We actually took some guac & chips home. Service was awesome - quick & very attentive. Can't wait to go back again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Downstairs bar.

praz-lpl2dSCw1pCc9IAdw.text: Such a cool taco place! And the food is amazing! Gotta love all the queso and guac options!

mnjm3r7xv8p59yZBhaJMaw.text: Great food, and service. Usually pretty fast unless there is a lot of happenings downtown...then you may wait a bit. You can build your own tacos which helps in getting exactly what you want. Also great margaritas.

AGKgqFq0WGjUN7yPhy5Frw.text: Condado Tacos is a great restaurant.  I've gone 4 times over the past 2 weeks.  It's definitely budget friendly, with really tasty suggested tacos, but my favorite is the Create your own tacos.  Starting at $3, they allow you to customize your taco from shell to sauce, the whole enchilada.  You can easily get away with eating in for $10-$15.  The margaritas looked really good too (and cheap), but haven't yet indulged on that yet.  Also - they have a loyalty card that's gets you $5 back on every $50 you spend.  Happy hour takes a $1 off tacos and Margaritas, so you definitely can't go wrong (5-7PM).

mHnTmpargrwpX9IPpAHX2w.text: Awesomeness...great house made nachos. I had 1 of the pre selected tacos and 2 make your own. Great flavor. I could only eat 2, had to take the 3rd one home. Service was friendly and efficient.  Atmosphere was very cool. I did not try any tequila drinks, but the selection was vast. I will be sure to try some next tim.

oAyppq8bLcZ59qejWqGM4A.text: Best tacos in the Pittaburgh area. There might be other places where you can get tacos, but this place beats them all over price, taste and ambiance. Bonus - they have many vegetarian options, or else you can customize your own taco per your needs!

czs3C6_A5Vgp0zlt_IpPgw.text: Best place I have ever went hands down for tacos. Friends took me out for my birthday here, the atmosphere is great. Definitely recommend the blackberry margarita! As for the tacos they were out of this world. My friends rushed me so I do not think I can ever recreate what I made. However, you cannot go wrong with the chicken and shrimp. I tried the pineapple salsa it was great. 10/10.

haSzy-iGXIW_3WyIaDglWA.text: Love it! The cheese dip is incredible! The tacos are soooooo good! But the best thing is the craft cocktailing with Dave! It's definitely a good place to get a delightful buzz and a flaming hoop in one package!

FnIc5-ZsdOg70k1Lp3nh_A.text: Hands down the best tacos anywhere! That is all there is to say. Build your own tacos is definitely the way to go. I have never had a taco here that I didn't enjoy! They also have a decent selection of beers and their margaritas are an 8/10.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

VRtXWqG7GQGWzaWI0OZR_g.text: While I loved the food here, and I've been here a few times, this place has given my friend and my husband food poisoning.   I was there a couple days ago and I got something to go for my husband and my friend and I dined in. The food came out so quickly, and we were super grateful for that, however, now that it's been 24 hrs, we think that some of the food must have been sitting out.   My husband has been throwing up all night, and my friend has diarrhea and nausea.   It sucks because the food was so good, but two separate people that had separate meals, one who dined in and one who had take out are both extremely sick. I encourage this restaurant to not be lazy and cook all of their food in a timely fashion. People go to restaurants expecting to wait. Don't cut corners. I pray this is just a temporary bug.
