QPA2BrtRiItiWzkNEfcHTw.text: I can't write much about the service, because I ordered to-go (parenting on vacation means 1 parent gets the kids to bed by 7:30, while the other orders to-go from trendy yummy restaurants). I did like the vibe, and this place was pretty crowded even on a Monday night as I ordered at the bar.   This lived up to 100% of the yelp hype. I wish this existed where I live, because trendy Mexican places for a night out fall so flat. I just about died when I saw the Ju-Ju and Sweet Lucy tortilla options. Queso + chorizo, or queso + guac between the 2 shells? I'm already in heaven and I haven't even figured out what to put in the shells.   I'm a spice lover, and loved all the sauce options. Price was appropriate for what we got. Would return for a friends night out if I lived here!

5ZL8UZZ6UYqyBVTJWOETuA.text: So good!!! Best tacos in the city! Everyone was friendly! Only thing is the sitting can get a little awkward

39zUw3h2G-aeGj0dVD3_vA.text: Angelina was the best server I've ever had. She was so accommodating and sweet and my friends and I had such a great experience at Condado!

nzRtxFHNus8JAFFwuqDqew.text: I love Condado!!!!! The shrimp ceviche is to die for as well as the pulled pork. They offer a free taco if you post a pic of yourself eating it (if you have 1000+ followers or friends), something I always take advantage of. Taking off one star for the overly expensive, but delcious, margaritas.

g-LCEev1WA00gZuyujzpOA.text: 5 stars if i wasn't from California.  But I am, so while these are good tacos, they're pretty Caucasian.   Their tacos are good, their guac was good, I paid extra for their ghost salsa which is just a little more spicy than the mild I'm used to at home.  I ate here almost every night when I was in town.  They have good drinks, I like the atmosphere, and I would definitely return.

ikxsTgg7SRIvUEf7ggsaEQ.text: Who doesn't want to create your own taco?! They have a thousand different options for meats, toppings, sauces & so much more. You can literally get queso on your taco. There is even an option to get a crunchy shell wrapped in a soft shell!! (All the crunch, none of the mess) The tacos are excellent and the margaritas are literally to die for. Be prepared for a wait but trust me it is well worth it!

kNWa795z2VlbjxVv1XYw_A.text: Their vegetarian tacos were out of this world. Some of the best Tacos I've ever had. I especially liked the one with pulled jackfruit.   They also have a great tequila selection and interesting looking cocktails.

PtEgtMq7XE7664qRTxqqxA.text: I had heard that this is lace was amazing from a Mexican food loving friend-who highly recommended I try Condado Tacos. The food was pretty good-queso was pretty ordinary and one note in flavor-you can skip it entirely in my opinion. It really just tasted like melted Velveeta, and really not much more than that. Don't waste your calories. The chips were hearty and very salty-too salty. The tacos however-to die for!! Definitely try the layered taco, I think called Lucy. I had it with roast chicken, rice& beans, cilantro & onions & chipotle creama. Absolutely delish & beyond!!! However-the service here is really lacking. Our waitress took forever to get to us. Drinks were pretty quick. But we asked for hot sauce to give the bland, not warm, tasteless queso some flavor-she never came back. Food runners brought our food. No one ever came back to check on us-NOT ONCE!! Is this just a Pittsburgh lack of training thing?  And then, there was my absolute favorite Pittsburgh lousy service thing-the waitress drops our check off on the dirty table-never asked "how was your meal," let alone clearing the dirty table before asking me to pay my check-what is with this??? I waited tables for years. We were trained to NEVER present a check to a dirty table! Clear it first!! Have a little pride in what you're doing!! So I'm supposed to tip for slow, spotty, mostly missing service?? And then a check presented to me on my still dirty table-with a "I'll take this when you're ready," as she walks away. Yeah, I did tip. But not what I would have, that is for sure. And-it was not busy! All the wait staff were huddled near the end of the bar having a chat. I just don't get it. The food was mostly good. Service not so much. Will I be back? Maybe. Not likely though.

OSxc7YgLDYNX-ruxL2NjGA.text: Had a blast here. Had some tacos and craft beers. You order on sheets and it is super easy to get everything you want. I got pulled jackfruit and it was great. Waitstaff was over the top nice. We went here after having a poor experience at Tako so even walking in not in a great mood they won us over.

oHyPzbbhTsy_ynDdkyH_VA.text: Great food, great staff.  Cocktails leave a little to be desired but overall I would give it 2 thumbs up!  Brunch is good too!

gMctKDgt6O5i6bdYYhUcCA.text: I'm so over Condado. I used to come here all the time when I got off of work. I brought my family in here multiple times. I was a regular when this location first opened up, had one of their membership cards and everything. But now the entire staff has changed and the newer bartenders have an attitude. I sat in here for 10 minutes today with the bartenders walking by giving service to other patrons around me, never got a hello. It wasn't even busy. I walked out and I don't think they even noticed. It's a shame because it's one of the only spots where you can get vegan food downtown, but it's not worth it. I don't care about being hip enough for tacos and $6 drafts. The place is surrounded by other bars that want your money more. What a shame RIP

BOe2w_o9iPkt9kFUlycUvQ.text: Delicious tacos. Cool atmosphere. Lots of taco and drink options. The queso was delicious! The way you order is not traditional but our waiter did a great job of explaining. Definitely going back!

YDVnClPCA95gm_GSbvR8qA.text: I believed the hype, but I wasn't too thrilled with the tacos. I got the corn shell and the shells are hallow and fall apart and are too crunchy for the textures of the filling. I got the tofu on one and the portobello on the other. I'm vegan so I don't eat meat, but I still feel like the textures wouldn't match. They also didn't put that much in the actual taco. There was barely any filling. I could go to Doce Tacqueria and get a hefty taco and pay less than what I paid at Condado. Even Bakersfield across the street stuffs their tiny little tacos more than this. The guy who served me was super nice and great at his job, very friendly and welcoming. But Overall I probably wouldn't go back unless friends wanted to go or were paying for my food.

CtgxX6fSLrrdrynJh9rxMg.text: Delicious! Chips are awesome on the side and the menu is great and lots of variety. Cool, fun atmosphere too.

KYzyXRqcZqbQa-3Q0bNaCg.text: I LOVE literally everything at your restaurant. The employees, the art, the drinks and of course, the tacos. But, last week I was sad to discover that the chorizo recipe has changed. I even saved my chorizo taco last (unaware of the change) and was left semi-disgusted and questioning, "what the heck is wrong with my favorite taco?? Is this cinnamon?!" Even asking my boyfriend to try it for a second opinion. Yes, it was cinnamon--verified by two sets of taste buds and a wonderful bartender. Apparently, this complaint has been made from other patrons and by confirming my strong distaste of this MAJOR change, I have decided to write a review, (which I never do, ever) so yinz can all hear it in the back!!! CINNAMON DOES NOT BELONG IN CHORIZO!  please fix it. Love, an original chorizo recipe lover. Xoxo (Yelp also doesn't recognize emojis, so please, while reading, insert hand-claps between each capitalized word rant). You're welcome.

E3PZmvckFNPpRatgbdNZeg.text: Yummy (but messy) tacos and good margarita! I will definitely be returning to this place for late night noms if I'm ever downtown. The only reason I gave 3 stars is because my girlfriend and I split a pitcher of margs (about 6 margs - good deal) but neither of us really felt like there was alcohol in it. Also DO NOT order the side of rice. It's just a small container of white rice drenched in pepper. Not at all worth it or good. But other than that it was yummy!

sZWjh5vPx8mJgfopUcyorw.text: Go here!!! They have a great deal on build your own tacos or select some from their menu. Blood orange margaritas are excellent. Parking is a pain but it's in downtown so of course it is.

vqUbLwSvQ71pvnWCHfbsXg.text: This place was so good!! Since I started working downtown, I've been on the lookout for good vegan options and this was my favorite so far. I for the Thai chili tofu tacos with chips and guacamole. The tacos were delicious and everything was proportioned perfectly, so everything wasn't falling out, and I wasn't sifting through a mound of lettuce to find my tofu. The environment was also great. I will definitely be back soon.

v1cPLpTnjR6Te8HHkR9u8Q.text: Great tacos and great service. Thanks Brandon for all the laughs !!! We appreciate your amazing server abilities. He's the GOAT

NfFheEGGAQ5sty03tfUDKQ.text: I was in town and was craving mezcal margaritas so we came here. It's eh. Mezcal was good but even when i kept ordering different flavors, i didnt get much flavor. I didnt get to try the food except for the guac and salsa, but my bf tried the tacos. He said they were good. I did like that you can basically create your own taco.

BTR_Y8Nv6IpE6EQlsa6R2Q.text: My favorite place for Tacos downtown! Amazing every time and great staff.  One time they messed up my order and comped my entire check, even the Margaritas!  Their Reward Card program is awesome too, every $50 spent, $5 off I believe, and it includes alcohol purchases.  Great for Meetings if you dont mind the hustle and bustle of downtown!

0oPwbkP5F19MzyDUuJu5_A.text: Amazing tacos.  Get the Lucy shell or other one that has hard shell inside soft shell.  Also great drinks and beers.   Tacos are not the "try hard" fancy style like at Bakersfield that I find over rated. This is a cool spot with delicious filling tacos.

R0klpRRezrfdXnGpSoQzww.text: food wasnt bad. prices were pretty just. it was clear our server had to pinch a loaf or something tho.she was very much boom!!!i'mhereinyourfaceimkindashoutingandtellingyouwhattoorderokbyenowimgonefortwentyminutesatatime,heresypurcheckhurryupimwipingthetabledownwhileypustillfinisjyourdrinkokbye!!!

TDmqBcwQyB7ZKUB2Y2E2_Q.text: Ate here a couple of weeks ago. And really enjoyed the concept - build your own taco.  Also the taste was fantastic.  Going back this week again.

Tic6HXu_aTxTaHIhRpcllQ.text: There was good variety on the menu, but tacos did not seem very authentic, I was disappointed they didn't have soft corn shells. The hostess was a little rude to us as well, we had never been there and didn't realize there was a difference between eating upstairs and sitting downstairs for the happy hour. The margaritas on the other hand were great! They had a variety of flavors and they are made with real fruit puree rather than syrup.

L6WLrbHfIjJJpIWfYjWclA.text: Went here on opening night when they were giving away free tacos. The place was completely full even with the snow outside.  I ordered the El Santo taco and it was pretty good. It is basically a chicken taco with queso fresco. The twist is that it is in a soft and crunchy taco shell with some sort of sauce between.   I also ordered the pomegranate margarita and the prickly pear margarita. They were both easy to drink and tasted like they were freshly made and not from some super sweet premixed bottle.   The only negatives were that the free tacos were still on the bill when it came. The server corrected that and when I asked for a refill on the salsa the server brought out another order and charged us for it. Both of these problems were due to it being opening night and super busy.   I'll definitely be back, especially when they open the rooftop deck.

Jn3caZpjR1Rzf1ZbjWVTog.text: My husband and I stopped in on a Tuesday evening. We both had tacos, mine was chicken with the cilantro /lime aioli. My husbands had the house made chorizo on it . Both were great!! Chips and salsa were fresh and home made. Service was fast and friendly. It is a little loud! But a lot of fun!!

aP5GSjC0zG1ngGvqPL3Itw.text: One of my favorite places to get tacos in the city! They're relatively cheap and have a wide variety of vegan and vegetarian options. I normally get the tofu, portobello mushrooms, and bbq jackfruit in mine and they are always delicious. The salsas, quesos, and guac are also some of the best I've had.

As5N6qTzyfW8dG2tiXs5Eg.text: Great food and great margaritas. Being across from my hotel was dangerously convenient.

XN7KBidaJ5UVuoMHLjQa2g.text: Awesome vegetarian and vegan options, if this was near me I'd come here all the time! I stopped in during a work trip to Pittsburgh based on a co-worker's recommendation. It was packed on a Saturday night so I ordered takeout. The hostess and bartender were very helpful and my order was out in less than 10 minutes. Both the Mantis and the Dutch Dragon were absolutely delicious. It can be tough to find creative and tasty vegetarian tacos and the flavors in both of these were perfect! I will be back :)

Z_YE9cSqb-SwpAFRUzVIjA.text: Queso is fire.  Never had bad service.  Huge tequila selection, draft beers that are actually decent.. plus the art on the walls is dope af.

wq9NnLhfjX7NkAli4NvGLQ.text: I came here once with some friends really late at night before the kitchen closed, and my server was pretty pissed about it. I wish I had cared to remember her name...but I guess any human would be pissed about that. Besides her attitude, the tacos were bomb! Cheap and fast. Next time my friends and I will come at a more reasonable time, but we were drunk, hungry, and didn't care, so. Thanks anyways, Condado! :)

Ss65cyFgnqHZQOdKNr03Jg.text: Love the vegetarian tacos here. The chicken ones are good too, but I find the flavor in the mushroom and tofu tacos to be really good. The margaritas here are good too. There's a line out the door pretty much every evening right around 5pm so suggest going before or a little after. Worth the wait.

vWWBh9HybRf6A4_IeioiQw.text: To the extremely stressed out waitress that just talked down to me without provocation - I'm SO incredibly sorry. The hostess told my husband and I that we were next to sit outside so when a couple left we waited around but given the extremely crowded environment we proceeded to sit down and patiently wait for service. Please understand that we had no way of knowing that you were "holding the table" for the previous patrons who were out in the crowd enjoying the concert. Also please note that it is not standard procedure to "hold" unbussed tables in a crowded restaurant while patrons go off to participate in other activities. Frankly, it sounds risky from a walk-out-on-the-bill perspective but hey I'm not here to judge. But I would like to share a basic customer service tip: try to maintain a professional tone when speaking to patrons irregardless of your stress level especially when they do something intuitive like sit at an empty table. It's our first time in Pittsburg and it's a busy Friday night. We had attempted to get a table at two other places before arriving at your restaurant, we're tired, we're hungry but we are respectful. We didn't deserve your tone, you talked down to us as if you were dealing with a pair of irate assholes when we were simply confused - confused that you had walked by us multiple times but failed to mention we were grossly infringing on your "reserved" table ... confused that you're suddenly back and telling us to "take it up with management ..." wait? what? Remember me? About 10 minutes prior when you could barely get through all the people I sympathized with you ... I leaned over and commented on how difficult your job must be tonight ... Why are you suddenly talking down to us? You turned business away from your employer tonight and left a small stain on what would have otherwise been a lovely evening.

3SEQwWfz_k_V-87zLqJzWg.text: If youre going to take short cuts, dont do it with the gauc!! Totally pre packaged and was confirmed by the staff...: At first we thought we were snooty New Yorkers with high expectations but after getting our entrees we realized that thjs place is just good for the decor. Food is no bueno! Drinks are overly sweet as well... the bartender with the blue hair was super cool. If anything deserves the star its her. Thanks for being super accomodating

3rkp2aqnFsrI3PyrNm6ahg.text: Another Pittsburgh restaurant that is quickly going downhill.  The drinks are watered down, no more Mexican Coke for the Cuba Libre (too expensive to stock, we were told).  And the queso apparently was able to be made less expensively as it tasted like something you could heat up from Giant Eagle.  So disappointing, but at least the lines will be calming down if they keep going in this direction.

VadR83Av-bkmg9wSFSu6HQ.text: I won't reccommend this place to anyone following how I was treated. I have a chronic illness and injuries that sometimes require use of a cane. I arrived tonight and was pushed past by other guests, who were seated before me and my partner (including a party of 6).   One hostess thought I was part of another party, but I explained we were trying to put our name on the list. This hostess didn't take our names, she just went to the host stand to seat a party. I waited patiently because I have worked in the industry and was trying to not rush them. This same hostess said nothing when another couple pushed past us and got their names on the list with a different hostess.   When we were called, they attempted to seat me at a cramped high top table squeezed between other people. When they realized that wasn't going to work, they asked about going upstairs. Then they told us that we would have to go back on the waitlist. I've worked in restaurants for over 12 years as a host and server. Asking guests about accommodations is the industry standard. I felt so upset by the disorganization that I told them that we had been cut off by others and that I wanted to leave.    Never before have I left somewhere feeling like my business was worth less, like here.

R8sOr_ej7-BDT0Z1drAWFw.text: this place is everything you want and more if you're looking to get a quick bite to eat downtown. tacos are fully customizable, and cheap! they start at just $3.50! they also have amazing guac and queso to start off your meal with. this is the place i always recommend to my friends coming to pgh when they ask where they should eat.  they have a very uniquely decorated interior and offer outside seating (weather permitting, obviously). another key feature is that fact that they have vegetarian and vegan options, all of which are labeled on their menu. they have seasonal monthly specials that always bring new flavors to the table. condado also has a rewards program and you get a free taco for every 50 points you earn. i've become a regular at both pittsburgh locations but i usually go the the one on liberty ave. just because it's a tiny bit easier to find parking in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. table full of delicious food

wolo65SJ7TDdh3EAghOxag.text: Let's be real, I'm a little bit of a taco snob! This is by far my favorite taco joint. I love it because you can easily get your money's worth. You can walk away with a taco at around $3.50 or you can build a mansion on top of that taco (Aka mine) and spend $5.50. I come here starving every time, and my two favorites to get are the Sweet Lucy & the Ju-Ju. I get about 10 toppings on each and get 2 tacos every time. I am STUFFED!! So worth it! Tacos are great, drinks are delicious and chorizo-queso is amazing. They have a great salsa and guacamole option as well!!  If you think about it, it is kinda of like Burgatory but got TACOS!! Can you think of anything more genius!? Go ahead, I'll wait :-) ENJOY!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

8gKGuF0QWtkQDoCH62-MAw.text: Maybe I'm being harsh here, but someone should do it. Here goes nothing:  Service: it look me a long time to get a hostess, to get a waiter, to get water, to order and to get my food. The staff was very friendly and not weird about me eating alone (oh, business travel), but I was worried I'd miss my meetings and I'd given myself an hour.  Food: The tacos were just ok. I tried one of their recommendations...surf and turf and then crated my own. By the time in got to me the create your own with chicken was not just 'not hot,' but actively cold. I think it's that both the corn salsa and cabbage slaw came straight from the fridge. When I bit into my taco, my teeth got sensitive from the cold. Now I have sensitive teeth. But still! I will say that the flavor of their black beans and guacamole was great.  My rec: come for a drink and order the guacamole, beans and queso . Let's leave the tacos to Texas, mkay?

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. So many options

vRxN22AYPpZ5SruN-gtmAw.text: FAVORITE TACO PLACE. EVER. 10/10. It's funny because we just kind of stumbled into this restaurant one night. I was having a hankering for some Mexican food. This isn't really authentic Mexican, it's more of a street taco type of situation. You sit down, and they have a pad of paper that has a checklist on it. You basically just check what kind of shell you want and what kind of toppings you want on your taco. The way just comes and takes your drink order and the little slips with your taco order on it. A few minutes later, voila! Your perfect tacos are delivered! Love the atmosphere. Fast service. GREAT TACOS. Favorite stop in Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

su-ZBuWET3pN8ZNosvVb-A.text: This is probably my favorite taco joint ever! I began eating at Condados while in college in Columbus Ohio and I am so happy that Pittsburgh has one. I recommend the peezler since it has a hard shell wrapped around a soft tortilla... best of both worlds  for appetizers definitely try out the queso diablo which is red hot peppers mixed into the gooey queso! The margarita is good but sometimes I feel like it's watered down. To avoid that get the skinny margarita. Finally they have a bunch of these locations throughout Pittsburgh, Columbus, and Cleveland so I make sure to stop by one whenever I'm in those cities

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Queso diablo
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. House margarita

v5XgLhza3SZ_Ag9Y-8A3_Q.text: I'm not a huge taco fan (spoiler alert). When I went, I really enjoyed the chips and guacamole and cheese. I had tacos, and while I wasn't a huge fan, everyone else raves about them. So I think I'm wrong.   Let's talk guac. This place has got some Tuscan guac that you're going to want to order. It's got pesto and artichoke hearts and so much deliciousness. You won't regret it if you enjoy Italian flavors and don't mind fusion.   Had the regular blanco queso. It was appropriately Tex-Mexy, which I appreciated.   I wouldn't mind having some more varied vegetarian options for the tacos. I love tofu but can't handle spice, so I couldn't do the tofu option. Maybe a milder tofu option would help round out the menu.   Anyway, the vibe is cool and the service is great. And I'm totally wrong about the tacos, so you'll love them.

3utXnTT_zbMeb-ycN-RNyw.text: I'm wondering if my first time here was an outlier. I have been here twice since my first visit and both times the service has been really bad. On one occasion, great lengths of time went between visits to our table. At least then our waitress was somewhat apologetic. Tonight our waitress just seemed pretty miserable, terse and disinterested in our table. It was very off-putting. They did not have frozen margaritas which was a letdown (not sure if that was just tonight or always) but the bigger letdown was that the margarita itself tasted like it was just alcohol-free margarita mix. The food was fine but I honestly was so turned off by our waitress tonight that I don't think I'll be back.

hXjSa9SEOf7gJZsTONXdzQ.text: Second time: worse service. Server was great but short hostess with tattoos was outright rude.   Terrible service at the door. I waited nearly a half hour before being acknowledged and then it was with a whopping attitude. Kyle, my waiter, was great. Super nice and kind. The food was meh...OK. Not terrible. Not great. Nothing was served hot. Everything was just kind of warm. The atmosphere is kind annoyingly loud for no reason, which makes everyone else scream over the music which makes it even louder. I'd be willing to give it another shot but my first impression wasn't great.

2rAQ83gaMFNrAoBRWhs_tA.text: Our favorite happy hour downtown! 3 dollar margs and the tacos are amazing. They have vegetarian and vegan options which is why I love it so much. The server Matthew is super helpful! Highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

9lrtCNqMrEO29QLyAwIt_w.text: been here for both casual meals and for birthdays, and this place is perfect for both (it does however get pretty loud). for starters, the guacamole and dirty queso are always a must but don't save room for the tacos because they are super good and filling. I recommend making your own custom taco, it starts at $3.5 and you can add whatever you want to it and it gets very filling (maximum 3 tacos for when I'm hungry). the double shelled (soft and hard) are definitely worth if you want a change of texture in your tacos. I came here for my 21st birthday and ordered a strawberry margarita (~$7), it was very strong but was pretty tasty. the service is also very kind and accommodating!   tldr; food 5/5 service 5/5

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. custom tacos &amp; strawberry margarita
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. create your own tacos and traditional guac

D9Md85BgHvbEHL1z4lBStQ.text: Late night taco spot? Or just taco spot in general...and you can probably bet that I'm already a fan.   This was my first visit here and I really liked this place. We arrived late and the place was packed. Once you grab a seat, the ordering process is easy. You can either build your own tacos or select from a menu of pretty great creations.   We started with a pitcher of strawberry margaritas. For me it was just okay. It could have used a bit more alcohol and flavor.   The tacos were awesome. I tried the Mantis, Dutch Dragon and Surf and Turf. It's so hard for me to pick a favorite. I really liked that they used a hard corn and flour tortilla! The toppings were all so fresh!   If you're in the area...this place has to be on your list to try!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Strawberry margarita
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dutch Dragon, Surf and Turf, Mantis

NA2pQcv9Pk7MBEz1b9ngHg.text: First, this place is L-O-U-D. It was very difficult to hear each other as we sat cramped together at a small table - a party of 8. As an adult couple going out it would've been tolerable, but as a group that wanted to enjoy each other, it was too loud.   The server that we had was very talkative - in a way that we couldn't get a word or question in and when we did, she wouldn't really stop talking long enough to actually hear what we were saying. She basically heard a word and then cut us off or never heard us at all and apparently did what she thought that we said - hence my very simplistic request with my queso order (no peppers or garnish).   We were not really impressed overall due to the above.

qpMG-pD03fX28ehiODD1-w.text: Absolutely the best tacos in Pittsburgh. Extremely flavorful and so unique. Very cool menu. Margaritas are on the smaller side. Chips and salsa are not complimentary but they are only $3. Cool little vibe

x-xPUc_bRQ64QjIWhAelNA.text: Definitely a cool place inside.. small but there is more tables upstairs.   I sat at the bar and ordered take out.  It took about 15 minutes - not bad for lunchtime.  The service at the bar was good.  You have the option to build your own taco or order from the menu.   I chose the "El Santo" & "Bubba Kush" tacos.  I loved them both but liked the Bubba Kush more.. it made my taste buds happy.  The tacos were nestled with hard and soft tacos.. love that!   I like the build your own taco option.   I will definitely return with the boyfriend to check out the dining experience.

AKwXchc3bRM0QtN8o9KQTA.text: You can always count on me to review a good taco joint. I love any place you can customize your food. If you're familiar with the Custom Sheets at Burgatory, then you get the concept behind Condado. Pick your shell, protein, cheese, and fixin's... You're in charge. I can't recommend the juicy marinated Portobello mushrooms or the Shrimp Ceviche enough! And the picked red onions are PHENOMENAL as an add-on! Of course, there are House Tacos that you can choose from if you don't like hard choices ("What kind of sauce do I choose???? Chorizo or Brisket for protein?) Everything is rad, promise.  Then, another important choice: What kind of margarita? You can always roll classic, but if you're daring, the Muddled Jalapeno Marg is FIRE. (Haha, yes, I crack myself up...)  Located right at the edge of the notorious Cultural District, Condado is a prime choice for food after any event. Just be warned: Going any time after 30 minutes prior to Happy Hour (Beginning at 4:00) might mean you're camping out for a bit!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. I hope Heaven has tacos

hYHFejr8s7uJRD0hn1DWHg.text: One of the only good places to eat near the conference center. Menu is real easy to follow, you check off all your choices or they have some specials you can order .  Service was quick and friendly.  2 tacos is a perfect portion for lunch. You can taste the freshness in all the ingredients!    Tip: get there when they open at 11am otherwise the wait is out the door.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

BlKSOzX1PWx6Ux5oAR9NQw.text: My friend and I spent a night downtown and was told by several people that we needed to try Condado Tacos for dinner, and it did not disappoint! We arrived at about 6:45 on a Saturday night and it was PACKED. The hostess told us it would be a 30 minute wait, so we awkwardly stood in the corner of the restaurant waiting for a bar seat. Luckily it only ended up being about a 15 minute wait!   We both tried the peach margarita and it was delicious! Neither of us were disappointed. They had many unique flavors such as banana, pomegranate, and rosemary.  For dinner, we decided to build our own tacos. It was pretty cool that you could pick your shell and all of its contents to your liking! I ended up only getting one taco because we had the queso blanco as an appetizer, but I do wish I would have gotten two. The homemade tortilla chips were thick, crispy, and went perfect with the cheese dip!   Overall, I really enjoyed my visit to Condado and would definitely try it out again!

yjKLzZAFZgjnM8-F9Fxvag.text: Among the best in a growing restaurant spike for for foodies. Food truck tacos meet fresh fresh fresh ingredients - hipster wait staff has nothing to do with the trendy taco joint. This is all about the best ingredients you can stir between a variety of coed shells, flour tortillas and your lips.

Ct2LKrA7OPUYR8zsWeUWzQ.text: I have mixed feelings about this place, the service wasnt great and the tables are too small and awkward. The food was good, reasonably priced tacos , I didn't like the hard shell in soft shell hype, it just doesn't taste good. The drink selection is ok but the prices of the drinks are obscene, I am not at a roof top in NYC so one drink shouldn't cost as much as 3 tacos. Otherwise the make your own taco option is pretty good.

8RQPkWcdGC8aVukpJZoiaw.text: Love the food. I had steak tacos on juju soft/hard shells. Very good. The margarita were very good. Happy hour specials are great!!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pomegranate, strawberry banana, mayo jalepeno

aIZkcgmCzZI1XWhlqm65hQ.text: The tacos were hella fiiiiiire. You can create your own tacos or choose the signature ones they have on the menu. I created my own and my God it was banging. Definitely try the brisket and the Sweet Lucy shell , twas' muy delicioso.  The place itself was poppin' and can get super packed on the weekends so if you're okay with being basically elbow to elbow/ back to back then give it a try otherwise definitely grab some tacos to go or beat the rush.

bsAaTi6jRCHGzn8csOXpUA.text: Delicious tacos & friendly staff! They have a build your tacos menu, which can be a bit intimidating at first but is so much fun! They also have taco suggestions for those who are not brave enough to try a new adventure of building your own taco! Bartenders are amazing and will help the newbies!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

b5b-DkeezPrwbu2sp4s_Nw.text: My first time here and I have to be honest I came because I thought this was still Tonic.  I walked in and the host greeted, or rather grimaced at me.  When I asked for a table, he offered to take me upstairs. I politely declined. He walked away, removed something from a bench, came back and told me he would seat me upstairs...there were two tables in plain sight that were ready and empty. After being seated upstairs I was greeted, wonderfully I might add, by a waitress-Julia. She was all similes and extremely accommodating.  I gave my order of a marguerita,  extra salt, and nachos, custom ordered. She continuously checked on me and made sure I was ok. The marguerita was bland, but the nachos were delicous! I don't know if I'd come here again, but I can say the nachos were really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yummy nachos, meh(!) on the drinks and the host.

RZoEOmKViFXkBI9GTFeh7Q.text: Fantastic tacos, great atmosphere and a friendly wait staff!  Create your own tacos, even some vegetarian options.  I've been here many times and it never disappoints!

CeXUEsJdajXfZh0P45VOtw.text: First off I tried not to let my previous experience ruin this review. I tried to come here before but when I got to the restaurant it was unexpectedly closed but yet nothing was stated on social media. Regardless I tried this place tonight. It was very crowded for a Tuesday night which was good and very lively. My date and I ordered the queso and guacamole to start with. They were not flavorful. In fact guacamole I've made at home using McCormick spice pack tasted better. There needed to be more lime and cilantro. Next we did the make your own taco. They were ok.  If you do make your own taco I recommend the Lucy shell with hard and soft taco. Also the surf and turf taco is pretty good. But other than that there is Nothing really stellar to report about them. We got the margaritas which were good which is the most redeeming part of the night.

S0T3tp9HQVtSsnOS4aGyMw.text: This and Tako are the best taco places in Pittsburgh by far! I really enjoy the make-your-own taco aspect here, as there are plenty of funky and flavorful options to choose from. You must get the queso & guac filled Sweet Lucy shell for at least one taco, and if you're at all a fan of tofu, you need to try their Thai Chili Tofu (I order it every time I go and have even replicated it at home for friends and family-it's that good!). Now, the tacos can get pretty big depending on what all you put in them, and I have never eaten more than two. If we're ordering margs and apps, then I can barely even finish one! I'd suggest starting out with one then ordering another if you're still hungry when you finish. Speaking of margs, I'm unfortunately not too big a fan of theirs as I find them to be too sweet and syrupy. Luckily, they have a decent beer selection. Now, this place does tend to get crowded on Thurs-Sat evenings, so if you're coming for dinner, I'd get here 30-45 mins before you wanna eat

VD30rm5VxcbuYcWwwgM53Q.text: We did not have the best experience at this restaurant. Very very crammed inside, especially for a bigger person. I ordered three tacos. One of the tacos I ordered was braised beef brisket on a flour (soft) tortilla. The brisket juices made the flour tortilla extremely soggy, which made me have to eat it faster than normal.   The chicken is pretty good choice for protein. We also had the seasonal queso (red pepper). The queso was delicious and the chips were on point (replenished if needed).  Maybe we just had a bad batch of tacos when we were there. The staff was very nice and the service was good.

aTse72UcVgSTJdbZjJDo4w.text: This place is soooo good! Please try the Ooey Gooey taco! The guac was pretty good as well, my friend slopped it all up. Now that we got the foods out the way, let's get on to the experience and some minor concerns. We did come during Happy Hour, that has awesome happy hour prices. Of course it was a bit busy but super loud in there. The seating area on the bottom area can feel a bit cramped during the busy times. There is a second floor but I am not sure of the layout. At first, we felt annoyed by the lack of attentiveness to get started with out order. But again, like I said it was busy. Once we were with our waitress, she was on top of things. It was just a slow start  The margaritas are a part of the happy hour special. (Half hour margaritas and a 1$ dollar off tacos) The margaritas were very weak! I usually can feel a margarita the first glass. They need to kick it up a notch. What's the point of drinking a margarita without  kick and fun!? However, this restaurant is the place to hit if you have a craving for a taco that makes you melt and wanna slap your mama. I heard they are opening one in Lawrenceville. And I can't wait to continue eating to Ooey Gooey taco, and try more.

3rLl93mpOZMkcMiYO1dTKg.text: Service & food is everything when you choose to spend your money & go out to eat. Food was Ok - nothing great- order what you want on their little menu sheets & wait for someone to bring it to you. Drinks are always an important part of a dining experience- ordered the Gran Classico ( I prefer anejo's).w/ no salt. 15 minutes later I get a Rita with salt ! ..not just rimmed with salt but salt dripping into my drink. Classic " newbie" or " don't give a shit" bartender mistake- who likes salty tequila & lime juice or agave?? This chick doesn't care about her customers or her job. ( probably a half ass millenial).

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. That&#39;s my water over there- doesn&#39;t even put it in front of you- obviously not working for tips- must just love her job
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. This is how it served- bartender is a terrible server

0M7Dspr01uMLVr5ylpvs5w.text: Food is great but it's small inside and gets very busy so wait times can be up to 1-2 hours even on a weekday

QzcSeEqohHDs75gDh1VbNA.text: I went there for lunch, they were receiving people at door very professionally. I sat at bar and filled out the order slip , 1st I ordered two nachos. The waitress at the bar pointed out that nachos are too big and man she was right. That nachos was huge and rich . I changed my order to one taco and only one nachos , food came out pretty quick .it was delicious and very fresh . I totally recommend it .

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nachos

3xiwQWL40Xn_h2JUJiFiyg.text: This place is awesome!  With the option to make your dream taco, there is LITERALLY something for everyone here. The ambiance and vibe inside Condado is just the guac on the taco (ha-ha)!  The endless selection of sauces, salsas and toppings make it hard to review everything, but I have to admit that the mango habanero sauce was the perfect combo of spicy and sweet. And as a jalapeno margarita afficiando, I have to say, the muddled jalapeno margarita was superb.   For $3.50 per taco, it's hard to beat as a lunchtime spot. Drinks outside of happy hour can add up, but the pitcher deal is perfect if you're with a few friends and only looking for a drink or two!

JCVPlyMgrdy4YplVVteZdw.text: I have been to Condado for lunch, dinner, and happy hour many times. They have a large number of vegetarian, vegan, and gluten fee options, which are clearly marked. The veggie proteins are all delicious, especially the Thai chili tofu. Once you get the hang of filling out the order sheets, it's very helpful to have time to customize exactly what you want. Plus, there is very little risk of error when the kitchen staff sees your order written by you.

Mvw23LzEbYB-fX7D8sedgg.text: Get the blanco queso - it's delicious! Great place you build your own tacos and they are really good :)

r4NYZyCBnX03JMl4bLPhUQ.text: Wow! I am utterly surprised at how bad this place was. The decor is amazing and the staff are fantastic but the food is awful! They have a sheet where you can pick what you want & it is a bad idea. I tried 3 of the sauces and all were misses. The ghost pepper steak was dry and flavorless. The chorizo was the worst I've ever tasted. I am pretty surprised about how bad this food was. Maybe it was just a bad day? I'm not sure but I am disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

A-n80p99EZRpU9rJm6NZKw.text: I feel like I am supposed to love this Taco spot, but for me it fell short and was a confusing experience.  We were seated quickly on a Saturday afternoon. The place is super small so I can see it becoming packed on a normal night. The atmosphere and decor was super cool and had a really nice vibe. I was excited!  I sat down to what felt like 6 menus and had no idea what to do with no direction from our server. I first ordered the margarita flight because they had about 10 different margarita flavors. I had the blackberry, strawberry and pomegranate. They were fresh and delicious!! We also had the queso appetizer. The queso was thick and creamy, mmmm. However, I was not a fan of the homemade chips. They were so thick and greasy it totally took away the flavor of the queso. I know most people like chips like this, but I'll pass.  I ordered 2 tacos. I would love to say what I had- but I honestly have no idea. There are a ton of options so you can be as crazy or as basic as you would like. I got both with chicken. One in a four shell, one in the sweet Lucy shell. This shell had guac in it, which I do not like, but there was nowhere to request no guac on the sheet. I meant to tell the server, but forgot which is my fault. However it would be nice if they went over your choices with you when you hand them your sheet. My one taco I got pineapple salsa which was delicious, however the chicken was sort of blan for me. My other taco I got one of the cream sauces which was also very good. Both tacos for me just tasted like the sauce, which was yummy but I wanted more. Next time I will try one of their speciality made tacos. (There are good options for vegetarians, too!)  The food comes out SO FAST. Which is great however I had no time to drink my margarita flight so next time I probably would not get a drink or even appetizer. This would be great during a quick lunch rush, though.  The prices here are awesome. Each taco is $3.50 with certain upcharges and specialty tacos being more. Happy hour is $1 off tacos and there are drink specials! You cannot beat that.  Overall everything was good, but not great. I will be back to try again.

OyTo3L2ZE-BaAMuqkauJwQ.text: Heard great things about this place from friends and had to check out for myself...seems like a younger crowd hang-out...not a fan of the shrimp tacos...was very chewy and cold...tables are very close together and got bumped when others walk by...probably will not return

ukHI2zhn_3A9aJvG79FczQ.text: Finally got down here for the first time last weekend.  As more and more taco places open up around the city I was impressed when this easily became one at the top of my list!  Totally customizable, you can create multiple tacos, each one with a different flavor and taste. I made one of mine spicy and one sweet, the perfect balance.  They have margaritas made in house and I would get one in a heartbeat if you can!

bM3wvdZHv_cbmXy0jIWS8A.text: I've been here twice, once for lunch and once for dinner, and both meals were great! VERY reasonably priced! You can easily get lunch for around $10.  This place seems to have gotten very popular very quickly, so I'd suggest getting in before the lunch or dinner rush. The downstairs dining room is a little overwhelming when it's crowded because the tables are quite close together and it's very loud. There is not much room for the staff or customers to walk through when it's packed. This would not turn me off but I know it would for some people.  I love the menu. They have a menu of suggested tacos and then a "Build-your-own" option where you select your shell, protein, toppings, sauce, etc. My favorite shell is the Sweet Lucy which is a hard shell in a soft shell with queso and quac in between. You can't get much better than that. I absolutely loved the combo of the brisket with the jicama & cabbage slaw and pickled onions. We also got an order of queso to split for the table and I'll have to order that every single time I go in. Their chips are amazing! Pair all that with an original margarita on the rocks with salt and I'm a happy camper! I'll be going back here very soon.

cD2GZ2T7lzhpP6TgA9_7XA.text: I was extremely disappointed and not satisfied. Guacamole was to blended, not authentic. Taco portions are tiny... not filling. Bad experience overall

oXuJHfzYRobvlohDN89H2A.text: Mostly toppings and sauce. My stomach was left unhappy and my tongue was uninspired. For all of the complexity of their ingredients, they didn't mesh well.  Nice bar staff, average food.

Pu9C4HJ_UN-sCyGWvxaArw.text: Normally I love this place but today I ordered the surf n turf which includes the ghost pepper steak. I was told it was not spicy after inquiring about the spice level. It was in fact very spicy and after informing the server of this she responded that "little old ladies eat it all of the time and never complain that it's spicy." Aside from feeling silly over this I just want everyone to know that it is spicy.

3T7a_oIikJZfVyzm1dld8w.text: I want to love Condado because I love tacos.... but it's just not worth your time, ESPECIALLY when there are three stellar taco spots within walking distance. This place does not have its shit together AT ALL. I've been here twice now and both times were pretty lackluster. The first time I came with a girlfriend for happy hour. It was decent - the food is mediocre, but during happy hour it's cheap and if the service was good, I probably would have enjoyed myself more.  The second time was a straight up disaster. I went back with a large party (10 or so), also for happy hour. I don't know if they just weren't equipped to handle us or what, but from beginning to end the service was so bad. The only way to describe our server is erratic. We had issues with who ordered what, to go boxes, food prices (all on one bill to make it easier on him), a lost credit card... it was such an nightmare. As the night went on you could tell he just wanted us to leave. He cleared a nearly full margarita away from a co-worker just to get us out of there :(  To be honest... the high point of the night was actually the food runners. They were the only ones who were fast, efficient, and seemingly interested in the customer having a good experience. If they switched places with our server our experience probably would have been much better.  If the food was amazing, I'd put up with all this for sure. But don't call yourself a "gourmet" taco spot if you're using store-bought tortillas and guac. The guac was so obviously not freshly made. It was basically store-bought pureed avocado with no flavor whatsoever.  I guess it's still new-ish but I'm not willing to see if they work the kinks out when there are so many other better taco spots with similar prices around town. We probably won't be back.

CVW8IlcQDPfW3iUFGUuK-Q.text: Went here for some birthday tacos after a pirates game and it was great. I loved the way you order the food. It makes it so customizable and easy. I went with my boyfriend and some friends and everyone was happy. I love more creative and authentic food, while my boyfriend is strictly ground beer, sour cream, and lettuce kinda guy. We both got some great tacos and left very happy.   The one and only downfall was that one of my tacos included an ingredient I didn't recognize and it turned out to be made with VERY HOT habanero peppers. The server apologized and said that the most recent batch was MUCH spicier than usual and that's not how it typically is.   The manager that was working came over and chatted with us about everything and really sealed the deal on a wonderful experience. Will definitely return to this place the next time I'm in Pittsburgh.

B7XobduDM_Hs_ssisXInKA.text: Great tacos. Have the option to build your own or go with pre-made ones both were delicious. It was our first time there and our waitress was super helpful guiding us through the ordering process. Delicious margaritas. Overall great experience.

0WkqnmaN3LlIPDwI5UwDjQ.text: It's hard to give 5 stars because Bakersfield is right around the corner. They have flights of margaritas which was awesome! The food was delicious. It just wasn't as good as Bakersfield. Prices were comparable.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

iewa0Hwi-Oe2Yp0doTeoWg.text: I love that you can build your own tacos!! And the drinks are amazing. A huge tequila selection. I wish we had one in Detroit! A place like this would just boom! - the staff also gave us amazing advice on places to visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ZTgxIzHw-JRXqg7iXbHjRw.text: absolutely amazing! if you're looking for a fun trendy place to drink some fun margaritas and design your own street tacos, this is your place. I ordered the shrimp ceviche, beef brisket, and chili tofu. only complaint is that the beef was slightly dry but definitely didn't stop me from eating the entire taco! I would recommend this place to anyone and I'll definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp with slaw, chicken with chimichurri
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pineapple salsa
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Queso

LGdJ6gEwWZWc3DPMRLlSCg.text: This is a tough one to put my finger on. I am actually torn between 3 and 4 stars.  The tacos are very good, and decent size for the price. The beer and liquor menus are very impressive and not too expensive. I like the atmosphere, it's 'hip' but not pretentious. However, what's lacking here is the service and management. At times it feels as though you are inconveniencing the staff.  "Excuse me, I hate to bother you, but could I place a food order?"  Also, they have an upstairs area with plenty of seating and a nice bar, which rarely seems open. They'd rather have the downstairs be cramped and uncomfortable, then let their patrons decide which type of atmosphere they would prefer. When it's not super packed I would say come here, but if you prefer some space and better service, go around the corner to Bakersfield. Too many good choices on the 900 block, to let service be an issue.

QTiF3j15oh8FZRmEzn5E7w.text: The tacos are very delicious, but a bit pricey.  If you are looking for never ending variety in tacos, this is the place to be.  The margaritas are very good as well.  The restaurant is quite small so service seems to be good as they want to turn the tables quickly. It is very loud and dark in here, and everytime I come here it is super crowded.

SFBbnDZs6ngSvoL9CYapOw.text: These vegetarian tacos are amazing! I'm passing through and was waiting for a train so I popped in for a quick bite and a beer-was not disappointed! I had luggage and the Host even let me leave it with them so I wouldn't have to worry about crowding up the bar, which I really appreciated. The bartender, Dave was friendly but didn't hover, and the tacos (on the spicy side) were delicious! Overall, a super cool and funky place, would definitely visit again

c4lu2NgMQytqzdseuiQB-A.text: Like the idea of fill out your own sheet to Build Your Own Taco.  They have a variety of taco shells but not the softer corn shell that most real Mexican places have, Wish they did.  It took us awhile to figure out what options we wanted on our Tacos.  Had some chips and gauc. The gauc. was a little on the sour side but still enjoyed it.  I had two tacos, one with the hard corn tortilla with chorizo and some other toppings and a flour with shrimp ceviche and some toppings.  Really enjoyed both.  Both had some nice flavors and little kick to them.  Of course your salsa and sauces options can really heat things up, but I stuck to some of the milder/medium options.  Our orders came out pretty quickly.  The system they have seems to work well. The tacos are $3 but some of the add on items do have an UP Charge.   We sat at the upstairs bar and our bartender was great.  She was really busy since it was a very crowded and noisy place.  Drinks were good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

2otrZoLp20IP315Omh2HjA.text: This place has a really cool atmosphere and I think the drinks are really reasonably priced. The margarita flight is great!! The guac and the chorizo queso were the bomb as well. The tacos are just so-so but I would definitely go back to try some other things on the menu!

npZqMeQFKki4IyqBWyHPhA.text: Just had tacos at Condado and it was fine for me. The pluses are that I was seated right away, the space is cool, my server was helpful, and service was super quick. Where it fell short was I didn't love my tacos. I ordered the beef brisket and the shrimp ceviche and a side or rice. The rice looked like plain white rice and lacked flavor. The beef was rather chewy and the shrimp in the ceviche looked as if they were pre-cooked. I found this to be more American style tacos, which in and of itself, is not a terrible thing. But if you're looking for something more authentic, this is not your place.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tacos
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Condado, you have a lot of style

3G8HADrL1ZfUS0P3TAtb_Q.text: I really love the idea of another taco spot in downtown, but Condado is lacking in many areas, namely service in comparison to La Palapa(food buggy), Bea's, Tako and Bakersfield. All of these places are worth going to ahead of Condado.  I booked reservations a few weeks ago for a group of 12 work colleagues. I asked about Happy Hour specials, and the lady working mentioned that they typically don't honor Happy Hour prices upstairs, but for this large of a group they'd be able to. When we got seated at our table, our waiter would not honor Happy Hour prices until the manager approved. Note: Happy Hour specials are apparently only honored in the downstairs bar, not upstairs for a traditional visit.  We ordered an abundance of food such as chorizo queso, traditional guacamole, and pineapple salsa to start. Our waiter, was pretty awkward and unable to take simple requests, most of the night. At one point, I literally had to take my 1/3 full margarita out of his hands because he took it from the table. His goal was to get us out of there as quick as possible. We ordered a good amount of tacos, and they were pretty average. Nothing stood out to me, but several folks mentioned they were worse tasting than the first time they ate here.  Lastly, when we got our check (all on one bill), the prices were wrong several times. When I go out to eat at an establishment, I want to be in a peaceful mentality, and enjoy my experience. My experience at Condado would've been better if I threw on a Condado tee and served my own table.  Needless to say, we won't be back any time soon!

PUIXMjtn_wQFDW6qonvGGg.text: I came late on a Saturday night and had to wait over 45 minutes in the rain for a table, and once we were seated had to use the flashlight on my phone in order to read the menu--but despite all that I would still name my first child Condado. I get a little overzealous when it comes to build your own menus, so I stick with the 'taco suggestions' which all happen to be divine. I think my ideal last meal on earth would be at least four bowls of their queso blanco and a pitcher of blood orange mango margarita (my favorite of their many margarita flavors) (they also have the option of marg flights, an idea which may surpass the wright brothers idea for the first airplane).

RHNVYxknJypOFVpK2trufg.text: Thought this place sucked, quite honestly.  Served me beer in a plastic cup like I was an a college frat party. Tacos remind me of what a taco would look like if a seven year old was trying to be clever and making cool tacos. If you want your tacos to be unusually sweet and taste like they were dipped in a swimming pool that hasnt been cleaned in nine weeks, come here. They also have no hot sauce that could can drizzle on the tacos yourself. Dafuq.

04iajCvBA8AayneF_H-Kmw.text: Condado is probably might favorite place to get tacos in Pittsburgh. You can either order one of Condado's recipes or create one of your own. These aren't necessarily authentic, Mexican tacos, but they are delicious. The queso, guac and salsa are all good as well. The beer menu also features a good selection of craft beers. On top of the food, the restaurant has a fun and quirky feel. It's a great place for a casual outing.

xTVz8YCUSN68OSMymeK_Fw.text: Condado Tacos is amazing, hands down my favorite taco joint in Pittsburgh! I've been in for dinner twice now and loved it each time. The atmosphere is laid back and the servers are super cool and friendly! The salsas, queso, and guacamole are out of this world delicious and there's plenty of chips to go around! I love the build your own taco menu and there are plenty of choices for vegetarians, too (BBQ jackfruit whattttt!!). I think both visits I got pulled pork and roasted pollo with various toppings and everything was just so good! I'm already planning what I want next time, which I hope is really soon. Btw don't let the price of the tacos fool you, they are really filling; both times I took my second taco to go!  Last but not least, the margs. Man oh man do I love margaritas and Condado hits the spot! The house is $6 and to have a flavored one is an extra $1, I'd recommend the blood orange or the prickly pear! Yum! Happy hour during the week has a half off marg special as well, I mean you cannot beat that!

Ym-qQMXGpZebmbXgpHdZrA.text: I still remember the feel I had when I took my first bite two days ago. It was so good. I remember it because I have had it for the past three days at lunch. Tacos are only $3. Everyone is nice. I was glad to be served by Becky at the bar, she was on her game and really frickin nice, and has some wickedly cool tattoos. The other times it did take a bit of time to get served, but they don't have a lot of severs, so catch one when you can.

TgQr_bHpOweSvindm_yh_w.text: Seriously always an amazing experience when we come. We have been in multiple times and love it. Prices are good, service is good, and food is amazing. I have never had food that I did not like from Condados! Love the pitchers of Margaritas.

On_PBcRCcET_AlPe5b7AJA.text: This place is trying way too hard. Born and raised in LA, I know good Mexican, and this is far from it. The queso is very similar to that of Moe's at three times the cost. Gross. The beef brisket on my taco tasted like marshmallows??? The only redeeming qualities to this meal were the salsa verde and my pomegranate margarita. The decor is...very strange. Meme-y and kind of annoying. "TACOS 4 LYFE!!!"? Not these tacos. Won't be back for the food. Might be back for the margaritas. If you want good Mexican, walk around the block to Bakersfield.

B9SlI8h-Sy51v6Bv8FcGEA.text: We chose Condado as the dinner place for my husband's birthday with a couple of his friends because who doesn't love tacos?! We definitely were not disappointed. They don't take reservations so we walked in and the wait was long, but we didn't mind because there was a bar :) In fact, there are two! One downstair and one upstairs; the upstairs one seemed larger. So we left our name and went upstairs and ordered a pitcher of Strawberry Margaritas and their Traditional Jalapeno Guacamole. The pitcher served about 6 glasses and were perfect! Not to sugary or watered down like other places make, but not too strong with the taste of cheap tequila! You could taste both the mix and the alcohol = two thumbs up! The guac was great and smooth and their chips crispy. After who knows how long, we sat down and started our fun journey of building our own tacos with the check list. Two people in our party picked from their pre-selected tacos and the other four built their own. It building your own was overwhleming at first glance, but super exciting as I looked down the list. It is nice to be able to order two different tacos with two different flavor themes! I made one with the beef brisket and a spicy theme (using the other toppings) and the second one with the BBQ jackfruit (they ran out of shrimp ceviche) with a fresh theme. Both turned out AMAZING. A good taco starts from the outside and being able to get a soft AND hard shell ensures you don't miss out on any texture! All the ingedients were great and the two tacos were huge! My husband had to help me finish them! And to think... they were both under $5 each! Everyone enjoyed their food and the service was super friendly but not overbearing. The only reason I didn't give five stars is because our table was sticky, which was annoying as we were there. But, we will definitely be back. Super affordable, delicious, and convenient for all appetites!

qlOHbjWqX0VpbBlyHOgewg.text: Highly recommend! Excellent atmosphere, excellent food, and excellent service! (Julia). Super cool idea- build your own tacos and they have a bar!

lp1L9o81IYziw7Gm4V53PA.text: Condado is a great addition to what seems to be an ever-expanding taco scene in Pittsburgh. The biggest difference here from other joints is that you can completely customize your tacos. I highly recommend the Sweet Lucy from the taco shell selections! It is a soft shell, layered with cheese and then a hard shell inside...kind of like a gordita crunch for anyone that's a Taco Bell fan. The prices at Condado are also super reasonable. You only pay $3 per taco..unlike some other places in town that charge $6 or $7. They also have a great Happy Hour where tacos are $1 off!

jH4asxU-7bJt2L0sXu1qCA.text: Great build-your-own tacos and chips and queso blanco. Right across from the Westin and really close to DLCC. Definitely check it out if you're in town for a convention (like Anthrocon).

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Build your own tacos.
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

OosnVxiKWRfRvGsQ4AnA2w.text: Obsessed. They have plenty of vegetarian and even vegan options!! It doesn't cost a fortune for a taco and they are more than filling! I would pick a condado over tako, Bakersfield, or the other "trendy" over priced taco joints in the city that offer very few options.

Gb0sSV-3VDCU21RJWJj-mg.text: Customer Service was amazing but the food wasn't great. The tortilla on the tacos were really cold. Tacos weren't so great. For the quality of food they serve, the price is too expensive. I was very disappointed.

N-rKlGwmy9lIV47gJUxKNA.text: Went for lunch yesterday at around noon with a friend. Service was good, chips and salsa was tasty and tacos were even better. Will be back.

1biOR1-wNjvKiVJK8rnoog.text: This was my first pit stop on my cinco de mayo bar crawl. Like every other Mexican place this bar was wall to wall packed. This restaurant has 2 bars so I headed upstairs. They have all types of margaritas banana, jalapeno and strawberry just to name a few. Since I had a long night ahead of me I ordered the cinco skinny margarita and some chips n salsa. Since it was super crowded they weren't using real glasses so no salt for my margarita since the salt won't stick to the cup . My margarita wasn't flavorful at all I know i removed some of the calories but this was flavorless. My chips and salsa arrived pretty quick. The chips were a lil dark for my liking and they didn't have any salt. And the salsa didn't help because it tasted like bland tomatoes. I took a glance at the menu and I liked the idea of Buliding your own taco. I may come back on a night that's not to busy to see if it's any better. Other than that this place is nothing to right home about

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Skinny margarita chips n salsa

pU74U9HWHLpO6muW0CWgng.text: Dang good tacos!  Service was awesome....bartender was extremely helpful and the patrons at the bar were all very nice.  I'm traveling on business and get tired of the same old thing....Condado's was not the same old thing.  I'll definitely be heading back there.

uMuQSVejv4XrwwslFwp-tQ.text: Awesome tacos need not say more, tons of options the combinations are nearly never ending. Excellent beer selection.

rxNukvc-rt2ZYg9aNcRGqg.text: The one thing Pittsburgh needed! The atmosphere, food, drinks and staff are all amazing. My boyfriend and I go there AT LEAST once a week. We have a taco obsession and this place surpasses standard. The variety you get there is like no other and the combinations are literally endless. The food comes out fast and delicious everytime. Happy hour is amazing and cheap! I'd recommend this place to anyone and everyone.

Kl-cQZVTAYwZ9GGvMenSpQ.text: I have been here once and both my tacos AND the margarita were the best I've ever had. I went to Tako the next day and it was nothing compared to Condado! The option for a soft, semi soft, and crunchy shell taco was awesome. There are so many varieties of tacos that you can make!! I'm a fan. Would eat here every day if i could.

uDvcf3ozYFNNOyDq11CFYw.text: Really loved the decor of the place and the artwork on the walls, combination of funny food related work and traditional Mexicano artwork. Two floors both with bars, kid friendly (they'll hold strollers at the front podium for you if you have young ones). Awesome concept of build your own tacos. Tried the shrimp ceviche, BBQ jackfruit (which is an awesome vegetarian option), and steak all of which were delicious protein options. Salsa verde was hot but delicious. Beer selection was small but good choices including some locals from PA and OH. Definitely would come back to try more combinations of different ingredient options!

hshK6V6aHblbK5AmrLONQw.text: Had a great time with work friends eating food too hottt for words.  Ghost pepper steak not a joke! It is was a great night!

9AQJCatshNEJbgE7ZHRmqg.text: As a first timer at Condado Tacos, I had a very positive experience. My boyfriend and I went during happy hour on Friday night and were very pleased with the specials. The service was excellent. Tori was our server and she was very enthusiastic and attentive during the whole visit. The food was excellent as well. We both ordered chicken tacos and they came out hot and were just as we ordered. We will definitely be coming back!

RX0z1JL4ZC2aLyWtECQmIA.text: I ordered the BlackBerry house rita. Delicious. The Ooey-Gooey tacos were fab. Fun atmosphere!

vDhEWiQHDU-EHu-QkwrgOQ.text: I will be thinking about this place every day until my next business trip. I'm usually wary of Mexican places- anyone can make a Taco. But holy cow- these were AMAZING! I had the goody goody with chicken and I could not get enough. They're as addictive as Taco Bell but as decadent as an upscale eatery. The restaurant and menu is trendy and unique but it won't disappoint. 10/10 recommend for anyone in the area.

BsN1PtUowz7zAhdd3UFyYQ.text: My experience seems to align with many of the other reviews that I read here--good food, poor service. Theres something for everyone including quite a few vegetarian taco options. There's the option to create your own tacos (many many options!) and a menu of pre-designed tacos for the indecisive people like me!  We had a group of 8 so we tried 3 different guacamole styles (regular, pineapple, and salmon) and the corn salsa, all were great and the chips were delicious. Good prices. In terms of service, our waitress brought out a plain guac instead of a pineapple guac and when we told her about it she made a face and pulled it off the table without saying a word. This is just one example where we felt we were inconveniencing the staff instead of them simply apologizing and correcting the mistake--this can really make or break a place. I was hoping our experience was just an isolated one but it seems that its fairly common here. I will probably go back because the food is good but the customer service needs to be addressed!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Horchata!  Delish
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chips and guac and tacos!
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

mRubC-JRkkLSEs8uGHS_Tg.text: I love these tacos, but I'm pretty sad about my latest experience here. I work a lot of tough hours at a catering kitchen and farmers markets. After today's downtown lunchtime market, I walked my sweaty, tired self several blocks to order 5 tacos and a couple sides, for a later dinner (and next day's lunch) with my husband. I got a water and beer while I waited, and my takeout order came out pretty quickly. I asked if it was 5 vegetarian tacos and the young man said yes. I gave a quick glance into the bag to make sure it looked like my order.  after I left a tip and finished my beer, I crossed the street to wait for the bus. Rode the crowded bus home, walked up the big ass hill to my house and when I went to put the stuff in the fridge, I was bummed to see I was one taco short. Since I had been bagging and checking other people's food orders all day, I really wanted to be able to trust the Condado staff to do their jobs and check mine. And yes, I got charged for the whole order.

jPAfkUqKQw-xK4ZvZj4XmQ.text: Most delicious tacos ever. You have to like spicy though because everything has a bite to it. Also, be prepared for a wait, especially if you have a larger group, but most definitely worth it.

PSMVgRT3DuR3jcunnzIzzw.text: Food is great and the service could not be more accommodating.  We went with a big group and lots of different requests and the service was just great!  Excellent vegan and vegetarian options. Only problem, the place gets very noisy with lots of people there. Probably not a great choice for big group.

JSaJuVjYKGL39uCX57cPxg.text: Worst ever service. Ordered dip and tacos for 3, we only received 2 orders.  (No dip) The check still had the undelivered taco and dip on it, server had no idea we didn't get the food.  Drinks were wrong first try, took forever to get the correct ones.   I left without being able to even eat.  I was so mad I just paid for the tacos I didn't get just so I could get out. Recommend to not go. Thanks so much for ruining my evening!

85uJq7sLqav3L-ksLB1cVA.text: I tried this joint again after an extremely subpar first experience. Confusion with the terrible menus continued. Servers were rude and didn't explain anything, including an extremely spicy sauce on the most basic premade taco on the menu that made a friend sick to her stomach. After the fact she joked that "we're supposed to tell everyone about this".   The house margaritas are way too sweet and full of syrup. The only good thing was FAST service (and the tacos still didn't taste fresh) so we could get out of this place. Disappointing for such a prominent location.

3HDi6o2OR4QI_p1fwHj_gw.text: Food was amazing! I went here for the first time and was blown away with their taco options. I had their Juicy Lucy and that was the best taco I had in my life. I will be returning soon!!

MYzblk71G32itasDWgzgjw.text: Tacos were just okay.  The big disappointment is that the Margaritas are soda based!   I don't know if they do it to save $ or what?  Any True fan of a good margarita knows it should be lime juice based.  Staff was friendly and they did have a nice mezcal selection (but no mezcal ritas).  I'd spend a little more and go to Bakersfield or Tako.  Update (7/1/18): I've been back and now love their tacos! The 1st time that I went was just after they opened, and I think that's why the food wasn't that good. Haven't gave their margaritas a second chance, but they have a great draft selection.

xeihDSncrbVwZj-un6PrFg.text: First visit to Condado Tacos was a relatively good one. We walked in and immediately heard how loud it was and requested to sit outside. Outside tables were clean and comfortable. Our waiter did seem to forget us for a few minutes while we were waiting to place our order, but we understood as it was a busy Friday night. Food wise, we ordered queso blanco as an appetizer that was delicious. The chicken is fantastic. Lots of choices for building tacos that it's almost hard to choose! Friendly staff, good food, great downtown location.

CGaalgyspYfbFX7npsleKw.text: I'm giving this restaurant 4 stars because of the affordability and service. The kitchen completely screwed up our orders but they brought out extra tacos to compensate so we were satisfied. There are far too many seats in this restaurant, it was extremely loud and cramped. But it was a Saturday night so I would suggest skipping Saturdays. I think this restaurant caters well to vegans and vegetarians. The queso fresco was so good! Heads up they only take reservations for large parties.

wNL1fJCoGDBfRDH2UN2jNw.text: Amazing food, drinks, and service! Such a great atmosphere. This has a slight resemblance to Smoke, but this restaurant blows Smoke out of the water. This is a definite must experience restaurant. Super amazing!

8-sAh7-YI5hE-monZY_J9Q.text: I gave it a try, but won't go back. I'll stick to Bakersfield where everything is consistently great.   1) queso: this is basically cheese soup. This is obviously something store bought and microwaved. It literally dripped off the chips. Kindof hard to eat chips and queso when the queso just runs right off.  2) tacos: I ordered my own, not the pre made suggestions. A brisket and a chicken taco. The meat was cooked at some point in the day, but wasn't even remotely warm when I got it. I guess it had just been sitting there. Other than that, not bad. Tacos are hard to mess up.  3) utensils/plates/lack thereof: I get it. You're trying to save money. But this is a taco place. Tacos are messy. You need plates if people are going to be sharing chips and queso. You can't just build a plate fort out of paper towels. Your location is downtown, so I assume you're appealing to the business crowd during lunch hours. These people wear suits and ties, etc. Come on... 4) service: in the case that you only provide paper towels, please be sure that the servers are attentive. Ours ran out at the table. I timed it for 20 minutes and nobody brought us any more. So that's the equivalent of not having a plate for 20 minutes. Also as I was leaving, the hostess was at the door and was not going to say bye. I stared her down until she said bye to me.  5) cleanliness: there was food remnants all over the floor and all over the tables...and benches... the entire time I was there. Probably because there aren't any plates or utensils, but someone could be cleaning this up... 6) "sides": ordered a side of rice. This came in a tiny condiment dish, with a plastic spork. It was the driest, stickiest rice ever. Basically minute rice. No flavor. Chipotle had this beat hands down.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie tacos and a &#34;side&#34; of minute rice
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Two very dirty tables sat like this our whole meal
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Food left all over the floor

adGUpagzIzndvcyFDrRUMg.text: The tacos and service were great. Nice Happy Hour vibe. The crunchy taco shells are made fresh.

uDI7_3OIaAosekE1LGjTJQ.text: Went to Condado for Happy Hour and it was delicious! Half off margaritas did not disappoint. I had a pomegranate and a spicy marg-- beware it is VERY spicy. We ordered the trio and the queso, guac (get the Tuscan!) and salsa were all so good I couldn't pick a favorite. I also loved that I was able to make my tacos to order because I can be a bit picky with my toppings. Try the BBQ pulled jackfruit in a taco -- vegetarian or not.. you'll love it.

jys5R9Cg-LtanYjZnzXAag.text: tacos! Tacos! TACOS! The 412 taco scene has some new competition in town that is everything muy bueno. Stroll in to this corner spot and be transported to chic Mexico - Dia de los Muertos designed/stenciled walls; bar top tables and wooden bench booths; and a tequila lined wall behind the bar. The upstairs is roomier with another bar, so don't be alarmed by the intimate setting downstairs. Once you've settled in, it's time to play decision maker...and the options are limitless! Order some queso + housemade chips while you get your taco design on, but take heed and pace yourself! The Suggested Tacos menu will save you time and includes the El Tradicional (choice chorizo!), Surf 'N Turf (mad spicy yo!) and some solid vegetarian options such as the Dutch Dragon. Or choose your own adventure and start with your tortilla, pick your protein, and finish with toppings 'til your tickled pink. It sounds easy, but I dare you to stay focused! The options are not only extensive, but all fairly tempting. And did we mention the price?! Where else can you get a substantial, tasty taco for $3? Mas tacos, por favor!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dutch Dragon a la izquierda y Surf &#39;N Turf y El Santo a la derecha.

rvdrELuDm8KVEJ-0cUlJIQ.text: If I could give this place zero stars I would. I waked in after then Penguins game to grab a few of the specialty pints and maybe a bite to eat.
