I sat at the bar and wasn't even looked at during the 15 minutes I was there. The place was not very busy and the bar tender seemed overwhelmed. I even tried to say "excuse me" to get his attention right in front of me and he kept on moving. I would love to try some of the beers on tap and what looks to be good food but that would require having a competent staff. Definitely a disappointment.

ivQvfjZg5Uu8mbwtb7eSqQ.text: Great food. Well worth the wait if there is any. Create your own tacos and excellent queso dip. Good selection of craft beers.

5D_M48XWpTvMuRX7mzNfyQ.text: This place is so cool! I love a restaurant that can deliver not only in the kitchen, but on the atmosphere/scene as well! For starters we ordered salsa verde, salsa roja and chorizo queso. I was a big fan of the salsa roja and chorizo queso! I was debating on whether I build my own taco or order one of their creations off the menu. The build your own menu has a lot of options to pick from! I decided to build my own with the following: flour tortilla, pulled pork, pickled red onions, queso fresco and mexican chimichurri. I will say the pickled red onions and mexican chimichurri were game changers in the build your own taco challenge. The flavors really mixed nicely together with the pulled pork. I will also say that I was a little disappointed with the pulled pork to taco shell ratio. I felt like there was a lot of taco shell and not enough meat compared to what my other friends had in theirs. You really can't beat the price though! $3 for a pretty decent sized taco shell, compared to others I have had in town that are smaller and more money. I really cannot wait to come back and try one of their creations and devour more queso and salsa roja! If you love tacos and love options, this is the place for you!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Build your own! Rice, pulled pork, queso fresco, picked red onions and Mexican chimichurri

oaaAoBIqrpmgLCFgafqAig.text: My roommate took me here because I love Mexican food. These tacos are definitely pretty Americanized, but good none the less. I'd eat here again. The food arrived quickly and was good. I enjoyed making my own taco creation. The servers can seem a little lazy because all they do is take the order that you write on a card. This was a turnoff for some of the people that I was with but it didn't bother me too badly.

dBsIL4eW5v276Sm1ncww7A.text: Disappointing. They have a really inclusive menu, but the food just wasn't good. The meat in the tacos (chicken/beef/even pulled pork) was inexcusably dry. They served all the corn tortillas our tacos were on cold(?!). The sauces were good, but tacos were under seasoned so I could hardly taste the sauces, this goes for made to order, and house tacos. I ordered a margarita, and it was in a highball glass, and waaay off on the lime:tequila ratio. And it wasn't lime, it was mix.   Good tequila selection though. I would go here if I wanted to drink tequila, and eat corn chips with dips, but I wouldn't order tacos here again.

mo3nDG8CBTttKxXMRnbujQ.text: Carbonated margs on draft, yes please!!!! This was one great marg, served in a mason jar--so hipster! My tacos were good, but I think I dressed them up too much, and I would recommend simplicity, rather than piling everything on that sounds good. One of my tacos did come out with beef instead of pork, which was a bummer because I was dreaming of a pork and pineapple salsa taco and then it didn't happen. I should have said something, but it was loud and crowded and we were at the bar and I didn't want to annoy the bartenders, who were super busy. Anyway, I'm from out of town, but I really wouldn't mind coming her again while on this trip, so that should tell ya something!

7xa7JMRjh1Enlh9YdIYa4A.text: My boyfriend and I were craving Mexican food (shocker) and we have been wanting to try Condado, it was happy hour, and it was Friday... all signs pointed in the right direction! Our happy hour dreams were quickly shot down when we arrived to Condado and the hostess sat us upstairs (even though there were open seats down stairs). When I asked for the happy hour menu, our waiter informed us that we could not get happy hour upstairs. This was a bad start to our Mexican happy hour! Next time, I will make sure to tell the hostess we are there for happy hour.. hello 1/2 price margaritas!!   I still ended up ordering the muddled jalapeno margarita. This margarita was just OK for me- nothing super special about it. Chris ordered a Modelo & we also started with the chorizo queso. This queso was the best part of the meal! It was amazing & the homemade tortilla chips were just as delicious. They also gave you a generous serving of the queso and brought out more chips as needed.   I loved the idea of the create on your own tacos. I didn't know that Condado offered this and I was super excited to make my own! There are plenty of options from the meat, toppings, and shells. It made it hard to create! I had 2 tacos- the 1st was a hard shell with chicken and some different fillings (can't remember) and the 2nd was a soft shell with pulled pork, pineapple salsa and a habanero BBQ sauce. The meats were just OK and there was nothing super special about the shells. I did love the pineapple salsa though!   The atmosphere inside Condado in my opinion was great! It would be a great place to come with a group of people for tacos and margaritas! Although the food isn't as amazing as some of the other taco spots in PGH, the prices were more wallet friendly.

HcoN_n6CYLVPeySJlpmCdg.text: All they serve are tacos (which weren't the best I've tasted), the wait was long, and you don't have a choice of frozen or over ice margarita's (only over ice).  In my opinion it wasn't worth the hassel of going downtown, finding a parking space, and then paying for parking.

OtrbSBDYpJ8-5BaGKfwsWw.text: Giving Condado an additional star than I planned since I've been here once before and enjoyed it. I dined here for a quick snack and one last drink with friends before heading our separate ways. One friend and I split the Queso Elote. This was the only shared meal and now she and I have a shared sickness! I didn't want to spend my last night visiting the city going between the bed and the bathroom, but unfortunately the queso had other plans.

2j1GHUr9bapgJM0BzgEa4Q.text: Great service, so fast! So many choices for tacos, create your own or pick from ones they have. Be adventurous, everything tastes amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

vTE9HgNwwGGo2f_UOhL91g.text: Best tacos, chips, and guac I've ever had! They are a little pricey but always worth it as I never leave hungry. Their service is great - almost too great! The food comes out quite fast after ordering, so sometimes we'll be slow to order just so we can have more down time to enjoy our apps and conversation. One of my favorite places to eat in Pittsburgh. They also have a rewards program, so that's nice!

SR8ATKvokU_cWvOBFH_Bwg.text: Brandon was excellent! The tacos were amazing and he was on top of getting drinks, etc! He split up the checks so easily and was a fun server for our bday celebration!

WrSQqSfODLRUBXNJGOZ59A.text: I must have caught them on an off night because my whole experience was meh. The only reason I gave two stars is because the queso is amazing. You fill a slip out and pick your tacos fillings and sides.  Service: now I give servers the benefit of the doubt on a Friday during happy hour but this was really bad. She mixed up a lot and after we were specific and walked her through what each of us had she still messed up the checks. This was after having to get other servers to flag her down so we could order drinks and get water refills  Food: like I mentioned before the queso was fantastic. The chips are fresh made and I dug those. Tacos I got two crispy tacos and the shells were super greasy. The shrimp in was good but they weren't filled very well.   Honestly, the whole experience was underwhelming, but there is so many good reviews that I may try it again.

nwWzWCTrfWU_vx61SmAiBQ.text: Always good food and fast service. The staff is really nice and always accommodating. Love stopping here for a good meal and I highly recommend to out of town guests.

nhQvpwGxtxF1EpRFLShCCQ.text: Yeah, kind of in love with this place. Good liquor. GREAT tacos. I was staying nearby for a convention and I loved it so much I went 4 times in 3 days! Best tacos I've ever had. I want this place to come to my rural Iowa town!! It would be huge here with our private, liberal arts college. Everyone would come from miles around just for this. The prices were spot on, the food was filling and delicious without being greasy at all. (A complaint I have with other taco places.)  I tried a variety of their options, but my favorite was easily the pulled pork with the Sweet Lucy shell ( flour soft + corn hard + queso + guac) and a side of chips with the Elote queso dip. Everything was FRESH and I love that it's a build your own kind of place. I need to go back and do more research and try other combinations.  GO THERE NOW.

1OG6SIsQqEw5aFWPf9Hgjw.text: Brother in law recommended this place when visiting Pgh! 2 floors and you fill in the dots like an old grade school test for how you want your tacos made (so any mess up is on you lol)!!! Get rum and they have Old Style beer from Chicago also!!! Server/ waiter Mikey was great also!!!! Check it out!!!

GguiT_NlLjEhwo4_oeSm0g.text: Downtown is filling up with taco spots. Normally I wouldn't complain because tacos are my all time favorite food, throw in some chips/salsa/guac and a cool pitcher of margaritas and I'm in heaven. My friend and I decided to stop here on our way to the penguins game. We always feel like getting tacos before the game is good luck.  Condado is in the old Tonic space which is awesome and it truly looks great in there! The waiter explains the whole ordering processs, explains the menu, and gives up a run down of cocktails.  We proclaimed "Pitcher of hour margaritas please" and the waiter obliged. The pitcher came, he graciously poured our first glasses for us (it tends to spill from the pitcher sometimes). We both gave each other a look of "oh no! These are NEON GREEN! EEEK". The house marg tasted like what I used to make in college/late highschool. That neon green unnatural color mixer and whatever tequila was cheapest but not total shit. It was palatable but with all the insurgence of taco places downtown, it was by far the most disappointing I've had. Maybe I should have sprung for the more expensive version, I don't know. We ordered the queso diablo. Jalapenos, habenero, and onion. The queso was really good. Very smooth. The chips are made in house, which I LOVE. They were a LITTLE greasy and definitely salty (but I love salt). We even got a refil of chips to finish the queso with. So far my experience was at a 50% enjoying and liking the food and 50% that margarita was subpar. We each get 2 tacos, my friend gets a shrimp and a tofu one. I get brisket and chicken. We make our own tacos. There are SO MANY CHOICES. It's very similar to how burgatory does their build your own. I probably made some wrong choices but my tacos were "meh". I had my chicken one with the sweet lucy shell (seriously...it's Amazing) and i really liked that one. I was not a fan of the brisket. It had a weird flavor I just couldn't place. My friend said her tacos were "ok, but I feel like when given the option I'm going to choose the wrong toppings and ruin my taco".  We closed out and went on our merry way about town to the game.  I would probably hit this place for happy hour and get some appetizers, but I think the margs and tacos have a way to go.  Big props on the multiple vegan/vegetarian options though!!!

1UbooCDNfki09ajiskqmAA.text: This is probably the grossest Mexican restaurant I have been everything was marinated there wasn't a corn tortilla the tacos are overwhelming and gross go to a traditional Mexican place if you don't want to be appalled first the tortilla wasn't cooked and was like it was from a cold supermarket everything was cold but the steak the shrimp was freezing and hard my friends taco was the sweetest thing I've ever eaten and the tofu was hard and almost frozen do not come here ever!!!!!

_wU10ZWa_V3Yz4NcgRf_XA.text: This is a go - to spot to meet my friend for dinner and a few drinks. I've been there only around 6pm during the weekdays, but it's always VERY crowded. We like to sit at the bar, but it seems like for a table, there is not much wait on weekdays (10 minutes?). I've always felt like the bartenders are friendly and talkative, even though they never stop moving! Beer/ liquor selection is unique but not intimidating. They're signature cocktails are fresh tasting, not overpowering in any department.  The food here is really the main event, though. I'm convinced that no matter what you eat here, you will not be disappointed! Fresh vegetables and house - made salsas and verdes, juicy meats, and a TON of food for the prices! I ordered the tortilla fritos with ghost pepper steak, and had enough to save for lunch the next day! And it was $7!

bTN15wrOKQfFdOlNhbZ-NQ.text: Okay, I know this probably seems like a recurring theme...but please apply the caveat "I got steadily drunker as the evening progressed" to the tail end of the review.  Okay...  5 stars on the accomodating staff.  Friendly.  Flexible.  We started with a group of 6...wait...sorry 8...wait...sorry...10 people for a friend's birthday party and the staff just kept finding ways to get us seating.  It is NOT their fault that the seating we ended up with was apparently a repurposed shoebox in the ass end of the top floor of the restaurant.  That was not on them.  I don't know what that space normally does...but it did hold 10.  And the restaurant was steadily busy all night.  So full marks there.  We started out the evening on the ground floor.  We ordered drinks from the menu.  They were good.  I don't...I don't REALLY remember what they were.  I'll look them up.  Bear with me.  RIGHT!  Okay...I got the Delicioso.  House Margarita, muddled jalapeno & cucumber + splash  of soda...right up my alley.  It was really good.  I probably would have ordered another one later except I thought it would be smarter to order a pitcher instead.  Related note...it is almost impossible for a single father of a younger daughter to order the Delicioso without doing so using an impression of Backpack from Dora the Explorer.  The pitcher I got was the Kahlo - Hornitos Reposado, club soda, fresh lime juice, fresh mint.  I should take a minute here to acknowledge that written underneath the margarita menu (in too small a font, if we're being fair) was, "Keep in mind, silver tequila (used in many of our signature cocktails and margaritas) can sneak up on you. The smooth  flavor doesn't taste like alcohol, but we assure you, it's in there!"  Heed this.    The drinks were great.  Let's give them another five stars.  The speed with which our order was taken was a downer.  I'd rank it pretty low, honestly, but they were so good about moving us around, and also...I had a pitcher of alcohol...so I wasn't really THAT irritated by it, but if I'd have been sober longer I might have been.  They were busy.  We were a big...seemingly nomadic table...so I have to give them a pass.  I'll rate that 3 stars.  I've sampled most of the elevated taco joints in Pittsburgh, so I was excited to try out theirs.  They have either a build your own menu, or a few signature styles.  I was surprised how many vegan/vegetarian options there were.  I think one of the three I got was vegetarian.  I was...I was quite drunk when the food arrived.    BUT...BUT...they were goooooood.  And that's not the tequila talking.  After my first taco, the girl across the table from me said she couldn't finish hers and passed it across and that one was even better than the one I'd ordered.    The Mantis:  Sweet Lucy shell, jackfruit, onions, tomato, Chihuahua cheese, and mango habanero sauce. Honestly ordered it because I wanted to say "jackfruit" over and over.   What?  I was drunk.  George's Dirty Taco:  Flour soft shell, queso blanco, rice, black beans, onions and dirty sauce This one just made me laugh.  I was eating George's dirty taco.  And laughing.  Because I'm twelve.  And I was drunk.  Surf 'n' Turf:  Flour soft shell, queso fresco, rice, ghost pepper steak,  shrimp ceviche, lettuce, onions, roja salsa, &  dirty sauce This one sounded the best to me, and I honestly don't remember whether I even ate it. I think I did though.  And it was hot.  I poured myself another drink from the pitcher.  All in all I have no idea which tacos I ate and didn't eat.  And I think the fact that I put my name on the order slip (they give you pencils and taco order forms at the table) as Rico Caliente probably contributed to the chaos that forced one of our party to just pay for the entire night on his credit card.  And I guess...I guess arms raised in victory and shouting "WOOHOO!" was not the correct reaction to this because everyone else seemed to be saying things like, "Oh my god, no, you can't possibly" and "It's too much" and stuff like that and frankly I was just happy to still have enough money to go to the next place, and also I was drunk.  So...I will DEFINITELY be back.  Something I didn't mention was the decor.  I loved it.  Lots of contrasting sugar skull-esque sorts of murals.  It was a fun vibe.  GREAT happy hour locale.  Really good food.  I'll...fine tune my food review in at some future date.

3pu4wWh2o89pTMmbuJ2G0Q.text: Best price for great tacos in town. Their queso and drinks are also great. The happy hour specials include $ off tacos and margaritas.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. cool place

aVlLLPHKP74eOj4HRNyZqQ.text: Once upon a time, downtown Pittsburgh offered very little to chose from when you wanted a taco, now there are several Mexican/taco options downtown Pittsburgh. Condado offers delicious taco options at moderate prices. I suggest creating your own taco and coupling if with a margarita if it isn't lunch time.  Not a huge fan of the Day of the Dead decor, but if you like it, Condado is the place to visit. It is a great place for a quick lunch. Can get loud.

xH31zIH8EuTPGlQCK9N1yA.text: Condado Tacos makes some of the best tacos I've had in Pittsburgh.  They also make some of the best margarites I've had in Pittsburgh (the blood orange one is, in my opinion, in a rarefied class).  And, much to my surprise, they also have one of the best brunch menus in Pittsburgh (which is basically the taco menu with breakfast options like putting scrambled eggs in your tacos).  The build-your-own taco is inventive, and the wide variety of options makes this a decent place for groups of many sizes and composition, though it's admittedly hard to stick to certain types of "healthy eating" diets here.  Now that they have four locations (at the time of this writing) with proven success, I'd say the concept is ready for more rapid expansion.  I'd love to see more locations in the area, and I sincerely hope the owners can find a working model for growth without sacrificing options or quality.  There are many neighborhoods in Pittsburgh and cities in America where this would be a popular restaurant.

Ysci9n7LFGN_iiXNKXBmig.text: Tacos, Margaritas, and guacamole!  Condado is a wonderful new option for tacos and brunch in downtown. A colorful vibrant interior and friendly staff will greet you. Seating is available in the bar area, upstairs dinning room, and some tables set up outside that allows you to enjoy the energy of downtown and is especially great when anthrocon is in town.   The menu is tacos, guacamole and dips, and a few salads. This is not a full Mexican restaurant but what they do they really do well. They offer a wide selection of specialty tacos and a create your own tacos option. The create your own has a wide variety of options. They have several stuffed taco shells that are a soft tortilla and crunchy shell sandwiched with toppings like cheese, beans, bacon, and guacamole. I definitely suggest trying one of those options.  I had the Ju-Ju shell stuffed with chorizo and queso  and it was amazing.   Speaking of queso this place has several queso options but the Dirty Queso with chicken, beans, and the wonderful Dirty sauce (that dirty sauce should go on everything). Plus guacamole and salsa.  They also have a wide selection of Margaritas, tequilas and beer. I suggest a Margarita sampler to start but you can just dive into a pitcher if you like.   I will be back at brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dips
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tacos
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Margarita sampler

HMveoc7HUcf5eduuQW5hAw.text: I am very torn about this 3 star rating. I was super excited to try this place because I have heard GREAT things, and I love tacos like the rest of the world, so this was a must try for me. I went with a group of 5 on a Saturday evening, and there was no trouble getting a seat. There are two floors, which is really nice. There is outside seating, but not for more than two per table due to limited space.   There are like a million different menus when you sit down, so just be sure to look at all of them. There are drink menus, taco menus, taco shell description menus, and build your own taco menus. It was a little overwhelming for me, to be honest. I decided to build my own tacos and I legit had no idea what I was doing. Our server gave us a general run down, but we were basically on our own when it came to figuring out what the proteins and toppings were.   I couldn't even tell you the toppings I put on anything because I basically just panicked, blacked out, and selected things. I only have myself to blame for the tacos I made, I know that. I picked the beef brisket and pulled pork for my proteins, and they were both ok. I did pick one of the "fancier" taco shell choices, and I was pretty happy with it, but I didn't know what I was getting until it came out. My friend had a shell that was like a cheesy gordita from taco bell, which seemed like a nice treat.  The decor was really cool, and I really was digging the vibe. The beer list was lengthy and they have an EXTENSIVE list for tequilas. Honestly, I just think I'm the type of person that doesn't do well with an endless amount of choices. I need a little more guidance. I will not write this place off just yet, I'm hoping to have a better experience next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

5kF0bo2o0l99xok3AosTsQ.text: My hubby surprised with with a lunch date and he chose this place because, tacos!  We entered at about 1:00 pm and had no trouble getting a seat upstairs.  The hostess and wait staff were very friendly and efficient.   Our eyes were much larger than our bellies this trip - we ordered way too much food!  We started with the Queso dip. $6 and a good size serving.  The chips were very crispy and fresh.  We both ordered 3 tacos (yeah, I know!) and decided to stick with the suggestions rather than create our own (or I would have been there all day!)  I ordered the Ooey-Gooey, El  Tradicional and the El Santo.  They each were unique and tasty in their own way.  There was a nice amount of heat to each one and there were a pretty good size.   The sides come in a small cup and are really nothing to write home about (we got the rice and bacon refried beans.  Overall, we had a good experience here and will be back.  I like the concept of create your own taco - I think I will try that the next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak Nachos!
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Baked Potato Queso (Nov Queso of the month)
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Love this wall art

ej_CtFcpmzn4I-3pgMZp5w.text: You can't beat the price for the food.  It's not the best taco place in town, but the value is phenomenal and keeps me picking up food here.

LtxO0AQ-tWckSZoNreHKSw.text: Delicious food! We always get the Tres Amigos salsa sampler. Highly recommend the dirty queso, blanco queso and the out this world corn salsa! All the tacos are delicious and you can even build your own. This place is great especially for vegetarians and vegans! Staff is friendly and tons of drinks to choose from as long as love tequila! Great date night spot or a place to get together with friends. Our waitress Sarah D was so nice! Food comes out quickly and just the way you wrote it down on the paper.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

FMSD-o8qUpxOaiQhYKdi8w.text: I would say this place is a acceptable place to go to for tacos downtown, although in my opinion Tako or Bakersfield are better, they are not always easy to get into especially on the weekends. The drinks are decent and the tacos are build your own, which is nice you can add what you want. It has a pretty cool atmosphere but the food is good but not great.

_2XQI8pCq-qHDUcMZbgxPg.text: Went here after a Penguins game in search of good, unique tacos. Got a dip trio, which comes with two salsas also. Highly recommend the chorizo queso, my dip of choice of the 5.   For drinks, my husband got the traditional Marg and I went mango. Yum, although no salt on the rim. I'm sure you could get some if you asked, but that's usually a given for a Marg.   When it came to taco time, I wanted to go with ones on the list because I often think the chef knows what meats, Vegis, and sauces pair together best for the ultimate tasty taco. Unfortunately, of the list of about 10 tacos, there was like one chicken and one beef and the rest were vegetarian or vegan friendly with no meat. I'm all for having these options, but carnivores like me want a taco with some substance. I don't know if they'd add meat to the vegan and veg options, but I opted to just create my own instead at that point. I did one with brisket and one with pulled pork. I made sure to add different Vegis, sauces, and shell choices to each so I could sample as much as I could from their list of add ons. I've gotta say, I made two pretty perfect creations. All the ingredients were fresh, my brisket one was my fav. This could be partly due to the fact that after all the dips and taco #1 I had no room for taco #2, so it went home with me and was reheated for lunch the next day.   I'd def return, and it was a nice simple walk from PPG Paints for a post-game dinner. But my only suggestion would definitely be to have more suggested tacos including meats.

7zyi0gSr1uJ5mBLkc39Kkg.text: Came here today for lunch/work meeting. Despite the lunch rush they were able to accommodate our party of 6 quickly. The food was good and reasonably priced but the overall experience was just ok. Although I would probably come back again, it would not be my first choice for taco place in the city.

q1HcZPWVmtfmZPtgJSsZIQ.text: Went here around 730 on a Saturday with two friends.  It wasn't overly busy we got right in.  We were very excited to try it however the services was atrocious.  They brought my friends drinks out incorrectly 3x.  The waitress kept running away before I could even order one.  Once I finally did it came out 30 minutes into us being there because she forgot it.   We ordered chips and salsa.  Salsa was good, the top few chips were good, the rest were crushed, like inedible without a spoon crushed.    Got past that and finally got out Taco orders in.  The tacos are more like 3 stars - pretty good.  I loved the different options you can create for yourself.  Tacos are reasonable and good size portion.  I got the pork and the chicken.  Pork was way better than the chicken.  Didn't love that they didn't have traditional corn tortillas as an option, but they have other unique shell options that are reminiscent of Taco Bell (in a good way).   The menu situation is also weird, there's like 4 different menus.  I don't understand why they can't condense it to 2 menus, one to order off of and one for drinks.  I would go back to give them another shot on service and chips, but not running back.

sVIts5zKWyJ24daXi3sKDQ.text: Thank you Condado for offering tasty American tacos. I am part Mexican and love authentic Mexican food. However, I have a picky spouse that has the nerve to complain about said authentic Mexican and is always craving cheddar on tacos with flour tortillas. The existence of Condado has been a blessing in my life. Lol.  I stopped in with my boyfriend before a birthday party. We both got two tacos that were very filling. You can build your own and there are endless combinations! I had one steak and one pulled pork while my bf got two chicken tacos. He was sooo happy with everything and that made me extra happy. He said it was his new favorite taco place in Pittsburgh. Tacos are the world's most perfectly balanced meal and I am always more than happy to eat them. So, thank you Condado for giving me another excuse to do just that!

ukKs_maDmxBiUIk3Ee_vOQ.text: Amazing tacos and margaritas. I got the taco with the soft shell and the hard shell and it was great. We also got the queso which was thick and very delicious. The service was great and the location was easy to get to. The aesthetic of the place was very cute and I would definitely go there again!

7YE3xnICTFlLDqh8ZAAGzw.text: Love this place so much! Let me get my two negatives outta the way:  1. So effing loud! Full of woo girls 2. They don't use the Nowait app 3. Waiting area is non existent   Ok now to the good stuff. The margaritas are so good! I recommend getting a pitcher to share, it's more economical.  The guac and queso are killer and the homemade chips always crispy and perfectly salted.   The build your own taco scheme is so simple it's genius! You cant go wrong with the shells but I would recommend hard over soft. The juices from the salsas and sauces and meats will make the floor tortilla soggy.  I haven't met a meat there that wasn't good. Seriously just go. NOW!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My taco assortment: 2 chorizo 1 pulled pork
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Queso Blanca
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mango margarita

mBak8cb8YP_ryYNsitTL_g.text: Tacos are large and very filling. They're pretty good too. Margaritas are half off during happy hour (5-7p). They have lots of flavors to choose from! My favorite was the blackberry margarita. I also tried mango and prickly pear. Mango was great if you like sweet drinks. Prickly pear was more sour. There's a taco, guac, queso, and margarita of the month so there's always something new to try!

g4Ic-oEicdM-8kOYdgrtsw.text: BEST. TACOS. EVER.   As a vegetarian, I think this is the best taco joint to provide a plethora of flavorful and exotic options for vegetarians. Hands down, probably the best tacos I've ever had. Even my boyf who isn't a foodie and hates tacos, fell in love with this place.  I always order the mantis (jackfruit taco). It's perfectly spicy and not to the level where you can't handle it. Their queso blanco is mouth-watering and their margs are great too.   Pricing is another plus. All house tacos are $3-5 each. If you create your own, it can get expensive depending on the amount of toppings you put.   It gets really crowded on weekend nights, and can be a 1 hour wait for tables of 3 or more people. However, it's a pretty small wait (sometimes none at all) for 2 people. The place is empty for brunch on Sundays, which is a great time to go.

Xf7gLENpHhKHeLzN97I8YA.text: Cool taco spot. I ordered 4 tacos. First taco (George's Dirty Taco) it was a good taco packed with savory flavor. Second (The Mantis) a yummy jackfruit taco with some spice. I enjoyed it. Third and fourth was the same taco I have to say it was my least favorite (Dutch Dragon) it was just to many flavors in this taco. Not my favorite, not bad, just my least favorite of the bunch. I liked the feel of this place. It has a cool hipster taco vibe. Plus the beer selection was good. I'd go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My order from left to right GEORGE&#39;S dirty taco, The Mantis, Dutch Dragon
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bar

QvrV4RWxbmntXUz6nGpyFA.text: Absolutely delicious! I had been to Condado twice and both times, my mind was blown by how amazing everything was. From the presentation to the taste to the friendly staff, I give this place two thumbs up!

m6LgCGiT3HXjz60guy9xew.text: We've heard good things about this place and were excited to try out a new taco joint hoping it was different than the other ten that are in town.   We arrived and were quickly seated at a table that was far too small for two people. We only ordered drinks, chips and tacos but they didn't fit on our table.   The service was slow and our server acted like she had better things to do. We waited over 20 minutes for our drinks and in that time we contemplated leaving. We stayed because we were so hungry and hoped anything we ordered would change our minds.   We both ordered a few tacos including the surf and turf taco which we were told wasn't ready yet because he seviche wasn't prepared. It was happy hour, so assuming it was a busy time it should have been prepared. We didn't replace it with something else and quickly ate so we could get out of there.   Maybe it was a bad day for our server or something but we wanted to love it based on the new twist it brought to tacos. We left and walked to Bakersfield down the street. We may be back if everything else is booked.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

RnViSCLxtiIhmlR0rpk3wg.text: We stopped in in a busy Saturday afternoon and were mostly pleased with our experience. The food was good and the wait staff was good even though it was busy in there.   The front door host was in a constant big rush with everyone and spent about one second greeting people until he rushed them to their seats.

pCV5YFRGBRRi9BQrq7fSYA.text: I'm about done with Condado, and I no longer recommend it.  After 6 experiences there (out of 8 attempts) in the last year... Positive: The tacos can be absolutely delicious, and the customize-your-own checklist format is fun.  Flip-side: At least 1/3 of the tacos we have ordered have come out not as ordered, missing ingredients requested (sometimes at additional cost), or just totally different. Sometimes meats are warm, other times cool, other times a weird stale-cooled temperature/taste. Extremely inconsistent.  The biggest negative is that, in our experiences, the restaurant doesn't prioritize customer service/ experience at all. The vibe we've caught says, "We're popular and hip now, so you're lucky to be here, and we're just too busy and cool to have to look out for your experience."    First, there is often a wait, and the very strict practice of hosts refusing to give time estimates for the wait is maddening. The vibe that comes across is, "Given how *exceptionally* busy and cool we are, the totally common practice of giving wait estimates is just too difficult in our special case." Yet restaurants way more hip, cool and busy somehow manage. We're grown ups; we understand that estimates are estimates. If you-- out of the experience you have with the timing, typical flow and capacity of your own restaurant, which a customer cannot possibly have--  estimate a likely wait of 10-15 minutes, and it takes 20, it's fine. Believe me, a host refusing to say whether the wait is likely around 10 minutes, or more like 45, makes a customer feel wayyyy more irate than having to wait a little longer than expected.   Tables in the downstairs are ridiculously small and cramped. The ones we've been seated at twice as a party of 4 were maybe 2.5 x 2 ft at the most, with a majority of the table space taken by the big paper towel/ menu card/ pencil dispenser. ("You can just put that on the booth seat beside you," said our server.) The last time, late on a Tuesday evening, the members of my party happened to be in the mood for just water to drink instead of our usual sodas, drafts, mixed drinks. The server acted noticeably irritated with that, and from then on was brusque and rude. We proceeded to order a respectable 12 tacos to perch on our little table, but not good enough, I guess. Sorry for not making your night.

svuHo6itOFIcb_-nodrKRw.text: Family 6 + a service dog walk into a bar...  I've only heard great things about Condado, so I was eager to try it. So of course I suggested it when my family was in town because I figure - well, we all love Mexican food and guac is a universal love in our family.   However, my little bother was exhausted (cue a hangry attitude), my brothers girlfriend and one of my besties is a picky eater, and my Dad has his service dog. So I was a bit nervous I picked a place that 1. was going to be awfully crowded for a Friday evening and 2. wasn't going to satisfy a picky eater, a hangry teenage boy, and be a comfortable spot for my Dad and our service pup.   But all my nervous were most definitely appeased. We had an amazing waitress who was super helpful in navigating the menu and also making sure we were in a comfortable spot to accommodate our service dog and the the rest of us. It was a Friday in August - the place was packed, but still they made us comfortable.   The guac was incredible. The salsa was great. Both came out super quick and paired sooo beautifully with the pitcher of Blood Orange Margarita we'd ordered.   I'm a vegetarian who loves Mexican food. And this place had seriously good veg options that I was SO satisfied with. And even with a picky eater, a tired teenager, a vegetarian, and 3 others to appease, we all walked out of Condado thrilled with the experience, the food, the service.   I keep trying to find excuses and company to go back with. Whether you just wanna get buzzed off some tequila, enjoy a little snack of chips and guac (they have great specialty guac, too) or simply stuff yourself with tacos - this is the place.

w7mNHbLT6jYZDLOuD3eiKQ.text: It was very popular in the afternoon (office lunch hours) when I passed by on a workday. Then I came on a Saturday afternoon and it's not that crowded. But it's a taco place I would never come for a second time--The tacos are cold, meats are cold, the flavor combination is not my type (too sour or too much cheese)... Guacamole is very salty... The server gave us the check before we finished the food.......But she split our check before we asked which is nice. One thing special about the taco is the two shells - soft outside and crunchy inside, though I don't like it. Overall it's not that good as I expected.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Guacamole with Pineapple

rKliijwkEzczaPB3WiuFaQ.text: The food at Condado tastes like it was prepared by someone who worships at the altar of Guy Fieri. I ate one taco and was sorry I finished it. The rest I brought home thinking it could be salvaged or repurposed. Alas, I couldn't undo that culinary crime, so I tossed it.   Stay away from Condado. It's awful.   FYI: I'm not your average patron. I've reviewed restaurants professionally.

TkxM1owXErKLotliTJcFCA.text: I love their tacos and they never disappoint! All of their tacos are amazing but the jack fruit taco is great! I'm not a vegetarian or vegan but the meatless proteins are awesome! I'd go with the beef if you like meat or go with the jackfruit or tofu if you like meatless.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Built my own so ones need and the other is tofu
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chips and traditional guacamole

ayV1oB-hr0bXvoabgvQpkg.text: Checked this place out while in town for a work training based on a recommendation of a friend from Pittsburgh. I sat at the bar for lunch. There are so many different choices it was a little overwhelming. I ended up ordering a make your own taco with a really flavorful tofu and I don't even remember everything I ordered, but it was tasty. I got the shell that has the soft shell with the hard shell. I also shared some chips and queso with a friend.  I really like the crunchiness of the chips. One taco and some chips was more than enough to fill me up for lunch. Nice bartender/server, fun atmosphere. Not super quick service, but not super slow either. I enjoyed it.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Taco
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bar

EdPYXPUCmXt__f0DvDxlkA.text: So many choices that it can be overwhelming BUT don't let that get to you. The tacos here are great tasting and the size is good too. You can literally pick whatever you want. Or if that's too tough for you, choose one of their features on the menu. Great cocktails. Fun decor but it is pretty noisy in here.

Vy2GXxTfuwknBOBTHUpN9w.text: Downtown location is my #1 spot in Pittsburgh for happy hour from 5-7! Amazing tacos and their queso is one of the best. Lots of great flavors for their margaritas and the wait isn't too bad for happy hour ever since they started doing happy hour anywhere you sit

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Main bar area

vHOVWMdCDW3JSCOdSAtilw.text: Yes alcohol and tacos. Do you needs thing else? Good efficient service. You build your own tacos.

z8I1YBpzRk6BkwwN7nVVSw.text: Pretty cool place and a great concept to fill out the ordering sheets instead of explaining everything you want. I didn't do any make your own tacos, and really enjoyed the tacos that were on the menu. If you're really hungry I'd say probably 4 at most, but realistically probably more like 3 is good enough. The margs were good too, got a blood orange marg and really enjoyed it.   We were a group of 18 people that came on a Friday night and they actually were able to seat us within like 20 or so minutes which is pretty incredible. It gets loud in there at night so probably good for a fun social night

IIwbUeMXEl65v6xclaNrDQ.text: This is a pretty cool place though it's always super busy. Especially right after work. I still need to check out the new Lawrenceville location.   Anyway there's clearly a reason this location is so crowded. Because they do it right.  It's a cool place to meet up with friends or coworkers for lunch, happy hour or dinner.  What could be better than build-your-own tacos and drinks?

FYmSW8WuEP0yZlkaHaTnAw.text: What Stack'd does for burgers, Condado does for Tacos, and it's fantastic! Absolutely love what they did with this location; despite its prime corner location, bars in this space have traditionally struggled a bit, so I'm very happy to see this cool space move in.  Space: It's really cool inside with fantastic decorations and cramping people together bring vibrancy rather than the feeling of crowding. It's super energetic and you are infected by other happy customers munching on their tacos. Be wary to get there early during lunch though, as it gets busy FAST.  Snacks: Food concept is great. You build-your-own taco and pile it together. The meat is juicy and the bowl sizes are generous. I love that they have a variety of sauces. The chips are made in-house and the salsa is delicious.   Sips: A bunch of taps, mostly local beers, and a good variety at that. I am pleased to see more than just IPAs so super good :)  Service: It's fairly fast for a local scratch location, but it's a bit slow if you are considering that they are only making tacos. Keep in mind, yes, really busy around lunchtime. Servers are friendly and very good about clearing your tables quickly to make up for the small tables and amount of space you have. Kudos to you.  Been there twice already this month, will be back soon

xiVFefE4djyUc8TeQ90w9w.text: I have frequented Condado for the past year or so and I can definitely say they have amazing tacos. The margs are good--the house marg and the blackberry marg are my personal favorites. Service is usually pretty quick. Happy hours on Thursday and Friday can get pretty busy, so you may have to wait 15-20 minutes or so on those evenings. The consistency of the margaritas used to be iffy, as in the first marg would be normal or strong and then the second would be weaker. This hasn't happened in a good few months, though. I would highly recommend this place to everyone.

Iq-CPZqz8O3dQk-oDyrRNw.text: I love this place. I usually go in around 11:30 before it gets really crowded and put in a to-go order. The food is so good, especially the queso. And the Sweet Lucy shell. And the roasted chicken. And the prices are fantastic. I'm picky so I love that I can choose what I want on my taco. I was going here for lunch about once a week for a while. I've never eaten there so I can't speak to the service but the food is great.

l9yCGSU5rG9qzIxk0wTjpw.text: I've been to Condado a few times now with friends to catch up and enjoy a nice happy hour. The tacos are about $2/each during happy hour and margs are about $4. (Mon-Fri 5-7) I'm not a huge margarita fan, but I will drink all of the margs at Condado! They're so refreshing and not too sweet usually. They also have seasonal flavors which is always fun.  As far as their tacos go, they're quick and easy tacos that aren't expensive and are MTO, or you can order from their pre-made options. There are SO many choices from gluten-free to vegan friendly. I also know that the chips and dips are gluten-free, so eat up! Last time I stopped here, my friend and I actually just ate their endless chips with a dip flight and it was enough! I HIGHLY recommend their queso blanco - YUM!  I'm sure it's been mentioned and tipped a million times, but downstairs Condado is not a big area. Happy hour specials are only available downstairs, not in their upstairs area (which I've never actually been to). Expect it to be crowded on game nights and during the week during happy hour. I haven't had trouble sitting the few times I've stopped here, but it does get cramped. In the summer they do have outdoor seating.  Overall, it's an easy place to go to enjoy an affordable happy hour with friends in a pretty cool environment. The staff isn't super attentive, but they're usually super nice and also, how much could you really need other than margs and tacos?! It's not really a deal breaker. Pro tip - get a margs flight and a few tacos so you don't need your server until you're finished! :)  P.S. I'm super bummed that cashback on Yelp isn't available here anymore!

bl8ppKXc319wVdKQgNoWTw.text: I went to the location on 9th around 7pm and the place was so loud it was too loud.  We ordered 3 different tacos but they all had just too many ingredients and they were just piles of jalapenos no real way to even taste anything just a burnt mouth and soggy experience. One was covered in a red sauce that ruined the taste of all the other ingredients too overpowering.  I think maybe building my own Would have been better but I trusted the custom creations.  I guess big mistake.  In the end we paid almost 50 with tip for some street tacos that were so hot they were inedible.  One was basically a Taco Bell crunch wrap supreme.  I felt suckered leaving the place but this is how these places are with super high rent and trendy locations.  I'd imagine this building will be 10 different things in the next few years.   On a positive note the guacamole was good.  Little watery and spicy but it was tasty.  That's probably the only positive I could give this place.

q1LULXlnbgd5kVp9G3FoHg.text: Full disclosure - I had been drinking when I came here for a late night snack.  This place was pretty amazing.  We needed a quick tour of the menu and we were off deciding on our tacos.  My friend had a few off the menu whereas I opted to build my own.  I loved that I could customize even the basic of ingredients (like orange cheddar) into a creation of mine, and they all tasted great.  Friendly staff with a couple of drinks I didn't need at the end of the night.  I'm a fan, and would come back on another visit.

0AUmy28os-2xFG_VNSXcew.text: Never was able to try the food. Played musical chairs because staff couldn't figure out where to seat a party of two despite lots of free tables. Eventually sat is at a tiny table basically at the entrance. We eventually just left. Unnecessarily complicated.

jn4FQfcSGYe9qK18_9Au-Q.text: I've always been a big fan of Condado and I've visited this one a handful of times while visiting Pittsburg. I prefer the locations that are in Ohio, but this one is great as well. They are organized when working with high volumes and I like that they have an automated text system for when it's time for you to get your table. My food this past time was pretty sloppy and seemed a little thrown together due to how insanely crowded it was during Anthrocon, but the taste made up for it. I love the amount of vegan and vegetarian options and it's great how customizable the food is, making it a great place to bring nearly anyone regardless of their diet!

eWXhfNP3-p0RJSSg63_Knw.text: BOMB, BOMB, BOMB!!!!! The only thing I'm mad about is the fact that I'm just now finding out about this place. Where have I been??? I can't even explain how good everything was. You just need to give it a try, you won't be disappointed. And don't you dare leave without ordering the chips!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tacos

wl6G_bnP76ARfIO8stX19A.text: Closed 20 minutes early, even for drinks. Employee came to the door to shush us away. Not cool. Next time I'm in town I'll go elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

aA9eBp1LGrXNTWeaKPqYrQ.text: I was in Pittsburgh for a few days for a conference and decided to give this place a try one of the nights. My friends and I ended up coming here twice during our visit because we liked it so much!   The drinks are reasonably priced, and the food is good as well! The decorations on the walls and the colorful bar was also pleasing aesthetically. It was very conveniently located, right across the street from the Westin convention center. The service was nice and prompt.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

RM15nNtwJ8e_MwbqE1fhiA.text: This is definitely my favorite Mexican restaurant in downtown Pittsburgh!! So many options and so much flexibility to order what you want.. and you can't beat the prices! Plus the staff is incredible,  Michael Schmidt and the manager Audrey were so personable the entire time. Highly recommend!!!

PBy2cui_asbLZAlqXsiATg.text: I've been wanting to try this place for a year but never had the chance to. Every time I tried to go, plans always changed. However, last night was my birthday and was determinedly make my first visit.   When we arrived, the hostess asked if we wanted a table or to sit at the bar, which we like to do. She informed us that there was another bar upstairs. When we went upstairs, the bartender informed us the upstairs bar would be closing soon. I looked around, saw full tables and an almost full bar and said to my girlfriend, "why would you say that to customers". Regardless we went back downstairs and decided to wait for a table.   We overheard the hostess tell the group in front of us that their food supply delivery truck was in an accident and they were out of a lot of key ingredients. I asked the hostess to confirm what I had overheard, but decided to be seated since we were already there. I figured we could a least have a drink and discuss plan b.   Once seated, the server (wish I saved receipt so I could use her name) quickly approached us and asked what we would like to drink. I had my heart set on a Kahlo, but she informed me they were out of mint. At this point I ordered a go to Beer and then asked if they had the stuff to make the Tuscan guacamole, which was another item I had planned on ordering when previewing their menu the prior day. She informed me they were missing the top cheese for the item but could do the pineapple guacamole. We order that and I discussed with my girlfriend having the guacamole, finishing our drinks and going somewhere else because I didn't want my first time there to be marred with something out of their control.   The guacamole came out almost instantly and it was very good. I asked the server what ingredients they were out of and she "x'd" and marked things on both the build your own and regular menus. She knew exactly what was what and was able to answer all my questions. I looked at it and discussed with my girlfriend that we can make this work, let's just stay here.   We both built our own tacos they way we would've wanted them and put our order in when our server refilled out 1/2 empty tortilla chip basket without us even asking ++++.   The tacos came out fast, almost to fast, that I'd advise anyone to wait until the moment you are actually ready to eat before ordering. Haha  The room was a little tight but our food and drinks (we had a couple specialty margaritas as well) were great. However our server was phenomenal! She made what could've been an unpleasant experience for a late night birthday dinner (when other restaurants were closing limiting plan b options) one that I am taking the time to write about this morning.   In this day of saturated dining options, Condado Tacos stands among some of the top in the taco/Mexican restaurant explosion in Pittsburgh. I will definitely be returning.

1G92RfLP-oMX-rcpWvNXiQ.text: Some of The best Tacos I have ever eaten very good food if you get to chance to eat here don't pass it up.

ckwrN3ScxCxVjakDNT32dw.text: From the moment you walk in to Condado, you can tell you're going to have a great experience. The art is edgy, the music always on point, the wait is short and the staff friendly and helpful--even though the place always seems to be packed, and the food and drinks are all spectacular.   As a vegetarian, it can sometimes be difficult to find good variety at restaurants, but I've been here a couple of times, haven't ordered the same thing twice, and have loved everything I tried. The queso and guacamole both rank easily among the best I've had, the tofu and jackfruit are well-seasoned and perfectly cooked, and the margaritas and horchata are killer.  Build some tacos, drink some margs, be a happy camper. Lather, rinse, repeat.

YZEX5ZQFSB6oNFmHFn2C6A.text: I just tried this place the other day and will DEFINITELY be going back. The art decor is funky and very dia de los muertos. We sat at the bar and the bartenders were great. Very prompt and a great sense of humor. The music was being played off someone's playlist - which normally could be a nightmare but made it really fun to vibe to.   Now the reason for the 4 stars instead of 5....the menus. I won't beat a dead horse based on the other reviews but yes, there are about 10 different menus and it was confusing as hell. I had to proactively ask what I needed to do to order properly as it wasn't really explained to us. Definitely overwhelming for anyone who has a hard time making choices.  That being said, the food was some of the best I've ever had. We got regular queso which had just enough spice/flavoring to it. The chips are freshly baked every day and were delicious. I ordered a hard shell corn taco with pulled brisket and a goody-goody soft shell with chicken. Both were AMAZING. The brisket was almost sweet, something that perfectly complimented the saltiness of the meat. The goody-goody came with 'crunch'....i dont know what the 'crunch' was made out of (neither did the waiter) but it gave a perfect amount of spice and texture to the taco. The chicken was incredibly moist and yummy. The side of black beans were the most flavorful plain black beans I've ever had. I don't even know how that happens.  The best part was the tacos were full size (not that tapas $5 for a scrap of meat crap) and at $3-6, you can't beat the price for the quality of food.  All-in-all, don't be scared to try this place bc of the menus. Explore, try new things, ask questions. It's far too delicious and inexpensive not to!

COvv3T5y2G8VEIv4iL1OQQ.text: Helpful staff, amazing apps, and the tacos are so good!! So many options you get lost in it!  Happy hour prices are good but the downstairs seating area is louder than a Pens playoff game!!  Doesn't stop me from coming back all the time though!

Dvci2qqBxdps39HjPruYyQ.text: The first time I was at Condado I went for happy hour, but I went upstairs and apparently happy hour was only valid downstairs. No one told me this so I ended up paying full price for my margs. Regardless, the margaritas are amazing - get the blood orange!! And the tacos are to die for. If you read this review before you go for happy hour, don't forget to go to the downstairs bar for it!!!!

J76OEbmNJAIOFL_C5xEGkA.text: One of the best Happy Hour Spots! Delicious margaritas, and the best queso/gauc! Definitely a great lunch and dinner spot as well :)

dcJcLABXaGeisSCLw5VgIg.text: Honestly not going to lie at all I've always been a big sucker for tacos and I was unsure how I was going to like this because I am a very picky eater. Plus I have my normal places I like to go. But one day while I worked in the strip district I decided to go for lunch with a coworker.   Let me tell you I LOVE THESE TACOS. I was not sure at first because the staff was very excited and I was trying to get my order in and everything so I could make it back in time. But best tacos hands down I've had in months. Condado is going to be on the top of my list from now on for a to go taco place while in the burgh.   I've heard so many raves about the margaritas and let me tell you I'm going to get my hands on one of those very soon!

WD0HRo15Q-oCseawXEg4fA.text: Stopped on a whim for lazy Saturday lunch and so glad we did. Margaritas were awesome!   We did the El Tres Amigos.. picked three "dips" for the chips. Pineapple Chipotle Guacamole, Queso and Corn Salsa. All were amazing.   They had some cool tacos or you could make your own, which was our choice.   Beef Brisket taco... great. Pulled Pork... amazing.   Picked type of shell, toppings. It was fantastic. Service was on point. Everyone was friendly And helpful for first timers. The food came hot and fast and just amazed at how good it was.   I would recommend a visit for sure.

TMCZ3ZBwziHInFaXHbAwHg.text: Great margaritas and tasty tacos. Love love love that they have jackfruit on the menu, and they do it very well. Happy hour prices are great if you can get a table downstairs, does feel a bit lousy that they don't do happy hour upstairs. The one time we sat upstairs we not only didn't get happy hour pricing, but the service was also extra slow.

iGEtDM5wmj4MlesmsduMLA.text: So fun eating here! Great waiters and great drink selection.  I've had a lot of authentic southwest tacos and these are right up there in quality!

A4lNGqC7v6dJfzBCqocJNg.text: Heard such good things about this place I couldn't wait to try it! Go in and wait to be served...and waited..and waited. Finally grabbed my stuff and got up and left! Service sucks!

WSLOt0nKeA7lUMntdmRNQQ.text: Yes, yes more please.  Excellent tacos and drinks.  Ordered chicken tacos with the ju-ju tortillas.  Hard & soft with cheese and chorizo between the layers.  Whoever thought of this idea is a mad genius.  The only negative is that they didn't have the juice for the prinkly pear margarita but not a big deal.

n5P91daR4WP4l6YCQTq88Q.text: Food and margaritas are always delicious! Serve can be spotty, but usually pretty good.

kKNHQm4ur-0eBMNJHJPk9g.text: Great stop of a quick bite to eat, there's a vibrant bustling atmosphere there at lunchtime.

ERgsoiFeo0S_O6Udf_iyrA.text: Very good! We had chipsand sala, 4 build your own tacos, tofu bowl, and hubby had 2 beers. Food was good and the bill was just $21.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Happy hour with my baby, and my baby (cause I&#39;m pregnant).

Q99g6Zlmy-9nIip3uJGZxg.text: Good food and a load party like atmosphere... feels like Cinco d' Mayo every day!  The Tacos are bigger and more filling than you think... 2 will do!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

COFPn_XCaWzptjB0VfELFA.text: Service is very fast during lunch as it hasn't been very crowded the couple of times I've gone for lunch.   I am seeing some negative reviews from Cinco de Mayo recently - yes, that was a train wreck. People were not relinquishing their tables for hours after paying (note to the public, even on a normal day, if a restaurant is packed and people are waiting and you paid your bill thirty minutes ago - leave. Seriously. The problematic Cinco de Mayo was largely because of inconsiderate guests in my opinion). Granted, when we finally sat down, the waiter was rather rude when I said we had more people but I suggested that when the people who finished next to us left (ie one of the aforementioned parties who paid their bill and did not leave) then they would come and sit there, but he then told them to take their time to spite me. After that his crass and vulgar service was more for comedic effect but it initially was not appreciated. I imagine it was the busy day that had everyone on edge.  Otherwise, the tacos are great. Good size, and I love their combo of soft and hard, held together with cheese. Yum. You can build your own or go for premade combos. I would recommend trying out the jackfruit as as meat substitute - very similar to pulled pork in texture but with a sweet tanginess that adds dimension to the taco.    A large variety of margarita flavors is fun for happy hour. I like the prickly pear flavor best.

C8KqH3DNfFogvUgZVQbj6Q.text: This is my favorite taco place in the the city. I would the highly recommend getting the sweet lucy taco shell with a pulled pork or ghost pepper steak meat. The taco are quite hefty! So even when I come on an empty stomach I can really only eat three. Also the dirty queso as an appitizer is a must order.

QsW9shB4657F26ie8wL1dw.text: The tacos were ah-maz-ing.   Went here on a date and it was honestly a good choice. I ordered one of the signature tacos, Bubba Kush (a bit more fruity than I was expecting, and a customized taco. The Bubba Kush came with two taco shells -- one hard shell and one soft shell, and it is a miracle in every bite.   We also got chips with the Guac of the Month -- Caramelized Apple Guac, which was no mistake it all. We were both very impressed by the sweet and savory taste. The combination of the caramalized apples and guac were unexpectedly compatible. They also provide unlimited chips with your choice of dip (who can resist that!!!).

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Custom taco (left), Bubba Kush (right)

q0OO2Eoy4XfwSsJbqfWkdQ.text: I've frequented Condado Tacos many times, and everything about that place is excellent. The atmosphere is great, waitstaff is friendly, and the food is amazing. For appetizers, I've tried the salsa verde, salsa rojo, and guacamole (not pictured). All three are very good, but one of the best things at Condado is their chips. The tacos are gourmet and food truck esque as they are nearly wrapped in foil. I know I'll never be disappointed when I go there!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

t1e5Y1AMfvtHFGr-5lyhdg.text: All around, such a unique place! The tacos are intriguing, the art is... weird. But it's cool, at the same time. Basically how it works is you pick and choose your toppings and it's great! Tofu? Yes. Jackfruit? Uh, yes. Chicken, onions, salsa... There is so much variety which makes it really fun and REALLY tasty.  For two tacos and all that I put in it I expected it to be a little more filled, but that's okay! I was still satisfied with this for lunch, and it's really reasonably priced. This is a cool chain that I'd never heard of, but it'd totally have it again!

S_lxunXyo16esPuzJ3eiTg.text: Been here once and probably won't ever come back. I am not sure if it was an off night but the food was mediocre. Cold tacos, which weren't very flavorful. When I left, I told myself that Taco Bell would've been a better choice. If you are craving tacos I would recommend Bakersfield, which is only a block away.  Keep in mind, I've only been here once so it could've been just an off night. I was surprised because I've heard good things about this place.

F7VjI93NCzv7WuNkoNAVnw.text: I really enjoyed the atmosphere of this restaurant. The murals were UNREAL and really well done. Also the drinks came fast and the food menu has so many options! Our server Mike O was really cool and helpful with guiding us around the menu. He has a cool david bowie tattoo as well which made me happy! I'm def planning on stopping back in soon. I recommend any firecracker taco.

SaJmSrT6-Nvw_SRPz4Mumg.text: Spicy!!! They need a spice warning for some of these tacos!  Anyway, I was a bit disappointed by my experience here. It was extremely crowded and very loud. You are either going to be crammed in downstairs, or crammed in upstairs. They don't really have menus, you use two different sheets of paper to order by checking what you want in pencil. The first sheet has "suggested" tacos and the other sheet is a "create your own". I decided to get two suggested tacos. You put your name at the top when you are done filling out your sheet.  At the table they give you plastic sporks and a roll of paper towels. So messy. The cafeteria style sporks just don't work and feel really cheap to me. Can't invest in some real forks? When it was time to deliver the tacos, the waiter would announce the name and you claim your tacos from the tray. When our table got the tacos, we were all confused about who actually had the right tacos. Mine ended up having meat in it, but nobody at the table ordered meat. Apparently I did by accident. There was a spanish word in the description that I did not understand that apparently meant meat. It was a %#*^ show.   The waiter returned with two new tacos, the Dutch Dragon and George's Dirty Taco. I took one bite of the dutch dragon, and my mouth turned to complete fire. It had guac, portobellos, corn, tomatoes, salsa and of course pickled jalapenos. Again, probably my fault, but they really need a spicy warning. I scarfed down the dirty taco, which seemed spicy too, but maybe it was because my mouth was burning. That one had rice, beans, cheese, onions and "dirty sauce". I literally don't know what that means but it was a decent taco.   So, if you want absolute chaos and a night ending with sticky fingers and a burning mouth, come on down!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sporks don&#39;t work!! Sorry
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tacos
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chips n guac

Zq9MN0lyxk1jC3tVqb0LiA.text: Taco lovers rejoice. We came here on a recommendation and it far exceeded our expectations. The drinks were great as was the food. I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Build your own tacos
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Elote queso dip
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Jalapeño margarita

ZG9ztXBihM9r3QIZ4_teZg.text: Delivered on the promise of tasty tacos. Great service and the Bubba Kush taco was fab.

zC4Av7Z6IKDlsqBeDyk5Fw.text: First of all....YUM. If you're looking for good eats & drinks, I definitely recommend Condado! My girlfriends and I met here on a Monday during happy hour (5-7 PM). We first started off with the El Tres Amigos - which was a sampler of their dips. We ordered the salsa roja, Diablo queso, and the traditional guacamole. Since the salsa roja is like their "house salsa", our waitress asked us to choose one more to try & so we got the ghost pepper roja salsa! All 4 were so delicious. Although a couple were described as spicy, they weren't overwhelming to me. I chose to build my own tacos and ordered two. It was the perfect amount! They did have a list of tacos that were already made but I chose to make my own. Since we were there for happy hour, I decided to have a couple mango margaritas. It was very sweet & delicious! I can't wait to go back and try other combos of tacos!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. I definitely recommend trying different tortillas. I loved the Sweet Lucy!
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

sKsWJpqEkmCYqZuQ1Lkrcg.text: The prices here are insanely good! Especially during happy hour (mon-fri 5-7)!  Came here for the first time yesterday! Tacos were $1 off and all drinks were half price. Being a vegetarian, I decided to build my own tacos. I picked out the portobellos and the BBQ jackfruit. Both were super delicious! And $4 for both!   We also shared two different types of guacamole: traditional and pineapple. Both were very good! And $6 each so very economical.   For drinks we all had two margaritas! I tried the peach and mango. Both were delicious! I liked the peach a little more.   For the whole bill, it was $17! That's crazy! Definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dutch Dragon: two taco shells with guacamole in between, portobellos, salsa verde, corn salsa, pickled jalapeños, jicama and tomatoes.
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Create your own tacos - happy hour 5-7 $1 off tacos and $3 margs!

Y_1_8kF4dhPK_8a23_rmPQ.text: I am a huge fan of it after my first time. My wife has been there about 10 times. The tacos are awesome ( el Santo and surf n turf are both awesome for not spicy and spicy fans respectively). We had an awesome server named Kristina. She was on point and according to my wife, the best service she got there. I would be pleased with that anywhere. I was a little miffed when I went to tip her and the POS system didn't give me a 25% option. It went 15%, 20%, and 18%. Who would be so cheap to tip 18% at a street taco joint? I want to see 25% on the POS at the table for the next time I see Kristina as the server for me and my wife. Also for all the times after. We are coming back.

8tflSkixtFYhurPtZNyq2w.text: They were pleasantly surprised to find this trendy little taco joint. Create your own gourmet tacos or order some of the suggestions from the menu. Outstanding! A bit on the spicy side but didn't have to be. I was just a rookie. It's a crowded space with small tables that are close together but had friendly staff and a cozy feel. We will definitely go again and now we know what to order!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Taco &#34;bowls&#34;
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

gaNS_s3ifEcDjMBVC9Trhw.text: Love their tacos. All are reasonably priced, delicious, and you can get very full with only three tacos. But make sure you save some room for their guacamole! They usually have monthly flavors for tacos, guacamole, and margaritas as well, so be on the lookout!

2xkt6M5R50-YPhoclD6ktg.text: Condado might be my favorite place to eat in Pittsburgh. The tacos are always delicious and there are so many options to choose from. I have to say that Dave's Dirty taco is my favorite though, so much cheesy goodness The margaritas also cannot be beat, especially if you get a pitcher! Definitely worth every penny.

egy9FPa4meK3cvCeNldwMg.text: I'm always a fan of the 'build-your-own' food places. They give you a checklist and you check off all the items you want on your tacos which makes ordering so much less stressful! I can guarantee my food is coming out as I want and there's no panic ordering!  My friends and I visit this place fairly often for lunch and they're pretty good at getting us in and out during our allotted lunch hour.  The happy hour is good too! Lots of interesting drinks at a decent enough price.

5fbDR_7kLJbWVHF30GWWVA.text: Love this place so SO much! Best taco joint in town. I'm also a firm believer that the pineapple guacamole is the best in the world. Both locations are fantastic, highly recommend.

eJTaoQbaIvk8g3_Y0uw05g.text: Loveeee Condados. I was apprehensive at first but my coworkers from across the street go there all the time and love it! Great drinks and the veg options are very appreciated!!! Definitely recommend.

opFMv0-_Nmh0x1XChbdKdg.text: This may be my new favorite taco spot! I tried the "Surf 'n Turf", "El Santo" and the "Chronic Tortillas Fritos". I really loved the "sweet Lucy shell" which is essentially a hard taco shell wrapped in a soft shell. The steak nachos were also amazing and could basically be a meal if you're not insanely hungry. Everything was cooked very well and the combination of flavors on my tacos was incredibly unique and unlike I've had anywhere else. I had a Peach Margarita and (like the food) it was delicious.   The decor is also very cool and Condado is in an accessible location downtown. I will definitely be returning

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ftZQPXa24lajdkz0ulgAAQ.text: Just made it here for the first time and was very impressed.  The decor inside is fitting with their theme, but the overall modern layout of Tonic is still there which I like.  The service was great and our server took a lot of time to explain all of the options and some of his favorites with us.  We had the queso blanco and salsa verde to start.  The queso might be the best I have ever had.  It was a perfect level of thickness and had a great cheesy taste.  The salsa was also very good.  It wasn't runny like many salsas can be.  The chips they use are house made and you can definitely notice a difference.  I had two soft shell flour tacos as my meal.  My first was the house made chorizo with cheddar and Mexican chimichurri.  The flavor of the chimichurri was great and went perfect with the chorizo.  My second taco was the chicken with chipotle crema.  The chipotle sauce had a perfect amount of spice to it.    Overall I couldn't have been happier with the food here.  You can tell everything is fresh and house made which really makes a difference.  Can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chorizo and chicken taco
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chips with salsa verde and queso blanco

qWqAdm87GWy77CGAIZKVBQ.text: We were here for a pre-wedding dinner/gathering. We had a choice of four tacos. We had the veggie, chicken and pulled pork choices. All were good. Service was slow but there were quite a few people attending. They did finally bring out some salsa and chips. Both were very good.

L0RFCiM0OwlhhaFkYQgtgg.text: Holy Tacos, Amigos!  I, like a few other hundred thousand, consider myself to be a taco connoisseur. I was skeptical at first, to be honest. But, now listen y'all, they're legit!  I built 3 tacos to my liking to start; each different.   They. Were. Delicious!  I wanted more, but was full and content and didn't want to need help getting back to the hotel.   The liquor and beer selection is very nice for a taco restaurant.   Very impressed and will be back. Prolly in a couple hours.

-V4xs9FQsw8O0dkxaWiRbg.text: Great taco place in downtown Pittsburgh area. We were a party of 8 with no reservations on a busy Saturday night, and I think we ended up waiting 20-30 mins to be seated.   Our whole group was vegetarians, so it was awesome to have a place where you can fully customize all the tacos. That can also be a potential downfall because there are so many choices! Lol it took us a while to fill out all the little forms, and we had to make several adjustments, but our server was great and had everything down. My only complaint is that it took a long time for our tacos to come out (~40 mins).   We started with some dips at $7 each: 2 guacamole and 2 queso with black beans - both were delicious! I ordered 3 tacos for myself (avg of $3.50 each) and ended up not eating one full taco as the size is pretty big. My favorite was the Mantis, which was sweet/savory/spicy! They also have a nacho option as a main, which was a hit with my parents.   Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ncdHn3485-aomqSeUdAzPw.text: I came here for the first time on a weekday night and really enjoyed the ambiance. The food was delicious as well and surprisingly filling!  We got the pineapple guac - which basically seemed like regular guac with some pineapple on top. It was decent but I would probably get the traditional one next time. As for tacos, I got 2 and they were more than enough. They sure put a lot in there! I got the surf n' turf and wow, it was so good. Now, I am very proud of my spice tolerance but the dirty sauce really packs a punch. For my second taco, I decided to build my own: peezler tortilla (there's stuff in between the two different shells!), their house-made chorizo with the cabbage slaw and the taco sauce. I thoroughly enjoyed both tacos but if I had to pick which one I liked better, I'd go with the surf n' turf. I've always been a shrimp gal.   We also got a few drinks - I got the bubbles + blush, which was not bad but also not great either.  The service was decent. We found that we had to flag down our waiter to get more drinks and for the check.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

8jOI_ICKvG0aowJSVe2V6w.text: I love Condado. The food is always delightful but the service is always hit or miss, hence the reason I deducted a star. The review is more like 3.5 but I rounded up because the food is soo good.  My most recent experience was kind of unfavorable. I decided to bring my two friends who had never been there. Our waitress, Amy, greeted us promptly which was great and asked us if we had ever been there before. I explained that I had but my friends had not. When one of my friends submitted her order (which is on a sheet somewhat like a scantron) the waitress kind of scolded her for filling it out incorrectly. She left the table as if she didn't have the time of day. After I explained how to fill the form out...our waitress collected our forms and sent them to the kitchen. But that's pretty much all we heard from her until she delivered our check.  The food came out super quick and we all agreed our food was great.
