The food runner was super nice. 3 for $10 tacos is appropriate for what you get and the tacos are a dollar off during happy hour.  So yeah. Food on A1, service not so much.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 1 shrimp ceviche taco, 2 black bean and rice tacos.

o7wTuVJii5gMzvlmQXyiTQ.text: Great food, iffy service.  It seems like the servers/hosts here are uninterested in making the customer experience enjoyable, and more interested in just hanging out and having fun with each other which I guess I get.   I love love love the tacos and the orange and brie queso (a special but I've heard it may come back).  The $15 margarita flight is a great deal.   also, if you can pick a location, come to this one. The Lawrenceville location is small, loud and the seating is at long, high tables so it's like you're sitting in a cafeteria.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Margarita flight (blackberry, mango, prickly pear) and queso blanco without jalapeños and paprika.

aoPvqNMi5hPlKmObTz9_vw.text: This place has some of the best margaritas I've had in my life. The margarita flavors taste so fresh. Mango seems to be from fresh mango pulp and so does prickly pear. Even though we got a flight, the bartender muddled the jalapeno and mixed the other flavors in front of us. They weren't premade.   I would definitely recommend a flight over a single margarita, I think you get more bang for your buck through a flight.  We also ordered a build your own taco which was delicious. I would recommend the shrimp ceviche.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp ceviche taco
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Margarita flight (prickly pear, mango, jalapeño)

636OdsqGmEuoeBFXXCNP4w.text: Cool hipster vibe of this bar. Slow service but they're pleasant people.  Excellent fresh chips! We got the traditional guac and the dirty queso. I really enjoyed both and wish we had gotten the full order of the queso!  Margarita wise- we did a pitcher of the jalapeno margs. These were just okay. A little sweet for our preference (too much sour mix??) but as the jalapenos say longer for the second set of drinks they did get better.  Seemed like a solid happy hour too with $1 off margs and tacos! If I lived here I would for sure go back.

l4Ym0OLeaa2cdjlPMhAZAg.text: I had high expectations coming to Condado that weren't quite met. My friend and I were seated almost instantly, although the place was pretty crowded around 7 pm on a Tuesday evening. Our waitress was helpful and quickly walked us through the ordering process.   We ordered the queso with corn to start. It was only $7, which I did not think was too pricey. The queso came out very quickly, and the chips were delicious. I ordered the Mantis taco with jackfruit, and I created my own taco on a flour tortilla with the tofu as my protein. I was slightly disappointed by the flavor of the tacos. The sweetness of the tofu did not pair well with any of the toppings in my opinion. The sweet Lucy shell with guac and queso was very good, and I liked the chipotle crema. I was not a fan of the mango habanero sauce. The rest of the toppings were slightly disappointing to me. I was also missing soft corn tortillas, which to me are the best shells for tacos.   I would like to give Condado another chance and will likely be back for happy hour. I have yet to try the margaritas. The prices made the food worth it to me and redeemed Condado a little bit in my eyes. For 2 tacos and some queso split with a friend, my bill totaled under $12. You will definitely get a good bang for your buck here, but if you're looking for a bit more of an upscale dining experience, I would recommend Bakersfield. Condado rivals more closely with Mad Mex in my opinion.   One more thing: Condado uses plastic sporks and lines plastic baskets with thin parchment paper. At an eat-in restaurant like this, I was disappointed to see so much disposable dinnerware. I hope they will soon move toward reusable plates and silverware.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Create Your Own taco with tofu
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Mantis
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Corn Queso

Dxcu9JW3JArX2Ml3ghwERw.text: I would say there are better taco options in the Burgh, but Condado definitely has great happy hour vibes. I wasn't feelin' Condado on my first time, so I thought to give it another chance for their happy hour.  If it is your first time, no worries because the staff is very friendly and will walk you through how to order!  TACOS (~$3.50ea): Varies in prices depending on shell type or protein. This place is by no means authentic, and you could probably go way wrong with building your own taco. There are also pre-set tacos you could choose for those indecisive folks. GUAC: Get guac if you have at least 2 people. It was quite a bit for me and the boyfriend that we took it to go and then I forgot it at the nearby Millies.. HAPPY HOUR (weekdays 5-7PM): is really a great deal. Half off margaritas and dollar off tacos! Probably one of the better deals in the area. However, our margs tasted pretty watery, but being half off ($3.50?), it was aite. Maybe we weren't so lucky that day.  Cool vibes and decent tacos. A solid happy hour spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Guacamole, margaritas, customized tacos

gDz87TIUwFEmTX7LX7yFIA.text: ** Cool interior paintings and solid happy hour deals, but unfortunately the food wasn't anything too special. Definitely not the best taco joint or option in town, but could be a good place for happy hours (5-7 pm).  I probably would choose Bakersfield over Condado in terms of the tacos, but Condado seems like a cool spot to get drinks and appetizers with some buddies after going around downtown. The tacos were $1 off and the drinks were also half off for happy hour, which honestly might be a better deal than Bakersfield (though not 100% sure). My girlfriend and I definitely took advantage of this deal, also ordering an appetizer of guac to go with the complementary chips.  The guac was definitely a very generous portion, and we had plenty left to take home. This could be a nice happy hour option with a group of coworkers or friends, since you could definitely split the large appetizer of guac and just order discounted drinks. The ambiance seemed fairly vibrant, with colorful paintings / decorations on the wall.  Not like anything was really wrong with the tacos or food here, but it just turned out pretty mediocre and didn't taste authentic at all. There are lot of options to choose from in the build your own menu to customize it the way you like, or you can choose preset options. If anything, I might get one or two just to snack on, but wouldn't want to rely on this as a primary dinner option to get full off. Typically, I do say I eat a lot but I probably wouldn't order any more than two tacos here.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Happy hour funsies
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Happy hour drinks
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Interior

yAwPGh88uPXq-RVGc5BKjQ.text: Condado Tacos is one of my favorite places to eat in Pittsburgh and my girlfriend can definitely attest to this as I always suggest Condado whenever we decide to go out. Everything from the environment to the amazing murals on the walls really come together nicely to please any hungry stomach.   Although the place can get very loud at times due to the somewhat cramped seating arrangement, this means that the wait for tables is usually very short. This is the only reason I'm not giving 4 stars. The wait staff and bartenders are always very nice and willing to help out with any request you may have whether its just a recommendation or something more. They are open 11am-2am every day which is good for grabbing a late night snack.   The food is what keeps me coming back though. The ability to make your own taco is always a cool option but it can get a little pricey if you start to get too creative. I personally go with the specialty tacos since they offer a wide variety and they will almost always be cheaper that a build-it-yourself taco. The bubba kush taco is my personal favorite and it packed full of ingredients, two of these will have you feeling bloated. Make sure you wash it down with a margarita as they definitely don't hold back on the tequila and you will always get your moneys worth. A margarita pitcher is a good causal drink for 4 or a tipsy split for 2! If you like whiskey you will feel right at home here as their bar is basically a whiskey bar and they offer around 50 different varieties of whiskey. During happy hour they offer half off margs from 4-7pm (times might vary since I've been there).   If you haven't been to Condado yet, you need to give it a try. I promise you will walk away with a full stomach and new favorite taco place!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Margarita pitcher, the bubba kush taco (right), the el santo taco (left)

QoLm3YqdFI72H_OmDNVm5w.text: We've been to this location a handful of times since the opening. We first discovered Condado in Columbus, OH and were pretty excited when we saw it in Pittsburgh.   Condado is a great taco joint where you can either order off their menu or build your own tacos. We usually chose to build our own! There are multiple shells to pick from, as well as meat, cheeses, veggies, etc.   I usually order a side of rice with my taco (one because we fill up on chips and queso, so I can't eat more than one!), and they used to come in the little 2 oz dressing cups. (You pay $1 for a side of rice) They more than doubled that size when we went on Friday, so that's a plus! The restaurant was really busy when we got there, and we waited about 20 minutes for a table. Once we ordered, our chips and queso, as well as our tacos, came out super fast! I usually order the roasted chicken or chorizo. I love their chorizo because it's really flavorful without being overly spicy.   I only have two complaints about Friday's particular visit (and this doesn't happen every time!) - my taco didn't have all of my selected toppings (I love my pickled onions, and they were left out), and we waited more than 15 minutes for our check. Our server did bring us a full bag of chips to take on the go since we asked for one for our remaining chips, so that's a plus  Still one of my favorite stops if we're downtown!

X-hBiORiawoJty1HTq39pw.text: My gosh this place is unreal.  I figured the tacos would be small street tacos, but not the case.  Chips and queso are a must!    I can't wait to go back.

Ow8vOBoocYEfPkba6WHxRQ.text: Great value. Build you own tacos is a must. Get the chips and salsa app on the cheap.

fBSxaP9nz3CXQXaIuX8fYw.text: I love Condado! It's one of my favorite places to get tacos in the city. While it's not super authentic, their quality and tastes are superb. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because I think their other location nearby in Lawrenceville is a lot better (in regards to set up, speed of service, etc).   This location is in downtown, near the convention center and many other restaurants. While they are open late, that doesn't mean they won't be constantly busy. It's incredibly tightly packed and loud. There are two floors in this location. Unless you're sat on the top floor, you won't be able to hear your group over the music and the guests.   Loudness aside, I think everything is awesome. Their food is fantastic, drinks are strong, and I am obsessed with the chips and blanco queso. I recommend coming in for happy hour because it makes the already cheap food even cheaper, and who doesn't love a good margarita?  Writing this review makes me want to go back!

3SmT1s13fsErJLZe5ooqEQ.text: Good drinks and easy fill-out-a-sheet ordering process. They always seem to be making slight tweaks to their menu and have ample options for vegans and vegetarians. I also appreciate the way that the menu makes simple out of a very long list of options of not just food combinations but also ways to enjoy (bowl, hard shell, soft shell, hard shell and soft shell, etc.).  You want shareables? The guac, queso, and salsas are excellent for the undecided orderer holding up your party.  You want to do something crazy? The menu's radio buttons of choices allow you to do whatever you want, like an every-kind-of-cheese hard-shell taco with jalapenos. Whatever, you do you.  My favorite thing to do at made-to-order gas stations is close my eyes and press buttons, so I try to emulate that behavior as much as possible whenever I go to Condado. The only difference is now I can randomly roll for tacos with a margarita in hand. Upgrade.

6zITo7Bp3HoPY7WH1SmyYQ.text: This is my favorite taco place in Pittsburgh! I know it is a regional chain but you can't beat the price and quality. I love that you create your own tacos exactly how you want them. Chips and salsa are pretty good but the guac is the best! I love getting the chicken tacos here and my husband loves the pulled pork. Great causal atmosphere and they're on the yelp wait app so you can see if they have a line.   There are 2 choices for small event space. I had my bridal shower here and it was awesome.

kfnMG_sBBfVXikTIKiG-PQ.text: I have been wanting to go here for awhile and it did not disappoint. I started with the bubbles and blush cocktail and the peach bourbon guac. Ahhhh soooo good...to both!!!  Our waitress did a great job with explaining the menu. You can create your own or pick one of the chef created ones. I did one of each. I can't remember the name of the one I ordered off the menu but it had portabella mushrooms and was delicious.  I got there around 4:30 on a Monday and stayed until almost 6. It wasn't crowded at all.  I can't wait to go back and have that cocktail again!

lPLZVSh4sfFc0bxn948RKQ.text: Updated Review: I now like it here. I know. After my first terrible review one would have thought I would have stayed away for life. But I am all about giving places another chance.   My friend and I went before happy hour around 4:30. We were seated right away and the waiter was really sweet. He indulged my friend in taste testing a beer without a second glance and also steered us towards a really good chip, queso, and salsa combo. I appreciate the time he took with us, especially since we ordered only chips and two beers. Very good service.   We chose two quesos: the spicy one and the one with corn. I would say the spicy one was for sure a hit. The corn was good, but didn't have enough corn or spice to make it super exciting. I would have preferred the plain corn salsa I think, without the cheese (blasphemous, I know).  We also picked the plain guacamole. I think next time we will up our game and do the spicy. While it had a good flavor, I think we were looking for more of a kick.   I had a great time. I look forward to coming back and maybe eating more of the "real food" options on the menu!

ZHs9rn-lSVV436wr5nqZYw.text: Condado is a great place to come for tacos--the menu is vegetarian and gluten-free friendly and they don't skimp on the toppings of your customizable meal! My go-to is the Sweet Lucy shell with tofu for protein and nearly all of the toppings. Important tip--the chips are free but you have to ask for them!   Also, the place is almost always packed and seating is limited so it's not the best place for large parties. The first floor is also extremely dim lit and loud.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sweet Lucy tacos with tofu
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sweet Lucy tacos with tofu
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chips with guacamole and salsas

cEyZmhtDz9Urm4VUDImj2w.text: Every time I came here I say I can not wait to come back. Fantastically fresh and so good. What more can you ask for?

8xUEFlhEZEixf0XGH6ODRA.text: Just got done with our meal at Condado Tacos. First off, the food and drink at Condado Tacos was phenomenal. We also loved the concept of the order sheet. The bummer is that the hostess was very rude. We were seated close to the hostess stand and she was rude to everyone that walked in. As she is the first person you see, we feel that this gave a negative feeling to the experience. Also, she complained multiple times when we were eating and she complained with another coworker. This needs to be corrected by management as this is makes the restaurant not as pleasant. Aside from that, everything was great with both our servers being nice and attentive.

__lfh0Qy1MOFuE-bHBZqig.text: This place was ok it was to dark. No one at my table could read our menu due to the lack of lighting. The taco were good but they were very small for the price. The waitress seem to forget about us more than once.

3kFajubEVAvEfFV-8dE5Rw.text: The margaritas are always good!  We had the corn salsa con queen and some chips. We were there for the margaritas so we didn't get food. Nice downtown location   Servers were a little rude though. Don't expect overly friendly service.

YNdm1g-H2TbpmBIQGVRtvA.text: First time! This place is really awesome!  A lot of choices to add on your tacos and delicious margaritas. Loved the chorizo and the pineapple salsa. Plus the salsa verde is really good too!  Can't want to go back and try some other salsas and queso.  If you go during happy hour make sure to order the single glasses not the pitcher. Cheaper that way.

C8YtiJGTHM3cl-kh-cuAOQ.text: I ended up getting the worst case of food poisoning from the taco I ordered. Not sure if the food was prepared poorly or if there was some other issue. I was really disappointed because the food actually tasted good, but I definitely won't be returning to this establishment.

sDdOQz3oPox4G-Pyq6VY2A.text: Great tacos and drinks. Prices are decent too. Relaxed and fun atmosphere. One of my favorites.

gDGDzD3BtiCdzI8mpCL4rA.text: I absolutely love Condado and go there quite often, the atmosphere, variety, and awesome drink selection definitely make it a go to for me! Although a few weeks back I went in with two of my younger female friends and they were a little confused by the menu, and the waitress (small blonde girl with glasses and wavy hair) was VISIBLY annoyed. I was the only one who had been there before, so every question asked was met with a very unfriendly and unenthusiastic tone- very unlike my previous experiences but definitely worth mentioning. I believe I've had this girl before and received proper service from her in the past, so I'll just chalk it up to a long day. Still, the food was fantastic and my friends said for that reason they'd return.

xCNIokjdUg6wefJDrK3QgA.text: Fantastic, insanely fresh ingredients, terrific beverage selection, only reason I don't give 5 stars is because they make you build your own taco/burrito/bowl. As a former chef, for me, part of dining out is trying dishes the way the chef intended, with the flavor contrasts, textures, etc. if I wanted to make my own thing I would have stayed at home. I'm sure I'm in the minority in this way of thinking, but based on the commitment to fresh ingredients alone, I would seriously love to try a chef inspired dish there, maybe it exists, and I just didn't see it. Otherwise, this taco place is as DANK as it gets!!! Must try!

qKwec6hGCKqaIGaTwBCPxQ.text: Best happy hour ever. $1 off tacos and $3 delicious margaritas. Create your own tacos! The queso is amazing. I'd suggest ordering 2 tacos as they are pretty large. The carnitas and chorizo are the best. If you don't add any extras, tacos are only $2.50 during happy hour, 5-7 pm. However, you need to try one of the cool shells with toppings inside!

FfsgDxoU9ctCWprPWd76Vw.text: Excellent food and great happy hour specials. Perfect place to stop if you are at the Convention Center and need a quick bite to eat. We had the dip sampler and two great cocktails. Chips were plentiful, thin and freshly made and the salsas were great!

5vbD7pw2x_4ZtCOMKe16rQ.text: Was in Pittsburgh 5 days and ended up eating here 3 times. Hard corn house-made shells were amazing, ingredients exceptional and fresh, build your own selections are vast, and all-in everything is extremely delicious. Excellent cocktail margaritas (on the rocks, as they should be, not blended) with real fruit juices, not bar mix. Ghost pepper steak is exceptional. This place is killer.

ZssWr00Yg1uxv6keURGSWA.text: Did not know what to expect when we walked in for dinner as we happened to walk by one night. The create-your-own tacos were great. A lot of different choices and combinations. Veggie friendly. The tacos we ordered were pretty large and very filling. They tasted great.  Looking forward to returning.

vvKrDD0zn-SHYO9HLmSr1w.text: So on a whim, my coworkers and I went here.  Drinks, food, and specials out of this world....  It's now our Friday spot.  Great service.

NocPsu1fEqL2vMk4beMpog.text: I've been here three times and I'm still not impressed. I've tried different tacos each time, but I still feel like I could make them at home. When I go out to eat, I want to feel like I couldn't make the dish at home. One nice feature Condado has, though, is a build your own taco menu. I like the personalization factor!

pxOYM0bm4sg8SbcY8tlVOA.text: This place has a really cool atmosphere going on. The bar seems like a cool place to hang out after work so I'll definitely be back.  I was waiting for Cinco de Mayo to try this place. It was more than worth the wait!  George's Dirty Taco - 8/10.  Not a huge fan of the top layer of onions but loved the "dirty sauce" so much.   Purple Haze Bowl - 5/10. I could take it or leave it.  Dutch Dragon - 9/10. I learned that portobello mushrooms go well in a taco. I had to google what jicama is (mexican turnip) and believe this is the secret ingredient to this delicious taco.  The Mantis - 10/10. The best taco I've ever had. Jackfruit is a popular meat replacement. Putting it on a taco was genius.  In short, I will be back. The options for tacos in Pittsburgh are growing and we're all better for it.

0wmJg2BKZhFevC8I6CvcEQ.text: One of the new wave of hipster, "upscale" taco joints in downtown Pittsburgh.  Not very impressed.  I've eaten here twice and tried a variety of menu items. Ordering is overly complex, but does allow for extreme customization (although there are $1-$2 surcharges for many of the sections of options, so you could easily end up paying $12 for one taco).  Do not order the Chronic Tortilla Fritos (Ghost Pepper Steak nachos).  $7 and I counted 5 tiny bites of (bland) steak.  Mainly just a mound of cheese and lettuce.  And not spicy at all.  The dish makes me seriously question how much of the place is a marketing gimmick vs genuine restaurant.  I also ordered some rice as a side- $1 extra.  A small condiment sized container of possibly the most bland and clumpy white rice I've ever had (think of some high school cafeteria).  Very overpriced and disappointing.  Pass on that too  The El Santo was the favorite taco I tried and I'd rate it 7.5/10.  It was also the favorite taco of rest of my group.  The Good: -Plenty of seating (unlike Tako which is crammed and rude and almost always pretentiously "booked") -Prices are generally good. $4-$5 for a taco that is twice the size of most places (2 tacos should fill up nearly everyone).  $5 for most beers   The Bad: -Happy hour ONLY available in cramped downstairs while upstairs sits empty -No chefs specials or drink specials (even the flavors of month are nothing more than naming gimmicks as the ingredients and flavors do not appear to be truly altered within the actual food) -A la carte surcharges -Bland sides, especially white rice -Majority of taco options are bland and ordinary (despite the clever, misleading names)  Overall Condado Taco is an average taco place with above average prices.  They appear to have avant-garde flavors and combinations but in reality there is nothing differentiating.  Not overtly friendly but still much more appealing than the pretentious Tako.   Probably the best trade off between price, value, flavor, and friendliness of all the new wave taco spots in downtown Pittsburgh, although unfortunately the bar isn't all that high.

A7jGffR2URSa-yojJjLz3g.text: Bartenders were super friendly and helpful in ordering.  I had a mango margarita, spicy queso, and 2 street tacos.   So good!!!!

VfBhQ0Zj55wjXr5zPPjzBQ.text: Looking for the jammest hipster taco spot in Pittsburgh? Looking for a way to order queso and also order something dirty in the same phrase? This is your spot. Might be a wait for a table, but more than worth it. Dirty queso isn't a sex act, it's a life changing dip.

q2x7ipSE5N1mlcBGUUvGVA.text: Heaven, bliss, nirvana!!! I love their tacos and the decor. My favorite tacos in pgh are at condado. Must get the Double shell with hard/soft and Thai tofu with spicy salsa!!!  Their queso is addicting and drinks are strong!

Tcbu5u3KkiE6Lczb4lYlZA.text: Came in for lunch on a week day. It was very busy during lunch but I was lucky to grab a seat at the bar. Their menu is quite interesting that allow you to chose quantity of the taco you want or build your own. There are not many suggested taco to chose from speak as a first time visiter. There are multiple vegan options as well which is pretty nice compare to a lot of place only offer one or two options for vegetarians. It is a little pricy for a workday lunch. It would definitely cost $10+ for lunch without tax and tips. The portion is bigger than a lot of taco offer in town. I ordered three tacos but full after 1 1/2. The mantis, surf'n turf and el santo were the ones I got. Love them all besides the surf'n turf because it was way too spicy! I wish the bartender would mention the host pepper is really included in the taco and it is very spicy. Had to stop after one bite. But one thing I like a lot about this place is they process things very fast. From the time that I turned in my order till they brought out my tacos, I would say 5-10 minutes? All their staff were very nice as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The mantis, surf&#39;n turf and el santo
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu

ZWn0jPtwCZFdoP0WOCnsGA.text: Vegan/vegetarian options were amazing compared to going to just any ordinary restaurant! I tried both the Thai chili tofu and the BBQ jackfruit, both were really good but I preferred the tofu one. Guac was super yummy but I did find the chips to be a bit too salty imo, also weirdly enough the tacos came out cold, but the flavors were amazing, service was great, and atmosphere was super fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Thai chili tofu, and bbq jackfruit tacos w/guac, Thai chili tofu was realllyyy good! Get it with pineapple salsa

iqDyYE8OkYKNE6uWWBAd4w.text: friendly staff, awesome checklist style menu with tons of choices, and even better tacos. good drink selection too. would absolutely go back next time i am in pittsburgh

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

n5LralFbgXT5VLdfazJAlQ.text: Enjoyed the food and the atmosphere went over lunch with a coworker and we were promptly seated although space was tight. 4/5 stars as I was hoping for more authentic street tacos vs Americanized.m but overall very impresse

GquJw0Yk_GZTWu88Khcvww.text: This place was very good. Our server was very helpful in offering suggestions. Food was fantastic! Our only disappointment was that the pitcher of prickly pear margarita we got was very weak, seemed to have no alcohol at all, and it was filled to the brim with ice. So for a $26 pitcher, we got only 2 margaritas out of it.

kMGFcYsT4HQfqBW11pWX-g.text: The place is a bit small, and you will be bumped quite a bit as people walk by during your meal. The service was good, but the tacos were served like you got them from a food truck (wrapped in aluminum foil). I don't mind that, but compared to other taco places nearby it doesn't really stand out as the better option. I tried it, but will more likely go to one of the other places nearby next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My three tacos jammed into a small basket

lY4ivee8yRNsYJUanABxLw.text: I would want to give this a 3.5 if it was an option.   Cool build your own taco concept.   My first taco was real good. Chorizo in a hard shell. Meat had great flavor and the shell tasted home made.   The next 2 were chicken a soft shell. Chicken was very bland and nothing special about the shell.   Side of rice was a tiny little serving for $1.  It was like the size of a golf ball. The rice was also not that good.  I was hoping for a cilantro lime type of rice. This was just white rice with very light seasoning...was expecting more.   So all in all, food wasn't terrible just not great.   I went during lunch on a Monday so I can't judge the atmosphere. They did a pretty good job remodeling prior restarting that was there but not a lot of people and music was very quiet so can't judge atmosphere or drink selection.   I'll go back for sure one day and give it another try.

lTZZJKOZCiw-mvNpvjQXWw.text: Condado Tacos is a veg-head's oasis in the veggie food dessert of Downtown, Pittsburgh.   It's like the Burgatory of Taco Places - get a notepad and pencil, and start building your own tacos. The amount of options to choose from are INSANE! However - I really love their BBQ jackfruit.   They are also surprisingly fast at serving up your food, no matter how busy it is. I work at the Convention Center, and have gone during the lunch rush for a To Go order, and only had to wait 15 min. I have gone on a dead Saturday, and waited like 5min. This is amazing, if you only get a 30min lunch break.   The staff has always been super nice and helpful, and the decor is also fun and funky to look at. Maybe there is a bit of inspiration from Mad Mex's decor...? Either way - it's always fun to look at colorful skulls and cartoonish characters when eating Mexican.   I need to bring other people here; but since I come for my lunch break, I haven't had the beauty of sharing this place yet. They do have a loyalty program; and they are also involved in Yelp's cashback program. Overall - 5 stars because they win for having MULTIPLE veggie options, their staff is super great, and it's bright and fun inside. Not many other places in Downtown can boast that.

zUxi8P7N0ppNO0W06IVBgQ.text: Margaritas were awesome and tacos were pretty tasty.  Note to self... order 2 next time and if you are still hungry order a 3rd.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

I4C8zM-fgh6ADjqK95yBZg.text: Great fastish food with a fun atmosphere and reasonable prices. Excellent bar with a great selection! Crowded at lunch, and for good reason. The build-your-own tacos are to die for, with the combinations endless. Don't forget to snag a bowl of yummy guacamole and chips.  Muy ricos!

xRVn4meu8GRbM0_4E8Me7A.text: They have a build your own taco menu! There is a long list of options to choose from! Including a variety of tortillas (sweet lucy was tasty with chicken!), sauces, and toppings! The brisket was really good! Great price, about $3-4/taco. Extensive margarita and drink menu. Will definitely be back!

qkJlU8IQNLG37DJp98CRzw.text: I was certain nobody could beat Bakersfield's guacamole, but it's happened. As someone who is searching for the city's best guacamole, I'm comfortable saying I've found it.   The service is hit or miss. The tacos are very good and many build your own combinations. A glass of modelo with a lime makes my world go round. Check this place out and ask to sit upstairs if you think the ground floor is too packed.  ** Updated May 2018  I'm removing two stars due to the service consistently being awful. I no longer frequent Condado like I once did. I'm back at Bakersfield slamming back the PBRs and guacamole. It's disappointing that they cannot seem to get it together at Condado, the food is yum but the rest of the experience is lackluster at best.

aLNkSEnu05Lx2bSFIrIaeQ.text: We hit Condado last night and I believe I have a new "go to" place when people come to visit us in Pittsburgh.   It was starting to get busy when we got there at 5:20. It's perfect for the after-work crowd to have some cocktails and some excellent tacos. Luckily, we were able to be seated upstairs with no problem.  We started our meal with a couple of drinks. For the four of us, a couple of the drinks were hit or miss. For instance, my Modelo-Ritas were perfect, but one of our group had trouble tasting any gin in his Ghost Gin and Tonic.   We then ordered probably one of the best queso I have ever had: Condado's Dirty Queso (chicken, black bean, onion, and dirty sauce) served with really good chips. We then ordered the Chorizo Queso, and while it was good, it was not as good as the Dirty Queso we had just had.  Order made-to-order tacos were perfect. I ordered shrimp ceviche on a flour tortilla with onions, and cilantro and it was excellent. My other two tacos were chicken (with a wonderful smoke to it) on flour tortillas with smoked cheddar and salsa roja.  The service was excellent and the prices fair.  Give this place a try. I do not think you'll be disappointed.

HSXdysEagkej2vLtliR-ag.text: Love the shrimp ceviche tacos here. They make my mouth happy! This was my second time for dinner here and it was as good as I remembered. The tortilla chips were much less greasy this time, probably because it wasn't as busy as the Saturday night I was here last time.  Only downside was the downstairs female bartender. She was completely miserable, acted like it was an inconvenience to take and make our drink order. She never spoke a word to me. Some of the worst service I've ever had.

x2lrc_Rm0M6bbaz-oqc8GQ.text: We love this spot.  Travel to Pgh a few times a year, this is a must have. Decor, vibe, food.......always spot on.

D4lMDh4vt10AKf4SVitw1A.text: Lots of options and tacos were great. Very busy and louder than normal (but in a good/lively way). Food was good (wish I could say the date was as well)! Regardless when asked about how my date went, I continue to reply, the tacos were great!

JJwKMDY5iCHmyfm3rJ8aWQ.text: Don't get me wrong, the tacos are great... IF you can actually get them that is. We decided to park near Condado on Sunday evening so that we could have amazing tacos prior to the game instead of the usual overpriced stadium garbage. We arrived, were seated immediately, and had our orders (4 tacos total) ready to go within a few minutes. Then the wait began... 20 minutes, 30 minutes, 35 minutes, nothing. Finally, after 40 minutes, an employee (not our server, she never returned) came up to our table and let us know that they were out of shrimp ceviche. 40 minutes and our meal hadn't even been started! We ended up telling her to cancel the order as we needed to get to the game. Total bummer and we would certainly hesitate to return.

e9mUnqm0iaDHnGq3YasTyw.text: Love this place! It is my new happy place. Food is amazing. My only complaint is how cramped it can get there, because it is always packed.

hiKA43W9JG5zdb-JgXv5eA.text: Let me start by saying that I am not at all a food snob. And I do not go around giving businesses 1-star reviews. But this place was HORRIBLE. I cannot understand how it can possibly have 4 stars on Yelp. First, their menu is full of Taco Bell versions of Mexican food where there are no classic options, and all tacos are odd inventions like "crunchy corn tortilla inside soft flour tortilla with sour cream in between". Their brisket was painful to eat. It tasted like greasy boiled beef (I.e., tasteless). Their home made chorizo tasted like they emptied a can of seasoning on ground meat. Their guacamole is by no means made from fresh avocados; it tastes like grocery store liquid guac that they "spice up" by adding chopped tomatoes and a lot of jalapenos, because "if you can't make it tasty, make it spicy". Probably the worst food I have had in Pittsburgh in 5 years. We couldn't even finish it.

3MJuaFxSunz770FygnqP9A.text: It was Friday night and every place was crowded. The host said we could be seated within 30 minutes, so we decided to wait. There was no place to wait, so we just walked around outside. We were seated upstairs. We ordered the Mango salsa guac and chips, which was good, but not amazing. They had suggested tacos and build-your-own tacos. They did not have a kids menu :( but they offered to make quesadillas, which my kids weren't big fans of. I had a shrimp ceviche taco and thai chili tofu taco. The shrimp seemed undercooked and the tofu was spicy. The flour tortilla tasted like it came from a grocery store out of a bag. There just weren't any amazing flavors. My husband had a surf and turf and the suggested nachos, they were huge, but he didn't find them amazing either. Our waitress was super nice and our margaritas were on point! I had the blood orange and my husband had the blackberry.

Ai4dHt7WIUps8QopLoqpWw.text: I've been here a few times and have never had a bad experience. Service is quick. Drinks are strong. Tacos are great. Queso is amazing! Lots of options for vegetarians/vegans. The jackfruit tacos are outstanding.

-eC-0OatAEOLGL6jo_M3EA.text: Atmosphere is cool and I liked that they have vegan options and there is outdoor seating but I left here unimpressed with the meal.   On the plus side the tofu was tasty and the perfect amount of crispy but I feel like none of the topping selections really compliment the flavors. Everything else was lack luster.   Unless you are a big yellow Gatorade fan I would skip the house margarita. It looks and tastes just like the sugary sports drink and think was a total waste of money.   All in all if you are in the area and want to eat stop in but don't expect anything special.

1I1IcLnF6uW0VS9ZqJ9OwA.text: Great queso, super oily and salty chips. The tacos are good for a chain, not entirely authentic, but compared to a lot of other restaurants pretty good. Better than Bakersfield any day. Margaritas are weak, but flavor is good. The tacos are a good size and feature good ingredients. Three will fill you up and the options to construct your own is cool, although it's easier to order from the house specialty versions. Bar specials only valid downstairs, that's not cool. I'll go back, when I'm in the area, but wouldn't make a special trip.

1WhV56HP3axqBfFvRGhQcQ.text: I didn't really get why people like this place. The waitress was frazzled and slow. The food was nothing special and the menu was confusing to me.  I don't want to have to think that hard when I want to relax and enjoy lunch or happy hour.  They should have more easy choices. I"ve gone twice and have not been impressed either time. There's another mexican restaurant around the corner from this one that's much better.

n2Es7UGcVIBVANEPrXR64g.text: Went to check this out during their official opening night with a friend of mine. Will definitely be giving it another shot in the hope that they were just working out the kinks in the new location.   To start, the downstairs packed a lot of tables in a small space, so I was constantly having to move my seat in to let the wait staff go by. I can deal with that, but after the 15th time or so, it did get old.   The waitstaff was very nice here, but seemed like maybe they were overwhelmed. There were multiple occasions during the night where we were either brought the wrong item, or it was forgotten completely.   The drinks were good (even though they were out of the muddled Jalapeno margarita I was hoping to try). Although another table and ourselves did notice that the wait staff doesn't ask if you want salt on the rim of the margarita you order, which is a bit odd.   I enjoyed the appetizer trio they offered, as you could choose from a few varieties of salsa, queso, and guac. The chips they gave with it were very good, but about 75% of them were crumbs that were barely big enough to dip. Luckily the wait staff offered to replace the chips a couple times as they noticed it was mostly crumbs also.   Now when it comes to tacos, I think my bar has been set pretty high by places in Pittsburgh like Bakersfield downtown, and Doce Taqueria in southside, so I was a little disappointed with the Tacos here. The tacos weren't bad by any means, but definitely not what I was hoping for.

MtJnRU2v2jcN7g859uyo3g.text: It seems like DIY food is in right now, from burgers to pizza to burritos (as exmplified by Chipotle), so why not tacos? You choose everything from the shell to the meats to the veggies and cheese, so you can be sure to fully enjoy what you get. Or if you're not creative like me, you can just go with some of the suggestions, most of which sound pretty innovative already. They have both corn and flour shells, and various creative combinations of combining them. Lots of interesting vegetarian options for proteins as well, such as jicama and jackfruit, and a large number of different sauces to choose from. I chose to sample four different suggested tacos with a variety of ingredients, and each one was bursting with different flavors from sweet to spicy to savory. They were definitely filled with toppings, since finishing all four was a bit of a struggle. The only thing I would be wary of is that they tend to splurge on the sauces--some of them were dripping as I ate them. I would ask for them to go a bit lighter next time, or try to build my own to control that a bit better.   Their salsas are also worth mentioning--really fresh and a great appetizer to share around the table.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bubba kush, ooey-gooey, surf &#39;n turf, el santo

Fl8pIRofvA3QidUysPH-sw.text: The food at Condado was really delicious. They also had good prices on their drinks but my major complaint is that they were out of a lot of stuff. For every 5 whiskeys or tequilas My group and I tried to order they were out of 4 of them which was a bit frustrating. Also, the next day we went back for lunch and again the food was great but the bartender that helped us was not very friendly. I would recommend going for the food and drink options for sure and hopefully they get a shipment in soon!

b44GdHWQPdCpHXo1XoGlbQ.text: I have been here three times and will keep going back.  Lunch the first week that they opened was crowded and the service was spotty.  We had a party of 5 and 4 of us got exactly what we ordered.  The one who didn't had his lunch comped by the manager so he didn't mind.  Returned for Happy Hour on Cinco de Mayo.  Tough to beat 1/2 price margaritas so it was no surprise that they were packed, especially that day.  They claim to have over 30,000 combinations.  It will take me a while to try them all but I will make an effort.  The queso was very good and so were the chips, but they tend to flake easily so you are left with a basket of crumbles.  Tried the chorizo and the brisket tacos.  Both were good, not great.  If you try something and don't like it, then you have plenty of choices for the next visit.  The menu gives you an idea on the heat of the salsa so you can dial it up as hot as you want it.  Maybe next time I will try the ghost pepper sauce.  Hopefully they will get their service issues worked out shortly.

b-MNm8iCsM7xf2h8094ISA.text: Fun little spot right across the street from our hotel right in the heart of downtown. We ended up hitting up Condado Tacos at around 11:00pm on a Saturday night after the Cubs Pirates game and the place was packed. Drinks were very good. Tacos were good but one of mine had a bit too much sour cream. Its a pretty cool concept for a Mexican/taco joint, almost like ordering off a sushi menu. There are paper menu tickets and pencils at every table and you just mark of the taco you want and how many or you can mark off custom taco by checking individual ingredient boxes, example, type of tortilla, type of meat/protein, type of cheese, types of vegies, etc. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for some good tacos, they have many traditional as well as unique taco offerings.

aHfGPKFD6YxgsjFMSvQAcg.text: Condado is okay, but it's trying really hard to be Tako.   We were there at about 8pm last night and it was super loud and clubby, which okay, that's their vibe, but it was a Wednesday night at 8pm.  It's just a hugely jarring change from Tonic, the establishment in the same location before.  It was also very dark, which made it really hard to read the menus that are printed in teeny tiny font.    My husband and I have three advanced degrees between us and we genuinely couldn't figure out how to order the tacos - it's one of those papers where you check the things you want, but it's really unclear how it works and how you order - go online and look at their menu and you'll see what I mean.  I couldn't even figure out where the nachos were  (under "tortillas," listed as "tortillas fritas" in like 4 point font - not the first place I'd look to find nachos).    The tacos came and they were good.  Not fantastic but solid.  The nachos came and were *so incredibly annoying.*  It was enough nachos to fill a big platter, as nachos are typically served, but they were piled 8 inches high into a tiny little basket.  Picking up just one made a huge mess, and about 10 nachos in, we just gave up because food was going everywhere.    On the positive side, the staff were very friendly and the decor (think many, many skulls) is pretty cool.  More tacos in my mouth is always a good thing, but I think Bakersfield, about 100 feet away, is a more solid choice.

AnsGqWGUie91VXBE5uTAZg.text: Wow -- Condado is the best taco joint downtown. Reasonably priced, fantastic margaritas, and creative selection of tacos. The taco of the month for November is this Thanksgiving Dinner taco that is still making my mouth water after leaving. I highly recommend giving it a try. Great atmosphere as well.

-oZqRQVPHzgXpV_vDFm-gg.text: I had friends in from out of town and thought it was the perfect chance to try Condado.  While driving from the Latrobe airport, i called at 7:15pm and asked for a reservation for 8pm.  I was told on the phone that a reservation wasn't needed and we could easily walk in for a table.  I told them we had 4 people and they assured me it would be no problem to get a seat at 8pm.  So..I get downtown, pay to park my car, we walk three blocks and reach Condado to find it's completely packed.  The hostess told us we had to wait and there were three parties ahead of us - not sure how long the wait was.  There was no room at the bar to stand or any room upstairs.  We awkwardly stood around, often in the way of the wait staff and other patrons standing around waiting for a table. We could see empty tables around and more that were being cleaned so we hoped it wouldn't be long.  8:30pm comes around and we were still waiting.  The empty tables we saw were being filled and more people we waiting.  I went to the hostess station to ask what the deal was and was told that "There's 2 parties in front of you..".  Over the course of 30 minutes the only seated one party?  Not buying that.  My friends and I were hungry so we left.  Before I left I chatted with a guy at the bar who was leaving as well - told me he ordered his food and waited 35 minutes but they lost his order and he never got it.  I hoped after being open for a month they would work out any kinks they might have.  If I would have wandered in at 8pm and had this experience that's one thing - but not taking a reservation and having your patrons waste their time is another.  Why not take a reservation, it's guaranteed business?    I can't comment on the food, but the decor was cool i guess.  I hope other ppl get better customer service than I received.

mVeYvyzDoNbyzkAPuzrvLw.text: Concept is there. Just too complicated. Less is more. Make the specialty tacos the main menu. Don't need to create my own.

kLILAWeBO7iN7tqofwtwqw.text: I love how unique their tacos are, obviously not similar to Mexican street tacos but authentic in their own way! I always leave Condado with a full stomach!

g0-tmIk3KX8Pj6TBSR7kLg.text: This place is awesome! If there's one thing I'll tell you, Go there and ask for Brandon. You won't regret your time, he is speedy with his service and makes the time great and enjoyable. Go here if you're in Pittsburgh! It has the BEST happy hour in the city - go tacos!

FR1m45lzARdODo7j6j7mgQ.text: The tacos are great, the margaritas are better, and Brandon was the best.  Highly recommended

Zg8N-g-q2EXkhEdXiZ5juA.text: Brandon is that dude, tacos we're super good! Loved the atmosphere, especially Brandon's service, unbelievable!

OZuHmbpzeWc4eeojhV_1Hw.text: One word for this place: awesome! Make your own tacos!? What taco lover wouldn't be into that. I love the fact they don't overcharge you for additional toppings. Prices are really fair. Unique customization options such as super spicy sauces, homemade slaw and delicious guacamole. Great vegetarian options, specifically jackfruit you don't see that often. I didn't have a margarita but they looked excellent. One of my favorite aspects of this place is the interior. So much attention to detail it looks like a local artist designed the graffiti walls. I definitely see this place at the top of the Pittsburgh restaurant scene.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

y6ee1D1x3e3rMldeZi_s4Q.text: I went to get a few tacos after the pet expo at the convention center, I sat upstairs for the first time and the server mike that was working up stairs made mine and my families dining experience awesome.  He was super friendly unlike some servers are in the other restaurants we have been in downtown.  This guy is a great employee we will definitely be coming back more often and requesting him as our server for how fun he is to be around and how great of a experience he made it for my family and I..

IrhFXBRP2zJw171NqJ7UWA.text: I'm obsessed with this place.  Their food is delicious, and you have the option to build your own tacos-which is super fun!  The happy hour specials they offer daily can't be beat!  During the summer months, we usually sit outside!

fnzxHbyWF__mPFKmlSFfVw.text: One of my favorite taco places in Pittsburgh. The best thing about Condado is that the tacos are made to order and you can pick every ingredient that goes in! The price is very reasonable and the tacos are larger than most! The only downfall is that you cannot make reservations unless you have a party greater than 12.

N504Ipla-DObL3qU76K_IA.text: I'll freely admit I got lured in by all the skulls and stuff on the walls. Beyond the awesome skater decor, the food turned out to be awesome. Maybe not authentic mexican, but absolutely great. The different quesos are all really good and I ended up having maybe the Best. Nachos. Ever. Highly recommended. I enjoyed the build your own style menu that let's you customize everyone that makes your taco.

IO9jvcsehqqQETqnYzki6w.text: We've come at least a half dozen times since Condado opened and they have really hit their stride.  Alex and Jason are both great to us when we visit and the huge combination of flavors and menu choices will keep us coming back.  They loyalty card doesn't hurt either - straight forward and easy to use.  The steak nacho bowl is great for two to share.

CwCuGZbZ4r1ILkzuvug_OQ.text: I love trying new taco places, but was honestly a little disappointed with this one. Condado has strong margaritas and a pretty decent draft list. I found the concept refreshing, but the execution a little flawed. Condado is a make your own taco joint, but also has a set list of menu tacos. They have several protein options, and  many vegetarian options, which is a plus. However, their set taco menu does not utilize each of the proteins. Meaning, the set menu has few options and it doesn't have one option for each of the proteins. The menu was a little confusing, but I liked that they had so many taco shell options. Additionally, the guacamole was very good. I only gave it three stars because I generally prefer street tacos and traditional tacos to the ones at condado. Worth a visit once, but not more than that.

X1tqY5wuK2ApLsYKUHLedg.text: Hands down, my go-to happy hour spot in downtown.  This is a place that you can go to without breaking the bank.  The tacos can be as inexpensive and basic as you want or you can make them on the fancier side with more higher end toppings.  It is a lively restaurant that is holding its own in a fiercely competetive foodie part of town.

nwhjGgziOlwSt0PeWBmAoA.text: Even though they don't usually take reservations for groups smaller than 12, they made an exception for our dinner group of 6, and we were seated right away on a busy Sunday evening.   For $3 a taco, Condado offers a fantastic bang for your buck. These were some of the best tacos I've had in Pittsburgh! Lots of vegetarian options too - solidly beats Smoke and Bakersfield in this aspect. Highly recommend the double taco - a hard taco wrapped in a soft taco, so you get the crunch without it falling apart in your hands :) the chili tofu and cilantro sauce were great as well. They also serve yummy chips with guac and queso (though I must admit to liking the thicker queso at Bakersfield t).   Condado has a loud, vibrant atmosphere - don't go here for a quiet meal, but you'll fit right in if you want to be a noisy group.

9spQ4BF9dsCDsildJqdlgA.text: Started with queso and black beans dip and it was amazing! We shared a Horchata...a little small for the price but it was good. We made our own tacos and had their premade tacos too...el tradicional, bubba kush, Dutch dragon and surf n turf which were all great! Maybe a little too much cilantro for my liking on a few of them but overall a great spot to have lunch. A definite stop for different taco lovers!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Trying out the surf n turf and Dutch dragon tacos!

9MtVmbtBZrpRabBaVgkGOw.text: An amazing example of casual, quality taco shop with style and character. Open late in downtown which is a rarity, anyone looking to crush some queso needs to be here. Great attentive staff, solid affordable pricing, and wonderful selection of tequila... who could want anything else?

dk1ZvkV1DE2oY94FTlg1qA.text: Condado has fantastic build your own tacos. There are plenty of options, including delicious vegetarian options like marinated portobello and chili tofu. I really enjoy the Sweet Lucy shell which has queso built into it. I recommend ordering the margarita of the month. It's always delicious and creative. The only downside is that this place is packed at all hours. That's because it's so great!

dYPIsA0TlL1XRzLqlbc7LQ.text: I have dined in and gotten takeout from here. Great tacos, staff is very friendly and helpful.

U9xm4nfjgBx_s7of1vblXg.text: I have not been here probably like 10 times and it has yet to disappoint. Great taco combos, especially love the tofu. Tried a lot of good quesos here too. Chips are great quality.

DbDL9PD4zfdr5pDNnfTa8g.text: Food was awesome. You have to get the queso and chips ridiculously good. The decor is pretty neat to. Prices are reasonable and there is no lack of flavor here. I will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Quesooo best I&#39;ve had

CgMTqMGJsBnzs7jGhNLPhA.text: Management sucked. Food was good. But if there is a problem don't complain because they won't help you.

Rgd52s6rZkqyZjFdI_8lLA.text: Fun tacos greatly equipped for vegan and vegetarian options. Build your own! Cheap cheap cheap. Full from $6. Can't beat that. Also.. the wait staff is incredibly attractive!

mJMjisV6iTvouUnKk0AIzQ.text: Their tacos are amazing!! Some of the best I've had. Queso and margaritas were also delicious! Atmosphere is very fun and the wait staff was very pleasant. They also have really good happy hour deals during the week!

RmvWA218CWBEGBtk1VXhWA.text: The tacos are very good!!!  I really like how you can design the taco with the exact toppings you want.  The service was excellent and the staff was very friendly.  My only complaint was there was there is a ghost pepper sauce that can be ordered with the chips.  Eating ghost peppers should be done with EXTREME caution (and should not be attempted by noobs).  I ordered the sauce, but there was NO heat whatsoever!  I thought they brought me the wrong sauce but my waiter indicated it was correct.  My waiter  brought out some sauces that were much hotter.  Over all its great place for tacos and I will be returning.

MnvmPKRNn9iefigWP51Q3Q.text: Went here for a lunch break last week and it was fantastic! I got three different tacos and they were all delicious. The chips and queso options were really really good too. I definitely want to go back soon and try out some of the cocktails to go with the food.

yoFcQYh8NKeaXAxi-bXJGA.text: Best. Tacos. Ever!  Margaritads and tequila collection are  out of this world  you've gotta check this place out. The atmosphere is another thing that makes it. theres graffiti all over the walls and bathrooms and they play awesome indie music all night. So yeah come check out this hip new cool place! / tacos! Very best I've ever had and I've had tacos all over the country!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sweet Lucy shell with pulled pork.
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The bar
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Skeleton smoking.

6MRhTi9r8unb36CUh14Hpg.text: Another downtown taco place but what sets this restaurant apart is its extensive menu that you can personalize as well as an amazing happy hour spot!  Happy hour goes until 7 (our waitress thought it was 6 and we rushed to get our order in but were happy when she told us 7 and another round of drinks for us).  The beer list is extensive with a lot of unique options then there is a ton of cocktails including margaritas. At happy hour the drafts are $1 and the margaritas are 1/2 off.  All of the margaritas are served on the rocks-no frozen which I was a bit disappointed about.  You can add flavor for a $1 including peach, pomegranate, strawberry and blackberry which basically is them adding a pump of flavor to their original margarita. I tried the peach and strawberry and my husband had the blackberry. I recommend the strawberry as the blackberry was super sweet and the peach really didn't taste much different than regular.   You then have a few salsas, guacamole and queso to pick from served with chips which is a great started. We went with their roja salsa and regular guacamole. Unfortunately, they never brought us the salsa but that was ok as the guacamole was such a huge serving we could hardly eat it and I love guc!  The chips are very thick and not too greasy.   The hard part is next which is choosing your tacos. You have so many options from a bowl to flour or corn tortilla with a ton of veggie or meat options, fillings and sauces. I went with the flour soft shells, one with chicken the other with beef.  The shells were a bit hard and I did not like my creamy lime sauce but everything else was tasty. For an extra $1-$2 you can add beans or rice which comes served in a little cup.  Did I mention that the happy hour special is $3 tacos.  Pretty great deal. Our waitress was fantastic and it was packed-we were lucky to get  seated upstairs with a very short wait.

MmeGzdOie-U5-ReAHsUUSQ.text: Was visiting Pittsburgh for a week and I have to say I was in for a pleasant surprise when I sat down at Condado. The tacos were absolutely delicious and the possibilities for combinations are endless. Also; the guac there is absolutely amazing. Would definitely recommend to a friend.

WhbrCUUFH0_5b2skZGVgYg.text: I've only just discovered this place and gone only once BUT it was amazing!!!! The tacos are so good and there are so many options to pick from. I will most definitely be back.

QrSpjfeXKffGek_nPzFaMQ.text: One of my most favorite places to go!! There may be a wait on the weekends but when you order your food it's very fast and always delicious! The staff here is super friendly and upbeat! I truly do recommend that you check this place out! If you love to drink then you will definitely be a happy camper here. They have great IPAs and drink specials here as well during happy hour! They have a downstairs and an upstairs so which ever is your preference you'll still leave this place feeling happy and your belly will be full! They also have a rewards card here as well so make sure that you get one because I assure you that you'll be a returning customer and it will help you to save as you become a frequent diner

Tgp5QcVhqFl6fWraFgiQVQ.text: Love Condado's!! Always have a great experience. The guacamole is fresh and so good and I love how you can custom the tacos how you want it.

QERtgVIHi9xJf65LJCiKuw.text: Great tacos and a cool little place to eat. If you don't mind basically sitting on top of each other for your meals, the food is worth it!

dxtJ7TbB8RluqoemIRrDrQ.text: Atmosphere: 5/5  Service: 5/5 Drinks: 3.5/5 Food: 3/5 Price: $  I had been really excited to try this place because they serve "Nick's Crispy Tacos" style tacos and I love anything tacos. We went on a Tuesday night around 6:30 and were seated upstairs right away at the last available table.   Our server was charismatic and informative and made the ordering process easy. The margaritas were good, but nothing special. I was slightly disappointed by the food. The tacos were okay but did not have the flavor I was looking for in the tortillas, meats, or toppings. I think fresh flour tortillas would make a big difference. The salsas were also only okay, which is crucial for any Mexican restaurant.   I may be back for a happy hour with friends, but I'd likely just spend a few extra bucks and head around the corner to Bakersfield.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Surf and turf &amp; BYO

LQGFhH7mcjj93dF2GoTrkQ.text: Some of the best tacos and margaritas in town. The nachos were delicious and the surf and turf taco was great. I loved the freshness of the ingredients. The muddled jalapeno margarita is definitely worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Muddled jalapeno

QfIaTGANa5ifaqettl24kg.text: We stopped in to Condado Tacos for lunch while waiting for our candles from Candle Lab across the street-- what a good decision that was! Condado has a really funky menu with a lot of awesome options-- both drinks and food. We started with the chips and salsa and the margarita flight. Our waiter was nice enough to let us try both salsas since we couldn't decide and they were BOTH awesome! I loved the margarita flight as they had so many different flavors available and it was a great way to get to try three of them. My personal favorite was the jalapeno flavor. For tacos, they have you make your selections on a slip of paper with both make your own options as well as some tacos they have hand selected. We did one make your own and two of the Condado Tacos (bubba kush and the mantis). All of the tacos were fabulous-- most with their signature stuffed crusts (hard shell with cheese and other wonderful goodies layered between a soft shell). Next time we are in Pittsburg we will certainly be back! Great service and great food!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

MwhN5_MmQdRiTfqjw9vMgw.text: Always delicious!!!!    Highly recommend the guacamole (ask for extra pickled onions!).

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

kBUZ2ZdPn-WzZBGDAxhMiw.text: I was extremely dissatisfied with my meal and service I received while at Condado Tacos. My food was cold, the waiter was rude and impatient, and the whole restaurant was overly crowded where my partner and I felt claustrophobic. I never usually complain about establishments, but when my partner wants to have tacos for their birthday and the experience was less than desirable, then something needs to be done.  I contacted the restaurant after my visit and spoke to the manager. She was very apologetic and sounded very sincere. She offered a refund and told me she'd speak to our waiter to make sure this doesn't happen again. After speaking to her, I am willing to give Condado Tacos another try my next visit to Pittsburgh.

xOC_GXLPcZU4AXUAshu6_A.text: My coworker and I visited Condado Tacos for lunch based on the fact that it was within walking distance of the convention center. It was busy enough, on a Friday at 1:30, that we had to sit at the bar as there were no tables available.   I enjoyed the ambiance at Condado--it was well lit and had a fun,funky atmosphere similar to Voodoo Brewery or Mad Mex.   My coworker and I split the guacamole of the day, which was a peach-bourbon guacamole. This unique combination was good, if a little sweet. A nice aspect of Condado Tacos is that they offer free chip refills of their delicious tortilla chips.  Condado Tacos has a menu format similar to Burgatory, as you can either create your own taco or order one of their recommended tacos. I ordered one of the Surf N Turf tacos and I created two of my own. I wasn't wowed by the food, but the prices were especially good for Downtown Pittsburgh.  One pleasant and unexpected surprise was the delicious beer I ordered, which was a collaboration between Platform Brewing in Cleveland and Condado Tacos. While Condado had a large tequila selection, they also had an impressive display of whiskey behind the bar--everything from bourbon to Scotch to Japanese whiskey. I only drank beer, but I was impressed nonetheless.  All in all, I felt that Condado had a great atmosphere, great prices, and pretty good food.

pIWhlOx2i7qkr8goJsLm3g.text: Best happy hour spot ! Delicious tacos & great deals. Wish they would put nachos on the menu. Try the prickly pear margarita, reminds me to my visit to Sedona !

CNtoFxW6iao663PLkBXh-Q.text: I am always excited to try a new taco joint especially one that is vegetarian friendly. We came on a Friday night and it was crowded. We were seated downstairs and it was very loud. My friends and I could barely hear each other. Also, it was very dimly lit.   I did like the customization aspect of Condado. I could pick everything from the shell, protein, toppings, and sauce. I also liked that they did not have a limit on toppings or sauces. I had a sweet lucy shell, which I highly recommend. It is a soft flour tortilla, queso, and then a hard shell. I had mushrooms, corn salsa, cilantro and onion, and a cilantro lime aioli. They do not skimp on the toppings as my tacos were overflowing. My second taco was a goody goody taco with the bbq jackfruit, jicama slaw, salsa, and chipotle crema. I have never had bbq jackfruit and it was on the sweeter side, so I am glad I had a lot more spicier toppings to cut the sweetness.   Overall, for the food I give four stars. I enjoyed my tacos. My proteins were not warm, so then my overall taco really wasn't that warm. Also, my friend thought that their chicken was very bland and my other friend could not even eat her tofu taco. The floor was also very dirty and our table was sticky, so Condado has some work to improve on. But I will be back for the tacos!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Create your own tacos loaded with toppings!
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Diablo queso
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. BBQ jackfruit and portabella mushroom tacos with heaps of toppings!

Rl2AjJFktknVrFZD6o2anA.text: Every new city I got to I look for a Mexican spot, this is by far one of the best places I have been to in a long time. This isn't your traditional Mexican restaurant, it is Americanized but don't let that take anything away from it. At first sight it seems small but there are two levels, we went on a Monday and got sat upstairs. Our server Matthew was super kind and knowledgeable, he walked us through their menu (you can choose from their preset menu or you can create your own tacos). He also gave us tips about places to go after we had dinner and he steered us in the right direction.  We ordered a marg pitcher it was pretty decent for the price, filled about 6 glasses. We had the trio appetizer: the chorizo queso (banging), the salsa verde (pretty good), and the plain guac which was decent. Some of us ordered from the preset menu but I created my own tacos. The options are mouthwatering and they have choices for vegetarians (don't recall for vegans). You fill out a sanctron kind of menu that details all of the options and possible up-charges, you can choose more than one of the same or mix and match. I ordered two tacos and they were kind of big which was a surprise. We were stuffed so we didn't make it to dessert but we did have another round of drinks.  The combination of service, food, drinks, and decor make this a five star place for me. Seriously if you're in Pittsburgh and are in the mood for tacos, swing by it'll be worth it.

q7VNWKpKXyEWfTcF7fMC8g.text: Amazing atmosphere! The braised beef taco is the best! The queso is extremely good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

7IbBYdf1ic1eIeVcFEAxPg.text: I'm here for work and staying at the Westin. I'm not here very often, but a modern taco joint always seems like a good idea. For people who haven't gone here before, you can make your own taco with many different proteins, sauces, veggies, etc. and they have pre-chosen tacos if you don't feel like making your perfect taco. Anyways, the tacos were delicious and I always love a little kick so get the surf and turf if you like spicy! The margaritas are definitely one of the best I've ever had and I would definitely go back here the next time I'm in town.

Uqk2jIEYEOVrkf6s0wl9Ow.text: Best tacos in Pittsburgh. Seating is tight, but we worth the wait. Create your own tacos, but definitely try some of the pre-mades. Take advantage of the whole experience.

XPqD0pLnywzQ8sOgIN9yzQ.text: Great spot to go with friends! Affordable tacos and cheap margaritas during happy hour. My favorite is the modelorito. At happy hour it is half off and includes a margarita and a modelo. Basically, two drinks for the price of one! I had a particularly good experience today at lunch. First, I was offered the opportunity to eat outside, which of course I said yes to! The outside seating is limited, therefore it is nice when places offer you a spot to sit outside instead of you always having to ask. We split a half portion of queso. The queso here is the best in Pittsburgh and being able to order an affordable half size for $4 is amazing! Such a deal. I like being able to pick my tacos. Pork is my favorite. Lastly, I liked that the waiter split our checks without even asking. Sometimes waiters get annoyed by the request and I'm happy it wasn't a bother, but expected!

ABbNXGaPaziK-BCg23I0aA.text: Second try! Never again! Our waiter was amazing, just wish the food was. We've visited both locations and don't think we'll be going back any time soon!chicken tacos were COLD, and the corn tortillas were just awful! Queso was BLAND, guacamole was just OK!

7r3U5wk5CgdJ_IWWbocS6g.text: Cute restaurant with delicious margaritas. Was surprised to see prices of tacos as "so cheap" but they are so small. Tried chicken and beef tacos and the chicken was cold. Cheese was totally cold on both. Ordered a side of rice and it was room temperature unseasoned white rice. Just stay for drinks.

JP61Nd0TFHCTVgS5h9Em_w.text: I really liked this place! Lots of seating, great guac (highly recommend the Tuscany guac), and great customer service. When we took some of guac home, they gave us a bag of extra chips! I made my own tacos and failed on the combinations so I won't comment on them. Maybe the pre-designed ones are better. They have a variety of shells though for the tacos - very unique. I'll def try this place again!

77QNcPvS9Ez6opuYfzkyPg.text: Delicious, fresh food! Great for after-theater nosh because it's open late, but it's a bit cramped & noisy like any bar might be on a Saturday night. The queso, fresh chips & tacos were all yummy! Go with a basic cocktail from the menu...this is not a place for refined cocktail connoisseurs.

y8ShycxZoNw9Q3K74kqldg.text: Stopped in for happy hour with my roommate and girlfriend and I was very impressed with the tacos/service. The tacos were well above average, our waitress was very helpful, and the bill was low. I will be back!!

aIRkPuQIhSHIksOfF7kflQ.text: love this place. service could be a bit better but overall really great. great food awesome vibe.

vMFRvzCn2RUkXmxpInU1lg.text: Great spot. Went for Sunday brunch. Margaritas were delicious as were the tacos. We had a wonderful server too. Can't wait to go again.

13yOumKcDcXyYbFmrThs0A.text: The hostess was nice the bartenders ok... the place looked a bit dirty and not many places to sit.. the food... overly cilantroed way too spicy I got supposedly bbq jackfruit which I wouldn't expect to be spicey and the supposedly the least spicey SOUR CREAM omg after a few bites I got the worst heartburn and 24 hrs later still have heart burn and acid reflux.. the side of rice had way way way too much black pepper and cilantro my finances bacon beans were loaded with pepper.. if you are over loading stuff with pepper and cilantro you are trying to cover for something.. never going back honestly and I hate to say it but I'd rather of home to chipotle.i love Jack fruit but I am not risking the pain of immediate and morning heart burn for this place again.. you got 3 stars for ok service but talk to your chef!!!

3gNg1zUV3vVTxrBNp_iXPA.text: Take your Taco Cravings to Taco Bell and you will be more satisfied than coming here. Low quality ingredients=no taste. I ate this over an hour ago and I am still regretting the waste of calories I ingested.

-wNVHnrbdmmoMEm1ZC422g.text: The best frickin tacos I've ever had in my life!!!! like everything was perfect, the manager explained how to order everything with patience(im slow sometimes) lol but it was just awesome. Will return again.

8n6wCgq85yC7XTF0Z6ibsQ.text: Went with a big group on a busy Friday and were seated upstairs. Even though the place was packed and we had multiple checks, our server was attentive and all the food came out together. We had a couple dips to share and I was a little disappointed with the queso. Not as flavorful as the name diablo queso would lead you to believe. The pineapple guacamole was surprisingly good. We all did the make your own tacos. I would highly recommend the ju-ju or goody goody taco shells - their homemade chorizo is tasty and not too greasy. The only problem with build your own is that I have a tendency to put too many toppings on and then can't taste the individual flavors. But it is nice to be able to pick cheese, salsas, sauces without being charged extra. The flavored margaritas were okay - reasonably priced but very sweet. Next time I'll try the regular margarita. They also didn't put salt on the rim but it could've been because they were busy. Much better prices than Tako and the food is delicious - can't wait to go back.

eVfH0jIBNGwBBNQm-V_bdQ.text: Fun and friendly taco restaurant Downtown.  So many options for customizing orders, can be overwhelming.  Honestly, you can't make a bad choice!   Highly recommend the flight of Margaritas!!

uiJ-0vjHnLZ21FreAiTrQw.text: We went here on a Friday night and only waited about ten minutes (or, as the hostess put it, a "one margarita wait" for a party of two).  The service was excellent.  As we had never been here before, the waitress took time out of her running from table to table to stop and explain everything to us, and she was very friendly and attentive.  I'd give the service itself 4 stars.  The food is good...not excellent, but there's a novelty and variety to it that made it something fun and different.  For a mini-chain restaurant, though, the ordering process was kind of overwhelming and confusing at first.  It uses the bubble-in sheets like a Burgatory, but I've always found designing my own burger to be self-explanatory.  This, not so much.  We had to ask for a lot of clarification, so I think they could save their servers some time if they reworked the bubble-sheet ordering form to be more clear and user-friendly.   The chips and salsa were pretty bland to be honest.  We really enjoyed the tacos and the margarita flights though.  Tequila was super-present, as it should be, but the interesting flavors offered for the margaritas could be easily distinguished as well.  Just one little word to the wise -- the double-layered taco (corn and flour tortilla) are huuuuuuuge (trademark).  I'm not a petite eater, but with two regular and one double-layered taco, I couldn't quite finish.  Not as good as Tako, but liked it better than a Mad Mex or Steel Cactus.

O8OOE5EPmh0K4FWUV25eoA.text: As a person who has checked out all the cheap taco joints in PGH, this one is my new #1. Only reason I'm giving it 4 instead of 5 stars was our server forgot our appetizer after reminding her twice, and brought it out after both of us had finished our meals. But will definitely come back again! Was amazing food at an amazing price in a great location!! Love the eyeball lights!!

i7M9NRktvRTzMjdskGLVWg.text: inexpensive, delicious and quick service. The menu is simple so all tacos can be different and customizable. they have many vegetarian and vegan options and also gluten free.

6ZjFxCR-uX2n0qfpmbj8SA.text: I got my family and friends hooked on Condados! We've been here numerous times over the past couple weeks and every time is great. The quality of the tacos are amazing and the price is even better. I love the flexibility of the ingredients. Their guacamole is also one of the best I've ever had. My fiancee's favorite is the queso.

K7vozi7409L3UiC9h2Q8MQ.text: OMG.   Very cheap for the quality of food you get. Nachos are a steal for $5.  Would not waste the money on queso.  Chips are some of the best I have ever had.

jQyQBC3U1u1OjvQ14camUQ.text: Ghost pepper sauce is amazing! I want to buy it by the gallon. I was a little disappointed they didn't have the michiliadas ready yet but they were on the menu. My boyfriend moved here from Cleveland and missed Barrio and prefers Condado because the food is just as good but the drink prices are better. And he is a chef who worked at the hottest hotel in Cleveland. He also says the wait staff in the Burgh, although new, by far out shows the staff at Barrio in Cleveland. We win.
