I won't go downtown for anything but jury duty or this place. High praise. I'm so glad they came here!

BxuEiF4istb4Eo720UuAug.text: amazing staff, fun time, great food! although it's super weird that happy hour is only downstairs but other than that i love that place. centrally located too...where tonic used to be. if you're someone who likes to have a good time while you eat, go check it out!

hh5FSUqjFRURNW2ls7VGZA.text: I went with here with my husband and 2 friends on cinco de mayo. I put my name in at 4:30 for a table. The host said that the wait would be a "little while" and I was ok with that because I knew they would be busy because of the holiday. An hour went by and I hadn't heard anything so I went to the host and asked how much longer for a table. She said we were next. So I went back upstairs and got another drink. I saw a table open up and the host seat another party. At this point I was getting annoyed. I went back to the host and asked why we weren't seated, and she said it was because that table seated 6 and we had 4, so we had to wait for a table of 4 to open. I asked how long it would be and she said she didn't know. I went back upstairs for another drink and saw a table of 4 open up and another party that I saw come in way after us was sat. So I went back down to the host to see what was going on. when she looked for my name on her tablet, it wasn't there. So Im assuming they gave our table away and lied to me both times I went to ask about our table. We were waiting for 2 hours at this point and was not happy. We left. By the way, I never received the text for my table.

_t65xnsYJMMKj5AMziUKMw.text: The Tacos are to die for or just wait in line for two hours. It's all worth it !!!!!!!. The people are always nice and accommodating.

FnKgVabGb3FBBL2GthaQhw.text: This place is simply amazing. It is where the old Tonic restaurant use to be. They have remodel and spent a lot of time painting murals on the walls. I is all very well done. It gave me a feeling that I was celebrating the Mexican holiday Dia de los Muertis. Day of the dead.  I liked it.   We started with an appetizer trio. The cheese dip was heavily. I could have taken a bath in it. I was not that impressed with the guacamole. Seemed store bought.   I had two tacos that I built my own. I tried one with the peezler and sweet Lucy tortillas. For protein I tried the brisket and chicken.  The brisket is everything they claim it to be. I will definitely be ordering all brisket next time. The chicken was good.    If you are downtown definitely check this place out

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. El Tres Amigos. Don&#39;t miss the queso.
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

w9g2YgcpWp2hskTiHHZKhA.text: So the hostess as soon as I walked in was a bit rude. I told her I was just eating solo and preferred a table instead of the bar. She asked if a high table was fine and I asked if a regular table was available and she seemed visibly annoyed that I was only one person taking up a table for 3. It was around 5pm when I went in and it wasn't that crowded either. Thankfully when my waitress got there, she was SUPER friendly and helpful and explained the whole menu to me and all the different styles of tacos and how to customize them since I wanted to build my own. She was great. The sauces definitely left me wanting more. I got their secret sauce and I would say it was more sour than spicy. Then again, I am Indian and used to ass-burning heat lol. So I would say if you want really spicy heat, this place won't do it for ya. I got the guac and chips and those were really good but wasn't a fan of the pickled onions on top of the guac. I did build your own tacos, one hard corn shell, one soft, both with rice and black beans on them, lettuce, cilantro, onions and queso fresca. The rice itself didn't have much flavor or seasoning to it and I was a bit surprised that there were only black beans offered and not refried. The black beans also weren't seasoned or anything at all so not much flavor. The other option if you don't eat meat was the tofu or mushrooms and I don't really eat either. I probably won't be back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

SqTcMgbR7ZOBc51WIHzvkQ.text: We were second online for a 4 top table atriums 4:45pm. Waited over an hour. The bartender was crazy rude and could care less. The hostess was nice when putting our name down and our server was pretty good . I don't think the wait was worth it.

uNS6Sp1Dt9cZTdUE5xTY2g.text: I'm not exactly sure what I expected when walking in to this establishment but they far exceeded my expectations! The Mediterranean guacamole was amazing!! The tacos were so unique and delicious. The atmosphere was fun and the staff are super nice!

P0tnTece6qcvuE_KZpvRYw.text: I absolutely loved the experience here. The variety of tacos available is impressive and the quality is just as good. The margaritas are served in adorable mason jars and they have so many great flavors! Between my friend and I, we tried 4 different margs and I enjoyed each one (which isn't common). The staff was attentive and kind.   I think the fact that impressed me the most, besides the variety, is that there are multiple vegetarian options that are actually tasty! It can be hard to find something other than refried beans as  a vegetarian option in Mexican restaurants, but Condado successfully does that.   My only critiques are that the prices are rather steep for a college student, unless you come during happy hour, and that the wait is mighty long during that time. But with quality tacos and margs like this, I think that's warranted. I will definitely be returning!!

NIPb_bmz-9fO9tukBCyYlg.text: First let me say who should steer clear of Condado...  Mexican Purists: This is not your typical Mexican / Taco restaurant.  If you will get all pissed off because Condado taco's don't taste like every other taco you've eaten in your life you should stay away.  Snobs: Condado is small, it can get crowded and sometimes loud.  If you need somewhere quiet where you can spread out with your friends and talk about who has the best BMW you should probably go elsewhere.  Terrible Cooks:  This is a "Build your own taco" restaurant.  If you have absolutely no clue how flavors mix or a general idea of what flavors when put together would be pleasing to you, stay away (otherwise we will have to read your terrible review about how the food sucks, when in actuality it's you that sucks).   Now let me say who should go to Condado...  Foodies:  If your life revolves around new flavors,  fusions, and pushing the boundaries of your taste pallet then Condado is a 100% must visit!  I cannot stress this enough, the mixture of outstanding options is a veritable amusement park for your mouth.  Date Budget Hawks:  In my opinion this is one of the best date night deals in Pittsburgh...  You can get two of the most exciting, original and personally tailored tacos in existence, with two sides and a margarita / craft beer for around ~$14 - 20 per person (even cheaper at happy hour).  And don't worry, unlike many local Mexican restaurants,  Condado's atmosphere is trendy enough to qualify as a legit date location.    If you take a second to read the other reviews you will see the vast majority of 3 star or lower reviews come from people who didn't know WTF they were doing when they built their own taco or people who were pissed because the tacos were not "authentic" (as if eating the exact same king of taco you've eaten since kindergarten is some kind of great thing)...

bYsIDH0L_glLoDg0FEvVEA.text: I have to say - I was expecting MUCH more after I heard all of the hype. You can either build your own taco or try one of their creations. I tried both and I was highly disappointed. My meat was very dry and the flavors were just bland. I will say the chips and queso were pretty great. I would go back for the queso & margs but that's about it.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

liYE52wbt6GLyRVTyAC3Qw.text: Good/unique taco and margarita spot. I'm excited to go back.

r9A_Yv1SfTqBnnJeYekRsQ.text: I went here for happy hour last night with a friend. She had been here before and raved about it.   We got here a little early, around 5, and it's a good thing we did - we were able to get a seat at the bar but within 15 minutes they were packed! In order to get the happy hour deals you have to sit downstairs. So if you want a seat, plan accordingly.   We ordered their trio of dips as an appetizer and margaritas. We got their red salsa, this amazing quest with peppers in it, and their honey chipotle pineapple guacamole. I love that they had some different twists on classics (like pineapple in guacamole). All three were awesome, and came with large portions.   I did the build your own tacos. I got mine "sweet Lucy" style, which is a soft taco wrapped around a hard taco, smothered in quest and guacamole. I loved the combination of flavors and textures! I also loved the plentiful vegetarian options - they had three veggie proteins! I tried the Thai chili tofu and it was awesome. Very flavorful. The tacos are big - I ordered two and has trouble finishing after the dips.   The margaritas were also tasty, and we had good service. Since we are during happy hour, we also got an amazing deal! Between the two of us we ordered the trio of dips with chips, four tacos, and four margaritas - and it came in around $45. For all that quality food! I was impressed, and I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie tacos

GfwFaMb25SsXJwItkBc7ZQ.text: Best. Tacos. Ever!! "The mantis" taco was literally the best taco that I have ever had and definitely one of the top 10 foods I have ever ate. The mantis is a vegetarian taco made with jackfruit, chihuahua cheese, and habenero/mango bbq. We also had the queso and a pitcher of the house margaritas.  Everything was delicious.  Hands down better than Bakersfield and tako.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

bSv_ubFT19AZ1dHt-ZoCYw.text: Great tacos and margaritas! I love being able to customize my order. The food has always been fantastic and overall the staff is friendly.

EJ2yfAS-BwFneupFLL1DEA.text: Tried this place for the first time today. You can build your own tacos, or select from a menu of gourmet tacos. I thought I ordered 3 tacos but when my food came out there were two huge, filled to the brim tacos, & a big pile of delicious nachos (pictured below). The two tacos were enough to fill me up, then I have nachos for dinner.   The ambiance is great. They have a Day of the Dead theme going on, & just about every kind of tequila you could want. The service was quick & friendly. I highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

4E-t2pIRDbEFnaFc5GO6NA.text: Stopped at Condado before a Pirates game based on a recommendation from a colleague at work. We arrived at 5:00, which was good because they were packed shortly after. Even as crowded as they were, the service was fantastic. We had nachos to start and tacos (of course). The food was very good as were the margaritas (not from a mix - a huge plus in my book). Definitely would go back without hesitation.

w3mWlSlvMgToBDehCYMT6w.text: We stopped in on a Saturday afternoon with our daughter (age 1). We had the dirty queso and make your own tacos. The food came fast and I was more than full after two tacos. Great flavor combos and I like that they change them up!

o0iSp9lgz09wDYW6_pyYew.text: We had a blast here! It was across the street from our hotel so we just stumbled upon it but the tacos were excellent (we got a variety and weren't disappointed by any) and we also really enjoyed our margarita pitcher. Any place you can get great tacos and margaritas is a win. Definitely a young, hip vibe but we didn't feel out of place being some of the older people in the place. Service was great as well. Art on the walls was beautiful. Would visit again and highly recommend to others.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

YVduYOXw5KXFtYpQd0HZ7A.text: Had my 200$ sunglasses on the table pretty sure my sever stole them. Never coming back.

I0H4hk6qAFHvq-gdcSpl4g.text: This is my favorite Mexican place right now!  Great tacos, cool vibe, friendly/knowledgeable bartenders and fun music.  I do think they have too many menus and it can be a bit confusing if it's your first time there.

xMWYaIRiBeD_ERuj1oQyuw.text: Loud ambiance, lots of tables. 2 bars. Upstairs and 1st Level.  Acoustics make it difficult to hear music, so sound is a lil muffled. Cool hipster staff. Friendly. Knowlegeable.   Very good make your own Tacos! Two shells available - hard corn and soft (flour) tortilla.wish they had Renyas shells here. Guacamole is OK.   Full Bar.  Beers on Tap.  Sitting at bar-no hooks for purses or jackets. BOO!  LITERALLY - they just opened.  Give it some time.   Neighborhood gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Loyalty Program
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sides

HecfmOQyGz3GKzM7uy_dag.text: This is typically our favorite place for date night. Tonight we went in and were immediately seated,  which is rare for a Friday night. The service was slow and inefficient. Which was also surprising considering how slow the incoming traffic was. We ordered drinks which came pretty fast, then everything else came very slow. We were charged for items we never received and not frequently checked on by our service. The food was okay. It was room temp by the time we received it. The stars are mostly for previous experiences. Im not ready to give up yet. I would try again as i typically will wait at least a half hour because service food and drinks is usually exceptional

G4zA7_XP4ZI7YCUY78rs2g.text: This place is SO COOL. They have a build your own taco menu, a very extensive liquor menu, & some really good looking cocktails. Whenever you order a margarita, you get to pick the tequila that goes in it! AND they have the tequilas listed by quality! There are a good amount of vegetarian options as well, which is always a plus for me. I ordered one with the Thai chili tofu & one with Portobello mushrooms. Everything was very fresh tasting & their corn tortillas were THE BEST. We also tried their Queso special which was loaded baked potato... it kind of just tasted like potato soup on chips, but it was quite pleasing. The tacos are cheap & the drinks are a decent price for being downtown. I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Loaded potato queso
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Build your own taco

z_abSN-Ez5hQZz7L4zXpSQ.text: The BEST tacos I have ever had. Get the Sweet Lucy shell...just do it.   Love the staff downtown Pittsburgh, except for one woman who was extremely rude and screamed at me to move out of her way at the downtown location while I was trying to get a drink during happy hour and then take it upstairs. Would have gladly moved out of the way and stayed out of the way with a simple "excuse me". Another bartender was very unfriendly and rolled her eyes multiple times at us as we told her our drink order and gave her our cards. I was almost angry enough to ask for their names, and wish I had now. Luckily, the rest of the staff being lovely has persuaded me to return.   Also...the amount of waste produced by Condado is absurd. I don't know why they don't just get plates and real silverware instead of plastic silverware, aluminum foil, paper tray, and wax paper that have a total life span of about 1 minute while you down your taco. Companies like Condado need to take responsibility for the damage they are doing to our earth.

FQTOQGTSlGQaNnHXvU1ypg.text: Delicious affordable quick Mexi food. Tacos only. Great guac and queso dip. Braised beef is off the hook!

KimgWAWW-pdjkzvn50EPFQ.text: Affordable and quality tacos!!! They are often bigger than you think, so best to order just two and keep em coming if your hungry. Their salsa is a little meh, but their house margs are great for the price, especially if you get a pitcher! The double taco shell options and jackfruit tacos are especially good!!

FiEKbPTZkAJ-ATL6ewfUCg.text: I was really looking forward to my first trip to Condado, but unfortunately, I didn't get to experience what all the hype was about. We came on a Saturday evening and the service was awful. To begin, our waters were never refilled throughout our meal, and our food order was incorrect. Our poor waiter spilled salsa all over our table and on me and my friends. No manager ever came to our table to apologize or address our concerns. The salsa was not removed from our bill. Any good will efforts from management would have changed this interaction significantly. I'm sure it was just an off night, but I don't think we'll be back for the prices and the service.

XoHxT37TeuRb0YRHRjlTpQ.text: Okay. They have really stepped up their game over the past year. They tacos are great (not authentic though) but they carry many options for different dietary restrictions. Pricing recently went up but they are still fairly priced for being downtown. I'm happy that there have been so many improvements to the food quality.

fPFvNtJgupmg9S5J9fl7AQ.text: Another day, another trendy taco place (or so I thought). Although the tacos here are not at all traditional, they're really fun and inexpensive.   Condado has a menu of pre-made tacos that you can order, or you can customize your own. Tacos are three dollars a piece, and two are usually enough. I've never tried the pre-made tacos, but I always have a blast ordering my own creations. They have a variety of shells--flour, hard corn shells, and a couple of combinations of both, some with melted cheese, beans, etc. The chorizo is probably my favorite meat there, and it's a nice place for people that are lactose intolerant--it's so easy to skip the cheese!!   The margs are fun too--I enjoy the banana one a lot! I've been back, and will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. DIY tacos.
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ghost pepper steak nachos!
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. DIY tacos.

k-KK5JsNqiKm6up0J4WISQ.text: Best. Tacos. In. Town. Hands down. Did I just rhyme? I mean it when I say Condado is never a let down. This is probably our sixth time here since it's open and not once we're we disappointed. There happy hour is unreal. $1 off tacos, $1 off drafts and half priced on all margaritas. More taco combinations than any person can comprehend and the tastes and flavors to go along. If you don't ever read another review take my advice and get to Condado ASAP. You'll thank me later ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chorizo queso!
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Regular menu

IMi57R7-hnk7-0eK0DN9og.text: Food was good. Service wasn't the greatest. Ordering is a bit confusing. Pricy for tacos!

YLX054ZmzBEnxA9IMtK2zg.text: Condado Tacos is excellent. The service is always helpful and the food never disappoints. Their queso is second to none. Better than Moe's queso. I was a little disappointed with their margaritas, however. They were small and just did not taste as good as I thought they would. Other than the margaritas everything else is fantastic.

VY33vz8jn0lhdePRstKq7w.text: I have been back to Condado a few times since my first visit when they first opened and I just don't feel they are living up to their original standard they set last year for me.  While their food, in my opinion, is still good and their combinations creative/endless, my issue stands with their service.  If I were rating based on service and the interaction I've had with employees alone, I'd give 2 stars and even that is being generous.  I've been here 3-4 times with reservations and it's never been a simple process. I would think with such a large upstairs space and the fact that they promote brunch so heavily on the weekends, that they would expect the crowd that comes and not act like they're trying to keep their head above water taking care of customers.  During any visit I've made recently, there were issues with the reservation not being communicated/tables not being set up, the service being slow/confusing/clustered or our food not coming out correctly.  These are all relatively minor things to be resolved, but creates an irritating experience when they happen, especially on a repeated basis. The employees seem to be there more to interact with each other and socialize than to actually do their job.   This past weekend we had a large party for my birthday and while our waitress was doing the best she could, they set us up in this most misconsTrued configuration of 3 tables all facing different direction and we had one person taking care of all of us ON TOP of her other tables upstairs.  This caused a lot of confusion both for her and us and probably would have been helpful to have more hands on deck.  Not to mention not one person at my table felt they actually received what they ordered, but that's not the waitress' fault.  Overall I love the idea and the atmosphere (and the margs) at Condado, but there are definitely areas that need work.  Seems fun & great for a group of people, but ends up being more frustrating and inconvenient, in my experience, once it's all said and done.

3f45slidJINzwt45ezhQUw.text: This is my favorite taco place in Pittsburgh! (And a favorite among many of my co-workers as well!) The hard and soft shell combo is a must try as well as the beef brisket meat option. The Blood Orange and Pomegranate margaritas are fruity and delicious. Don't forget to start your meal with chips and queso - I wish I didn't have to share it with the table! The atmosphere is quite loud so it's not ideal for a large table to have a conversation but smaller groups of 2-4 will be just fine.

tB20zU5yTu_FqbJWVw3M8w.text: The food was too salty. I ordered two tacos using their checklist to select items -- I received two tacos that were barely full of anything. I brought it up with the waitress and she promptly took the back. A guy from the kitchen returned with two new tacos and apologized for the mistake. The tacos definitely looked more full but the were still missing ingredients that I selected. Too bad: I am visiting Pittsburgh and this leaves an impression.

NB8MRk2h9PWz2SGlNbpI4A.text: This is my new favorite taco spot in Pittsburgh. It puts the two other downtown taco restaurants to shame. The upstairs inside isn't super fancy but it has a ton of light so you can actually see your food (I don't like eating in the dark TaKo) and it isn't so loud that you can't hear your dinner companions.   I love love love the ordering system. You choose from the printed list what you want on your taco and you can customize down to the tiniest detail. They also offer daily specials and I'm bummed that I was too full to try the Korean BBQ taco with kimchee but if it's offered the next time I got I will absolutely save room!  The bartenders were really friendly and well informed on the menu and the margaritas were delish. We also really loved the guacamole and chips. I can't wait to go back!

PWvsQ0Eh3-99xxUnfK3wDA.text: We stumbled upon Condado due entirely to its proximity to our hotel, but what a find! The bar vibe was great and I can only imagine it got better and louder as the tequila flowed and the crowds swelled. Fortunately, there is an upstairs which also has a fully stocked bar and a less raucous feel. The wait staff is engaging and knowledgeable, and the food delicious. I particularly liked the ability to build my own taco and order more or less depending. The guacamole is particularly good: dense and highly flavorful. Great and very serious selection of liquor and beers, and don't forget to ask about the special food and drinks menu that rotates monthly. This place is a must-seek when in Pittsburgh.

stCCGUUkmgwGRKYjWxoqGw.text: Best tacos I've ever had. They are so flavorful and the service is fast! The place is small but the food makes up for it!

JfIURvUbTBdvyGlADJqChw.text: My favorite taco place in town! And I've tried them all! Love that you can make your own. Staff can be a bit more attentive but it's ok.

TuVj8ZJU8fiu37duv9lcJQ.text: Mediocre at best. Overly crowded, felt like I was in a cafeteria. Margarita flight was the best thing going for them. The guac was decent. Tacos were large and good value for amount of food. Loud dining, could barely hear my company speak. Overly 2.5/5, 3 is generous. If you want a good taco joint, go to Tako.

gepvYH7BlcOnuONhzXvfkQ.text: Been here a couple of times... very nice workers each time I went. Delicious food and you can build your own tacos from Scratch which makes it interesting. Love this place will continue to go.

IxSqaTiSB2WYeynyj3uh4Q.text: A True disappointment. I completely agree with the other reviews suggesting they revise their menus into something more cohesive. Additionally, yes, it is an extremely tight space with very small tables.   Anyways. The biggest let down were (you guessed it!) the tacos! I mean, COME ON. if you're gonna specialize in literally ONE type of food -- you gotta get it right! (Insert that "they had one job" joke here)   Condado definitely missed the mark for me. I ordered the brisket tacos with cilantro and onions, slaw and lettuce. These were borderline disgusting. There was hardly any meat on it. A tablespoon is a generous estimate. Next, it was served fresh out of the refrigerator! Not even room temp, but completely cold. Zero seasoning or flavor and smelled like dog food.   The cilantro and onions were barely noticeable, and I'm almost certain they just forgot the slaw because there was hardly anything else on it except for some soggy lettuce. Finally, I got a side of rice for $1 -- served in those tiny little black containers most restaurants use for condiments. That is also a tremendous waste and laughable. Basically a little shot of rice. Cool.   My one time experience here made Taco Bell look like a three Michelin Star establishment.

KOyByA9XvvbrA-GYiOHLZw.text: Second time was much better after the initial crowd died down since opening. Love the specials and the variety of taco options. Very pleased on my second trip and excited to go again!

USd-wx4hBVniTrsH18Y-LA.text: This place has long happy waits if you don't get there early. That means it's good right?? I would say it was good, but didn't live up to the hype. I had a blackberry margarita with two tacos. The margarita was the best part of my meal. The tacos were good, but the flavor wasn't as developed as I had hoped for the flavor combos that I was able to pick on the create your own. Food came out very quick.  Warning the mango habanero sauce is mainly habanero tasting with just a touch of mango, I was hoping for the opposite. It overpowered the taco.   I would go back, but I think Las Velas is better for happy hour margaritas.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Blackberry and Pomegranate margaritas. Pomegranate was more tart.
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

GMWQ44lN1f_rYzernoyIcQ.text: Place was great. Ordering system a bit strange but more customizable. Food was on point. Staff felt welcoming. The chorizo was amazing

GP7cgFMyCuGuiPLGtjr9Eg.text: If you love tacos you have to try this place. The service is fast the drinks are good and the food is amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

GPzjkEuokV-iErCJP5AoTw.text: This is a great downtown lunch spot. You check off a list to build your own tacos. Good service even in the busiest of a lunch rush. The tacos were excellent, but be sure to get a side of the cilantro lime rice and the black beans, over the top flavors for a lunch that won't bust your wallet!

N5ZF9H931Szw6rCTYz3Gtg.text: Great little taco joint!  Our waiter was great, took time out to explain how it works there! Made it in time for happy hour, enjoyed 1/2 off my margarita and $1 off our tacos. Busy little place with great food. Only complaint is getting charged $1 for rice and $1 for beans on my tacos when there was barely any rice or beans on it. Otherwise, great little place!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Firey hard shell with ground beef and soft shell with steak!! Mmmm!
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Both soft shell, one chicken, one steak
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Great service from this guy, very personable, helpful and professional!!.He&#39;s serving a flight on margaritas to another table.

1SMCZGgHLna0lpCLgchaqA.text: Great tasting food with amazing service! It's a quick and easy choice if you're new to the area!

ogHcQZ4-n_KeVZ29qldKNg.text: Tacos A La Carte. You can sit down and build your tacos to order... customized in every way.  The guacamole is ridiculously delicious with chips that are freshly made... omg they were addictive.  The tacos were pretty good, but that might have been my own ability to build a less than awesome taco.  We really liked the food and ate up the beans and rice (I don't know what they put into those beans - probably crack)  it is laid-back... and a really good place for Happy hour probably or a low-key date.  FUN place.. good food =)

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Awesome guac
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menus
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Customized taco ordering

SMv81hZY9UYhePmEikD9FA.text: Best tacos in Pittsburgh!! Love the fact that you can make your own taco and choose everything from the type of shell and meat, to the toppings, cheese, and sauce. They have a great selection of ingredients too, so you will definitely find something you love, or something new to try. I recommend getting a few different tacos so you can switch up the ingredients and get different levels of heat. Their Happy Hour is great too, half price margaritas, which are fantastic, and chips with guac or queso. Even the chips that come with the guac were delicious. They were fresh and had a perfect amount of salt fried onto them. The perfect complement to the flavorful guacamole. Portion sizes are large too, these are full tacos so you fill up fast and get a good amount for what you're paying for. Prices are definitely reasonable for the quality of food you are getting too. Keep in mind how crowded this restaurant gets on the weekends and during Happy Hour. For 2 of us, it was about a 20 minute wait at 6pm, which wasn't bad, but we just had to stand on the stairs until our table was ready because the bar was packed. Definitely recommend going here!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

q5ED6uq0LozU8mtgB7NyOA.text: Came here this past Friday night with the bf and we loved it! Despite it being pretty busy, we were seated immediately. Great decor and atmosphere. I ordered the Pineapple Express marg and it was delicious! So light and refreshing. My bf ordered the Blood Orange marg and he enjoyed it as well. We also had the guac & chorizo queso. Great portion for the price. Tacos were great - my bf loved his chicken & steak tacos and I loved the shrimp ceviche. Can't wait to come back!

MUy0Guc6NnVyqaZNpbFxTw.text: Condado, you've grown on me. My initial review was a 3 star, but over the last couple visits, I've become obsessed with their tacos. They offer a couple vegetarian options: tofu, mushrooms, and pulled jackfruit. All are fantastic but my favorite is definitely the tofu. Their build-your-own taco menu has so many customizable options so no matter what you're into, they'll have it. It's a popular spot so expect a wait to get in during happy hour. Noise level can get obnoxiously loud so you'll have to scream across the table if you want to have a conversation. Or you can be like me and use it as an excuse to focus on eating the entire time.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

OBmYdxcuYIjozjzYKrwiQg.text: If you're looking for some Tacos in the midwest, this is the place to be. Pittsburgh has quite a few taco joints, but this spot is sure a personal favorite! Quality margaritas and solid tacos packed with tons of filling. 2-3 tacos here will keep yourself full for sure! It can get busy sometimes, which may slow service a bit. Staff is pretty great otherwise, so its worth the wait

VLV9EpsUJhx-PEqqPVw9cw.text: The Burgatory equivalent of a taco place.   Each person can choose from staff-recommended taco combinations, or they can step out of their comfort zone to create a custom taco creation.  With a topping check list and a pencil, you choose how wild or safe your tacos will taste.   The best part is the outside shell options: if you thought it was just soft or hard, corn or flour, you were wrong! Get wild, go condado.   At just $3.50 a taco, you can switch it up and not feel bad about it.   Great location, but a little tight on space. I will definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Condado Tacos: The décor is almost as cool as the tacos.

OTu3QZZJOT-IvizAI7n_mQ.text: Prior to coming here, my co-workers had mixed reviews so that kept me away for some time.  On a recent outing where I was asked to pick a place, I figured I would give a try anyway!  I was actually pretty pleased with the visit.  The chips are thick and extra crispy and the tacos were quite tasty. The menu can be a bit confusing until they explain it to you. You can build your own tacos or choose their "suggested" tacos. Be careful with ordering the chips as the queso dip can be 6 or 8 dollars, very expensive unless you are sharing with multiple people at the table!  I like the peezler shell (sandwiched with bean spread and had a nice hearty flavor) and the chorizo meat.    I attempted to order and pick up to save time but after showing up, I still had to wait another 20 mins to get 3 tacos.  That was a bit disappointing but won't deter me from ordering again.

joDRNImBrMQqzasVXKUgog.text: Condado Tacos is a wonderful place to get made to order tacos! My husband and I have visited a few times and have never been disappointed. On our most recent visit, we loved the September guac of the month - if you go this month you HAVE to try it! They tend to be very crowded during dinner time, but the wait is never that long. The service is great and the decor is perfect. We can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

kse4kDR05tMpYmVkSWBTFg.text: Visiting from out of town and this place was close to the hotel we were staying at so we walked. Probably about a 10 min wait which was cool because we just walked along the strip and they texted us when our table was ready. Our waiter started out okay but since this is our first time coming and we mentioned it I expected him to kinda give us the explanation on everything and how to order, he didn't. I also assume he was like in a mood because he was kinda short and not very helpful but the manager Janine came in and saved the day and gave us amazing suggestions and apologized for the shortness of our waiter. We would come back just because she was so sweet. Food was good, not a fan of the chicken but steak and shrimp super good.

yJ4oKu8xclvO31iH-RZzXg.text: We tried this place on Saturday afternoon. When we arrived it was already crowded. The first floor has about a dozen tables and a bar. The hostess took us upstairs where there was quite a bit more seating.   We ordered the guacamole and chips to start as well as a margarita for the hubs and a sangria for me. The guac was a pretty large portion in comparison to many other places. And the chips were fresh which was a huge plus. The margarita was good, but the sangria was not my favorite.  We both ordered two tacos a piece. The hubs ordered from the suggested menu and I did the "build your own".  The tacos were large and very tasty! My first taco had the beef with standard toppings and my second taco had pulled pork with a pineapple salsa. They were both delicious.  Hubs tried one of the vegetarian tacos and he loved it. That's saying quite a lot since he is definitely a meat eater.  When we left the line waiting for a table was huge. We obviously beat the rush. This place has some obvious pluses and not many cons.  Pros: Tasty tacos  Good value in the guac Fresh chips Homemade salsas Good prices  Nice location   Cons: Sangria could use some work  Drinks are a bit pricey  Crowded place The beans are way too salty- not good   All in all we will definitely be back. But we will certainly do our best to hit them at a slow time.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

EV-SFcWOpvQA6-cXM9I8hA.text: Awesomely tasty original tacos and other fare.  Fresh and flavorful. Super helpful staff really explain and assist with making selections.  Prompt preparation and delivery of food.  Sodas from Mexico and great beer selections.  We fell head-over-heels for this place!  LOVED, LOVED, LOVED IT!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Super interesting artsy decor
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fun art...and it has an upstairs level!

QeKOC2JIcZV1QwHLYXJpNQ.text: I think everyone who frequents the downtown restaurant scene would agree with me that the market is flooded with taco restaurants. Condado was the latest to join and at first I was thinking "really, more tacos??" However, I think Condado brings something different and I find myself coming here quite often.   This is a create your own taco place even though I've actually never done that. The gazillion different options kind of overwhelms me so I usually get the pre-designed tacos. I've tried a number of items from their "Taco Suggestions" menu and my favorites would have to be "The Mantis" and "Surf n Turf." I typically don't go with vegetarian options but The Mantis is to die for! Condado's tacos are quite substantial (I'm usually full after two) and they are also super affordable.   While the space might seem small, there is a whole second level. Service is also pretty quick so it's a great place for a quick lunch! Although I'd be ok with Condado's tacos any time of day!

Jt5R7g6aGkuhBzGN8XGRig.text: Amazing food, pretty poor service-for my first experience at least.   I wasn't understanding how the app choice worked and had a few questions about the menu and the waiter didn't hide his annoyance with me.  Once again, great food, so I will give it another go for certain. Hoping the service improves next time.

AfgxBqoqIbZW3yRlaPI2jQ.text: #TacoTues, #queso and #margs are certainly all the rage lately; and you've probably heard a millennial raving about this place - but let me assure you this place is more than an Instagram foodies' dream come True! Condado is just simply fun and delicious.  I have visited many times and always leave full and satisfied from the food. I will keep returning as there are so many options to create your own margaritas, chip & dip companions, and taco creations.   Anyplace that has margarita flights is for me. I love that I can try a few of the fruit flavors and not break the bank at $15 for 3 decently sized margs. I am particular about drinks and I do enjoy their margaritas. Plus they are relatively inexpensive (for a downtown spot) .  I also love that Condado offers fresh chips with flaky salt (important) plus many unique salsa combinations, fresh guac and flavorful queso.   I could fill up on just chips and dip -  but then there are the tacos. You get to build your own tacos for a reasonable price! I stick to the non-spicy options and have plenty of elements to choose from. I love their unique taco shell combinations, pulling both soft and hard shell with cheese and chorizo in between - delicious!  My first visit I ordered 3, when one was probably large enough. They come fully stuffed and are'nt dry due to all the cheese, salsas and sauce you can have packed on top.   I definitely enjoy their food, but for me the service has always been underwhelming. All but 1 server I've had has been uninspiring. Serve has been very transactional and servers are uninterested in answering questions and or sharing suggestions. I remember being lost of the process during my first visit. The menus are confusing and the monthly features are not easy to find - and the servers definitely do not offer to walk you through the form or the multiple menus, nor do they mention the special dip or meat of the month.   My most recent visit I actually did have a pleasant, friendly server. I sat outside and she must have been inspired by the sun as she did welcome sharing suggestions.  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

L7WFZsOduABVlz_9JDG8tg.text: This was my first time at this location. I've had nothing but positive and pleasant experiences at all the other locations. Unfortunately, the service at this location does not compare to their other locations, especially the several locations in Columbus Ohio. Our server messed up our drink order, which is understandable since we were a large party of 8. However, he made limited appearances, which prevented us the opportunity to tell him that the drink order was incorrect.  After about 20 minutes with not seeing our server, one of the guest in our party decided to go to bar to get his desired drink, which caught our server's attention. Our sever came over to our table and said it's disrespectful for us to get a drink from the bar and that it was cutting into the amount of money he made off our table. He was pretty sassy and we explained that a trip to the bar would have never been made if he came over to check on us in a timely manner to inform him of the mistaken drink order. Fortunately, the food was amazing and met our expectations! Service could have been better but we were all happy with our meals.

mGtdUWtoYagtm9Wk6mUNsg.text: I can't believe that we hadn't tried this place before now....so good! I had a chicken bowl, and my bf had three different tacos. He said they were one of the best he's had! And the bowl was delicious. I love the decor and the vibe as well. Super cute place and good food, works for me!

Ag8W7t_clmKhcxXkKllNXQ.text: Coming from Columbus, OH I am a HUGE fan of Condados and so I was so excited to try out the Pittsburgh locations.   The night my friends and I decided to go to this location, there were a few events going on downtown so it was definitely a busy night, which we understood. We put our names in, didn't get an estimated wait time, but were told we could walk around the area and we would get a text. We ended up going to the rooftop bar at Sienna Mercato for some drinks to pass the time, but when we got the text that our table was ready, it turns out you only have a few minutes (i think it was ~5?) to get back to claim your table but that was impossible for us. We got to Condados 2 minutes late, after waiting 40 minutes, and were told our table was gone but they would put us at the top of the list and get us the next available table. After waiting another 20 minutes, and seeing other tables get seated, we asked the hostess again and it turns out we were never actually added back to the list but that they would give us the next available table. We ended up waiting 1.5 hours meanwhile they had 2 tables saved for a large party, but it was 40 minutes past the time of that table's reservation but they continued to hold those spots and I don't think that's fair.   Now to the food and drinks. The tacos are amazing and I love that you're able to build your own because that's what truly makes Condados unique. My friends and I shared chips & salsa/guac. I've gotta say we were upset when we found out they were out of the pineapple and corn salsas but their quesos and guacs were amazing, so in the end it was alright. Those of us who got tacos, got 2 and those of us who got the bowls weren't able to finish it because the portions are a bit large for the bowls, so well worth it! The drinks were inconsistent. We had one pitcher of margs that was so strong and you could pretty much only taste the tequila but the others were perfectly balanced in flavor. And it wasn't just the pitchers, one of the girls got the single glasses and you could just tell by looking at the two that they were completely different shades of orange and vastly different in taste.   Overall, the food is what we were there for so it was worth it, but we could've gone without the wait. And it would be better if there was more consistency with their drinks.

fttyudaIMmOw3wca3SshmQ.text: Usually a good sign when there is a line of people outside waiting to eat. Tacos were delicious. Spicy margs were very good as well. 10/10 would recommend, well worth the wait.

FhDLJcoFBFnf4iffOZHsuw.text: I don't want to write a terrible review, but the service here was not very good. I get some days things happen so I tried getting a dinner order to go and it was all wrong. The food is good, but the unreliable service is disappointing!

XOcGREdmMH25zI9F4euEPg.text: This is probably my favorite taco place in town (there are also a few in Ohio). The tacos are great and customizable so you can get exactly what you want. The double decker chicken tacos with ghost pepper sauce is amazing. They also have a full bar with a great tap list. There are plenty of tequila and mezcal options as expected. The chip dips and sauces are great with plenty of options as well.   The only issue is that the place is a bit small and can get busy so may be good to go on non-peak hours. I would recommend this place to all taco fans (everyone).

UbRvA81BuPae__77t3ULYg.text: Loved loved loved this place! We arrived around 9pm and only had to wait 10 minutes for a table on a busy Saturday night.   I liked their unique way of ordering. There were two tablets on the table, one for suggested tacos and another for you to create your own taco, bowl, quesos, and quacs. Our waiter was patient in explaining things to my group since none of us had ever been here. He recommended good tequila shots and was on top of the water refills without being asked, all while managing several busy tables.   The guac and chips were delicious. The chips were perfect, fresh, and amazing. The guac was also good but a little on the spicy side. Most of us ate 2 tacos and were stuffed, all of which were packed with lots of flavor and a little bite. One of the guys we were with was reluctant to eat here because he doesn't usually get full on tacos but after 3 of these tacos stated he was surprised how full he was.   Definitely worth the wait and money. I wish we had one closer to my home.

q0cHmF3lo3CBratMe_0hHw.text: First the good news. The food is excellent. Tacos and queso are perfect. I made my own tacos, hard shell w traditional ground beef, spicy taco sauce. Delicious. They have their own you can close as well. Lots of chicken and pork possibilities. The Skywalker (a nacho salad with white queso) is delicious. Great atmosphere and good selection of beer.   Now the bad news: This would've been a 3 star review except for the fact that the wait staff was genuinely nice. We stopped in on Memorial Day around noon. It wasn't busy. While nice, the staff was not exactly observant or attentive. We waited for beverages and food too long. If they were in any way rude, I'd have put this at 3 stars. Assuming the staff gets better training and improves, this could be a primo spot downtown.

i-EFUIHccLuLBm8SOTldMA.text: I'd heard that the Condado tacos were amazing, so I was only a little disappointed when I realized that their existence meant the very first restaurant I went to in Pittsburgh had disappeared (The Tonic Bar and Grill).  And the verdict that I reluctantly came to were that although the chips and salsas were exceptional, the tacos were not. After stuffing my face with chips and gushing about how they were the best I had - were they double fried? when the tacos came, I excitedly opened up the foil because well, tacos have a special place in my heart.    My first bite made me wonder if somewhere between drowning my margarita I had accidentally ordered a frozen taco. I tried to get over it and explore the unique flavors that I knew were there but it was extremely difficult to get past the initial disappointment.  However, their chips and salsa were satisfying, the margaritas pretty good, and the place has an artsy, edgy vibe - so all in all, a place worth hitting for happy hour, maybe not so much for a full course dinner.

g2i9UV98OXWaAnz17UYVTg.text: This is my favorite Mexican in the world. For starters, the inside is decked out in Mexican graffiti and modern decor which is awesome. Next, for appetizers, I just get the original guacamole and salsa verde and have never looked back since they are fire. Next you get to customize your tacos. Don't skip out on the Juju or Sweet Lucy for the extra $1. It makes the taco go from a 8.5 to a 10. I'm drooling thinking about it. Their margs are ALSO FIRE. And also a little dangerous  since they are so good. I like the wait staff - they're always friendly and attentive. All in all this place is a must go - I haven't had anything that rivaled Condados.

7MP8lXw5DLZhmbfL7Hwpcw.text: Good spot for varied tacos downtown. You fill out your order on notepads, so you can follow their suggestions, or get crazy with it and create your own. Of note that make them different than other taco places are their shells. You can get various shells with cheese and other fillings that really set them apart from the usual corn or flour offerings.   The bar really shines here as well. They have a good draft list and the bartenders can whip up a good many cocktails. Personally, you can never go wrong with a margarita, but some of their specialty cocktails will give that classic a run for it's money.   If the upstairs isn't open the downstairs can feel small, but once they have both levels going it's a good sized spot!

1hVlzduR3AwV2JXc-tSDDQ.text: I came to Pittsburgh to visit friends. They are up the street from the greyhound bus terminal. Stopped by for a drink and something to eat while I waited for my bus back home. Food is good, drinks are good, service is awesome. Didn't have any complaints. Would definitely recommend to people who love Mexican food.

o9I6k56i6BeUoNJPm1Gjxg.text: What a cool place!   We had the queso of the month (brie queso with orange). Their chips are absolutely amazing. Freshly fried. Delicious.  It was fun to design your own taco, selecting covering type, protein, toppings, cheeses, sauce, etc. Even a basic with no extras for $3.50 was a good deal.   I had a soft taco with shrimp ceviche, pineapple salsa, lime cilantro sauce, and a mild white crumbled cheese. It was incredibly refreshing and tasty.  Everyone in our group loved their food. Too bad we aren't local or we could eat here more often!

GIzKuhwrxcyvaOYy8dPM7A.text: Such a hit or miss anymore... I used to be so excited to come here, but the past two times. Womp womp womp.... Nothing super special...The service is pretty awful and I don't think it is the servers' fault. They seem to get stacked with such large sections and that is not their fault. The tacos are obviously good, but the timing of the apps and tacos are awful. The tables are so tiny you can't even fit it all, that's after we had the hostess take away the wooden contraption. I tried their red pepper & pineapple marg, the presentation was sooo pretty. But, the taste. I was not a fan... I even love fresh squeeze juices, so I thought I would have loved it, not really. I took a few sips and couldn't do it anymore. Our server was so busy, I couldn't even order something else.  My favorite part of my trip? The dirty sauce, I do not know what's in it that makes it spicy, but I'm obsessed!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

By_zgHOmUwgs8Re8X4JoSw.text: Although the tacos were tasty as hell (the margarita was weak) this place is an accessibility nightmare. I'm considered a young, able-bodied individual who's made it through this world without too much trauma, but LORD, if anyone with the SLIGHTEST touch or claustrophobia or sexual trauma would not be able to exist here. Neither would someone who struggles reading/understanding English (this is a Tex-Mex restaurant), is hard of hearing, hard of sight, in a wheelchair, with a cane, with children, a service animal, someone wider than 20 inches, and a whole slew of other average people conditions. I was inadvertently touched countless times sitting at a very high top table with no seat back with my back turned to what was supposed to be a walkway with another row of seats for the bar no less that 25 inches between. I felt so many bodies brush past me, and my server, who was taking a order for the table next to me, leaned in to hear the their order and their body became flush with my phone in my back pocket. That means leaning with a considerable weight against my ass, to be clear.  THIS SHOULD NOT GO WITHOUT MENTIONING: You are required to place your own order through a menu pad that reads like an SAT demographic bubble form (in this dimly lit mf-in bar). My partner and I are college-educated, American-born, English-speaking peeps and this arrangement for ordering food is absurd. Is it too hard to talk to folx, servers (or rather ownership, who thought it was cheeky to order this way)? This creates a huge and potentially embarrassing obstacle for people with intellectual processing issues, and most of the aforementioned conditions I listed above. The server didn't mention the way to order until they came back to retrieve our choices, then had to explain how the hell this system works, which I imagine is an annoyingly regular occurrence. I feel for the workers here. We had to kinda figure it out on our own. But what if you want four different tacos? One sheet only has two columns and asks for one name--do you use two forms? Or what if only two people are dining and you each want two of the same thing (respectively) can you use one sheet and save the trees? There are a lot of ways this could go and there was no warning that this ordering system in this stimuli-ridden restaurant (dim lights, loud music, people touching me everywhere) is anxiety inducing af.  Some thought should be given to how many people can physical squeeze into a building vs how many people can comfortably exist in a building. This layout and consideration to access could use some work.

mVkhWjqEXnu7hop5ykPVbQ.text: The tacos are meh but the margaritas are great!! I highly recommend checking out happy hour. Margarita are about $3.50 each and they're super strong! There is a wide variety. I recommend the peach, mango or the mango and jalapeno mixed together.

cnXGd4NHcheW1IbSeNyDWw.text: So we got there late so I can't comment on the food.   What I can say is that the alcohol was very reasonable in price.  We had 2 beers, 2 vodka mixers and a shot of tequila. Grand total $29.50  The drinks were well made. And the beers were good pours. About 16 oz

HWQihsZmTaByV_Gx2awJvQ.text: This taco place was off the chain the best tacos I've had since I left California drinks are good to guacamole fresh made to order may take a little time to get to your table but so worth it

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Blackened steak taco
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fresh guacamole with fresh chips

afXorh7PVBRQhED11WPuJA.text: This place was good but not worth the long happy hour wait. I've heard so many good things but didnt feel like it lived up to the hype. I had a pomegranate margarita and two tacos.   The margarita was my favorite part of the meal, I liked that they had a lot of flavor options and the flavor was good. My first taco was good, but nothing special. My second taco I got the mango habanero sauce thinking the sweet and spicy would be a great on a taco and it ended up being so spicy I couldn't eat the taco. Could barely taste the mango, it was all habanero.   I would go back, but I enjoyed Las Velas more for happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

xT09kUlN9h2Rg2JcUIlicA.text: I heard so many great things about this place and I really wanted to like it but unfortunately, I hated this place. I mean c'mon Condado, you had ONE job. You serve one type of food so the tacos should be at least decent!   The menu was a little overwhelming and confusing. Once I tasted the tacos, saying I was disappointed would be an understatement. It was probably one of the worst tacos I've had. It was so bland and literally tasted like cardboard. I got a side of rice for 1$ which was also really bad and I don't really know how anyone could mess up rice. After a couple bites, the tacos made me a little nauseous, not really sure why.   In addition to the bad food, the space was really small and not comfortable at all.   I guess the only good thing I can say about this place is that the waitress was nice!   DO BETTER Condado.

gJGxTzoc4GoNEWXNiNmeKQ.text: So I've heard such good things so I stopped by before a show at the Benedum. My tacos were ice cold! The quest was just ok and the margarita wasn't good. The service was good, I didn't return the taco's . Go to Bakersfield for better taco's.

DLc83bOToh_VSzdZt3Ni6w.text: You can pick from predesigned tacos or select ingredients from a list. The tacos come out fresh & hot. It was so good that we came back a second day for another lunch. I had a pulled pork one day & a shrimp ceviche the next. Both days I had a "sweet lucy" shell which is a hard shell inside a soft shell with queso & guac. The pineapple salsa is fresh & light. The prices are reasonable for a city. I would eat here again if in the area.

zIwpRJgGMA8eLw0MkkHS4w.text: These tacos were some of the best tacos I've ever tasted.  Highly recommend the chicken and pulled pork tacos. They ARE a little spicey so make sure you're prepared. Each taco comes with a soft shell and a hard shell. I thought it was weird till I tasted it. It totally works.  Longer lines but they crank people through here.

vi4fxNAjzLPuWwW9at-g7A.text: Amazing food. Friendly staff. Great experience. Options for everyone. My vegetarian girlfriend loves the tofu and the fact that she has variety in her options.

hGVCFOGHRwgnw0yrCIIVew.text: Visited here Thurs 5/16 w/ 2 others. I was seated at 6:45pm & quickly ordered a margarita & 3 tacos. Happy hr is from 5-7pm & tacos are $1 off & margaritas are half off. Our waitress named "Sarah D" took about 8-9 minutes to give us our 1st round. We wanted to order another upon arrival bc she took forever but said "no, one per person at a time." I was pissed, so we weren't ordering anything else from her. The food came & was amazing, then left shortly thereafter to go somewhere the server takes our order when we want it! I would return, but stay clear of this server.

SFyosnrN2X1cg2VBtaFtSw.text: Came here late night with some friends the server had an attitude the whole time and our food was ice cold. When she finally checked on us (after we were all done and not one water refill) we told her the food was cold and she became argumentative and said she would get the manager. The manager never showed up and they comped one persons bill. My other friend was over charged but she was over it so we didn't say anything. Probably won't be back.

r2Jrd4USpEJ-ATrMRF3lxQ.text: I want all of the tacos and I want them now.   I don't think I've had better tacos in Pittsburgh. Decent draft selection, as well. We sat in the downstairs dining area, which is a little tight/crowded, but worth it.

JIQ4GCNQc2EQRO5-7inN4A.text: Condado is whatever you want it to be! Build your own taco with a huge list of delicious ingredients.  We have 3 upscale taco joints in Pittsburgh and somehow they have all been able to differentiate themselves. Condado's  build your own is how they stand out.  You can't start your meal without getting the guacamole and chips. So don't think about it just do it. And drink. ..they have a crazy list of margaritas including banana?! Every time I come here I get a chicken taco, a seafood taco, and a pork taco. Every time I leave I have dreams about the pork taco! Make sure you get pineapple salsa on it. Whatever magic they cook their pork in is heaven.   When you order, 2 tacos will fill you up but I always get a third that makes my car smell...but it stinks so good and can be like a pheromone for some men.   Enjoy! I always do!

0fFmshaoiyTSn4JXozvaaA.text: This was my second time at condado tacos but for some reason I forgot how good this place was. I like that you can make your own tacos from the different salsas, meats, and toppings that they have available. The service is great and the waiter was willing to explain how the ordering is placed on the paper by checking the boxes. It's a really simple, lively, and delicious atmosphere. I'll definitely be back when I'm in downtown for avenging meal.

tDvXzlV2usIHG-MESAq5Qg.text: Love this place. There are a lot of great taco places to enjoy through out town and this is one to.put on your to do list. I've been with friends and also taken my boyfriend's teenagers. Good vibe for both crowds.

5ms6einH6tYMgz5iLU4m-w.text: Food was awesome. Queso is amazing. My tacos were awesome. Best was Bubba Kush. 10/10 recommend. My drinks were awesome, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

wXhxbf5Q9LJENQU_f40w6w.text: OK, caveat, San Diego is my second home so I've become really critical about my Mexican food. Condado is good when you're downtown during happy hour and you want your taco fix, but I wouldn't go out of my way otherwise. For happy hour, the tacos here are a good price and decent quality. Great portion sizes too; each taco is seriously hefty. (But way overpriced during normal hours. Save your meals here for happy hour.)The ability to customize your order is another plus, and I enjoyed getting to try a range of meats and toppings. The joy here is mostly in the novelty and the variety, though, and I found most offerings to be either blandly cooked or overwhelmingly saucy. Other notes: chips were awesome! Margs were somehow both way too sweet and watered down. Stick with the beer. Ambiance was lively and crowded, but well managed. Opt for outdoor seating so you can enjoy the downtown scene! Overall, I do see myself returning to Condado, but only for happy hour.

9gv-wVeJzjNi70uRLJMo3g.text: Super sweet atmosphere and nice prices for what you get! The bartender was super kind and helpful with first time suggestions. The original taco was fab and the bubba kush taco was great even though we had to substitut the pulled pork for brisket! Chips and salsa was $1.50 and gave awesome chips with two salsa. Big fan of the skinny skeleton drink as well as the Modelo-Marg combo!

Z8Ew9yAFT9YsyTQVPNW8Ww.text: Stopped in for brunch on the way to a play and the experience was great. Had queso and chips, tacos and a flight of margaritas. I could totally sit in front of the tv and eat their queso and chips all night. The tacos were good but then menu was a bit overwhelming since you have to build it yourself. Lots of options so they had something for everyone but I keep my tacos simple so it was too long for me. The tacos and queso were different menus so that was a bit confusing as well. The flight of margaritas was outstanding. Great taste and good value. Had blackberry, mango and strawberry. Very good and the BlackBerry was my favorite. The service was fast and friendly. The location is a bit small but we didn't have to wait for a table. We are certainly going back for the food and drinks this is a very nice place.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Queso and chips
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Margaritas

GaMcqLhxFUY9n7UL3PkLhQ.text: Excellent gluten free choices. A little hectic inside for my liking. Food is decent. Portions are VERY small. Chips and guacamole are delicious though.

rftGPuP8HP73qV19eM7jkw.text: The tacos were awesome and reasonably priced... but the real reason to go is a margarita! I had both banana and blackberry and they were exceptional.  I come down to Pittsburgh for work a couple of times a year and I will definitely be back here next

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

U-Y1o3tKiPzvU1hhjtGxfg.text: I originally went to Condado for happy hour but after being seated I became intrigued with the "made-to-order" taco menu they have along with pencils on the table. The margaritas were great, my friend and I split the pitcher which was enough for about 3 glasses each. There are plenty of taco options to keep everyone happy, I ordered a Lucy taco with chicken and a soft flour taco with tofu - the food came out quickly and hot. I was nervous to try the tofu as it can be really hard to cook but to my surprise it was fantastic! Lots of flavor. The chicken taco was good as well but nothing to write home about.

jsSr6SQ6Gawk9FE9S9X6pw.text: Excellent Decour and fast service. We love the way you can build your own tacos or have one of their selections that are premade for you. The guacamole and salsa is fantastic.

mmpKNGMdDK8-dw31CaDGvQ.text: Tacos were ok. Step above Taco Bell and they came out literally within 8 min of ordering. The tres amigos dip cane out in 5 so we didn't have a chance to enjoy our app before the tacos. Chips were great dips ok. The queso was fantastic but it was too soupy so it was messy to eat. Only thing worth going there for is the modelo Rita!.

YMtRmQRbMhBlpsIXGcEgpg.text: I ate at the one on Butler street. The tacos were delicious and our server couldn't have been nicer. Will definitely go back!

g_YMU0QR40TjdMRSIQWqNA.text: Bad atmosphere and worse food.  Kind of a bro-ie place.  If that's your jam, you'll love it.

DFSop5Elb556nE7i9ZWy1g.text: You can't go to a taco place on a Friday night and expect NOT to wait an hour for a table...and that's just what we did. When our text came in that our table was ready, the hostess looked at us like we were aliens and said there wasn't a table for us (even though we saw many empty ones). Off to a rocky start!! Once we made ourselves known three times we finally were seated.   I had been forewarned that there are MANY menus. I don't think I took my friends seriously enough. There was a drink menu, appetizer menu, pre-made taco menu, build your own taco menu, and I think one more. Our waitress did explain everything briefly, but we felt like we were left to our own demise. Thankfully, everyone in our group was ready to be adventurous and build tacos from the very yummy options.   We started with the blanco nacho cheese and corn salsa. YUM. I would go back just for the apps. We all built our own tacos and there wasn't a sad soul at the table. Everything was flavorful, hot, and delicious. Absolutely worth the wait and confusion. I will be going back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

za1ZIp8zCeNp7Te96B6Chw.text: We decided to try Condado with some friends.  Overall, we really enjoyed the experience.  The tacos are fresh and flavorful and they have a great selection of beers, tequila, etc.  The various dips offered for the chips were also very good and diverse.  My wife is Gluten Free and they were easily able to accommodate her needs.  Although they have many types of tacos (both pre-suggested combinations and build your own (kind of like Burgatory)), that is where the menu ends.  Tacos.  Nothing else.  In addition, the restaurant was packed and there was a 30 minute late.  Finally, beware that it is a young crowd.  We are in our early to mid-50s and we were old enough to be the parents of just about everyone in the place - patrons and employees.  It did not make a difference in the food, service, etc., but just letting readers know so that they know what to expect.

YS6my9eWMbaJmT0Hx5RKsQ.text: Best taco place in Pittsburgh. Real tacos. Not just fancy over priced tacos like all the other places.

oCqZJXxdm58glMBSOpx-Og.text: Don't let the three stars drive you away, this is almost always a perfectly nice place to go for a lunch if you work downtown.   I would recommend getting there early. Not that it always fills up, which sometimes it does, but it's best to get in before the servers get too busy. The difference between 11:30 and 12:00 can be night and day.   There are tons of options from type of shell, to none, to proteins and toppings and sauces and salsas.  And mostly they're perfectly fine. I don't think I've had a single thing here's that's wow'd me and made me order it over and over, but even the strangest combinations will not disappoint.   Also a word to the heat seekers out there, none of the ghost peppers stuff on the menu is very spicy.

8PTa6RWP-bPVpqi2EngAVA.text: Any time it's a build your own bar, it's usually a disaster for me but this build your own taco place worked in my favor.   Food: Started with the mango margarita and they definitely did not cheap out on the tequila. One drink was just right for me. We moved on to the Tuscan Guac which was probably the best I've had in a while and a great portion, with two people eating it we only got half way through.  I got the JuJu taco (soft and hard with queso in the middle) with pulled pork, slaw, beans, onions and salads. So good, I devoured it in seconds.   Service: we came here the night before and the wait was too long. They do give the option to text you when the table becomes available but we were too hungry to wait. Today we got lucky and got a two seater fairly fast despite the rush. Our waiter was enthusiastic me fast. I was surprised at how fast everything came out. I guess this is what happens when you specialize in one thing.   Atmosphere: Seems like everything around my hotel in Pittsburgh is just really loud. Found my self having to repeat myself twice when talking due to the loud talking and music. I wonder if it would have been any different upstairs.   If I lived here I'd def come here for my tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. JuJu Taco
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tuscan Guac
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Jalapeño and Mango Margarita

sycJY8J1bkQnK8D3OdPXXg.text: As Good As It Gets!  Great tacos?  Check Great craft beer selection? Check Margaritas? Didn't have one, but menu looked great Great Happy Hour? Check Atmosphere? Check Space?  Eh, not really, but that's totally fine if the above is great right?  If you are familiar with Burgatory or any restaurant that allows you to customize your burger by filling out a check list with a pencil, then this is the same concept, but for tacos.  You do however have the ability to just go with their menu of tacos created by their chefs without creating your own of course.    Overall 13 out of 5 stars.  Highly recommend.

B-I8Xqze6UW6vtO7pmQv4w.text: Not open late and address is wrong . I arrived before 1am and was told that the kitchen was closed by a rude waitress.

1I6gO2mEnQQcZ6EhcBZL0w.text: Condado is right where Tonic used to be when I was in Pittsburgh last year. I never went into Tonic so I can't tell you how good that was but I enjoyed Condado.  There were four menus but I only got water for the drink, so that cut the menus down to two. After looking at the create your own taco menu, I gave up and switched to the pre-designed taco menu. That turned out to be a good idea because one of the items on that menu was the Chronic Tortilla Fritos. (bowl of nachos) That was a very filling item for the price. I also tried the Bubba Kush, a pulled pork taco with an interesting flavor. I do like the idea of using a booklet of tear-off fill-in forms for the taco menu. In a noisy bar environment, this avoids the problem of an order getting misheard.  Service was pretty good despite the crowd. I sat at the bar for this meal and the bartender was quite responsive and made sure I had everything I needed. The problem is the dining area is a bit cramped and groups of people who hang around near the bar get in the way of servers and everyone else.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chronic Tortilla Fritos and Bubba Kush

2kH1vQ3U49KYmZvCTfl2Hg.text: This was one of the worst meals I've had in recent memory. The food was on par with Taco Bell, which maybe that's just what they're going for. Their guac looked store-bought with some pickled onions tossed on top. The brisket was flavorless and tasted as if the beef had been boiled. Of the three tacos I ordered, the only one I could stomach to finish was the El Tradicional, and even it wasn't good.

po_4gMUMTOMf9qxGP2NTlA.text: I love the tacos here. How can you complain when you get to build your own? Their ingredients are fresh and always tasty. Not to mention, this is one of the only places that you can get late night food in downtown Pittsburgh.  Also, I'm a huge fan of the bar. It closes at 2 am every night. They have a really good draft selection, as well as awesome tequilas. There is limited seating at the bar, as it's usually filled up.

8WbqRkeAyjgd0Qut753DJg.text: First things first, GET THE BRISKET, explanation below.   I'm a big fan of Condado. IMO, it's a mix between fast food tacos and gourmet tacos. There's a ton of great options. I like building my own tacos and adding as much as I'd like. I highly recommend the brisket, it's extremely flavorful and not dry.   Service is good, food comes out fast, and it's cheap compared to other tacos joints.

1I2Ge0BRUEecCDzuFy-PMQ.text: Once you understand (and get over) all the different menus, the food itself is really good! They have a build your own taco and also pre-built tacos. I recommend reviewing the pre-built for inspiration at a minimum. This place is always packed partially because it is near the convention center but generally you can get in for drinks after work without too much of a fuss.

vCyLv_p7sfVkFQuZb3CmTA.text: Well, full disclosure, I'm born and bred Californrnian. So Mexican food is a staple.  So I guess I shouldn't expect much in the way of authentic tacos in Pittsburgh.  The shells were cold.  Not hot, not even warm. Cold. Flavor was missing.  No spice at all.  The side of rice? Well, that was a tiny (like condiment size) cup of steamed white rice.  This was a Mexican joint, not Asian restaurant.   As for the service, well, that too was found lacking. Asked for a taste of a beer on tap and got literally a few drops, barely enough to cover the bottom of the tiny glass.  Beer was good though.  Waiter lack as much personality as the food lacked taste.   Two tacos, one beer, two spoons of white rice - $18.  No need to repeat.

VoXV5n_DFwqm_yDLtPRrpg.text: This is a build your own taco place. They have several kinds of shells, proteins, cheeses and toppings. They have a lot of vegan and/or vegetarian options including jackfruit. These are some of the best tacos I've ever had. The only negative is that the service is inconsistent. I've had both great and terrible experiences.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

mWLwYV9UZb3LXXAzq_s4Yw.text: For sure my new favorite taco spot downtown! We stopped in Sunday night around 1030 and the place was packed. Still, we got seated right away which was great and unexpected.   Our waiter came quickly and offered us drink menus. He suggested the blood orange and prickly pear, which we both tried. I thought the prickly pear was a little too sweet, and coming from me, that means the drink must've been really sweet. My boyfriend had the blood orange which I enjoyed more - it had a nice tang to it that balanced out the sweetness.  The queso though. I would go back for just the queso any day. We got the dirty queso which had black beans, chicken, and a smoky spicy sauce. It ranks up there in one of the best quesos I've had, and came with plenty of fresh chips too.   I opted to make my own tacos, and tried two of the special shells. The tacos were absolutely stuffed with toppings and sauces, all of which were free of charge! I really liked the chorizo and the shell with retried beans stood out too.   Definitely will be back to try more taco combinations and margaritas!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dirty queso
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Prickly pear margarita
Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My two custom tacos!

6u67PVlzro6j9r3UK1dXEg.text: LOVE these tacos. They are delicious and you get to build you own! To me, it' doesn't get much better than that. They are very filling and tasty. Would recommend to anyone looking for a cool place to try!

-_QPfPLmj84Cf1LOLjXYCA.text: havent been here in awhile n forgot how much i like this place...loose hipster vibe with an eclectic clientele  i love drinking out of a mason jar at a mexican restaurant...the queso with chorizo is fantastic and their fried chips (though erm..slightly unhealthy) r likewise great!  fresh taco ingredients- i had the juju (hard taco within soft) was also excellent  really not a complaint to b found- well i guess their draft list was almost empty? which does seem strange to me for a bar....

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. juju taco with pollo and fixings n queso with house made chorizo
